chest pain; Caller stated the patient had an EKG showing irregular heartbeat.; diarrhea; Myocarditis; fever; didn't feel well; warm; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (Patient's Parent). A 19-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot number: EW0187, NDC number and Expiration date are Unknown), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Left arm on 22May2021 11:30 (at the age of 19-years-old) as 2ND DOSE, SINGLE for covid-19 immunisation. The Patient's medical history (including any illness at time of vaccination) was none and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took first dose of historical vaccine, bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot number: EW0176, NDC number and Expiration date are Unknown) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Left arm on 01May2021 10:30 (at the age of 19-years-old) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Additional vaccines administered on same date of the pfizer suspect were none. The patient did not receive any other vaccinations within four weeks prior to the first administration date of the suspect vaccine. Adverse events following prior vaccinations were none. Family medical history relevant to adverse events was none. Relevant tests were unknown. It was reported that her 19-year-old son got the 2nd dose of the vaccine on 22May2021 and 2 days later on 24May2021, he wound up with chest pain and the caller took him to emergency room and the patient was diagnosed with myocarditis and admitted to the hospital. The Reporter clarified the patient's chest pain started when he woke up around 08:30-09:00. On an unspecified date in May2021 at 23:30, the patient had a fever starting about 12 hours from receiving the second dose and it lasted for 24 hours, and the patient didn't feel well on an unspecified date in May2021. At one point he didn't want to wake his parents up around 11:30 p.m. but he was warm on an unspecified date in May2021. At 0600am the next day, the caller took the patient's temperature, and his fever was 100.9 Fahrenheit. The caller carried the patient to the emergency room on 24May2021 due to his chest pain. It was reported that patient's EKG was extremely irregular and caller stated that if it was her or her husband's EKG, they would have been having an MI, but since the patient was only 19, the doctors didn't think MI was possible. The patient was then diagnosed with myocarditis. It was reported that the patient experienced diarrhea on 24May2021. Chest Pain required a visit to Emergency Room on 24May2021 and the patient was hospitalized from 24May2021 to 26May2021. It was reported that, the patient received treatment with Colchicine 0.6 mg (NDC number and Lot number: unknown, Expiration Date: 26may2022) one tablet by mouth twice a day. The patient came home from the hospital with this prescription on 26May2021 and he is still taking this medication. Prescribed to take it twice daily for a month. Famotidine, it is like a Pepcid. 20 mg (NDC number and Lot number: unknown, Expiration Date: 26Mayy2021) one tablet by mouth twice a day for 6 days, because of the heavy dose of ibuprofen and diarrhea. The patient had completed this medication. Ibuprofen 600 mg (NDC number, Lot number: unknown and Expiration Date: unknown) 1 tablet by mouth three times a day for six days and this has script had ended. Caller stated that her son was recovered but that he was still taking the treatment medications at this time. Caller stated that her son's symptoms are improved, he was not complaining of chest pain anymore, she assumes his myocarditis was improved because he was not complaining of the chest pain. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included body temperature: 100.9 Fahrenheit on an unspecified date in May2021, EKG (electrocardiogram): extremely irregular on 24May2021, PCR COVID test (sars-cov-2 test): negative on an unspecified date in May2021 while in the hospital. Caller stated the patient had an EKG showing irregular heartbeat.It was reported that the patient had tests but she didn't have results available and the patient had a PCR COVID test in the ER. Caller stated that all of this was related to the vaccine. Caller also stated that she is wondering if her son would have reacted differently if he had gotten the Moderna, but caller and her husband had gotten Pfizer and didn't have any problems. Reporter seriousness for Myocarditis, diarrhea and fever was unspecified. The outcome of the events, Myocarditis, chest pain, diarrhea and irregular heartbeat was recovering and for fever was recovered on an unspecified date in May2021 and for other events was recovered on an unspecified date in 2021. Additional information requested.
19 2021-06-08 fainting The patient was given the vaccination and told to wait 15 minutes in the recovery area to observe fo... Read more
Close
The patient was given the vaccination and told to wait 15 minutes in the recovery area to observe for signs of adverse reactions. The patient had syncope about 2 minutes after sitting and fell from a seated position on his chair to the ground. He had a brief seizure (unresponsive, tense muscles, open eyes) for about 2-5 seconds. He then became responsive and was able to respond to prompts and questions. He was given water. an ice pack (for injured spot on forehead), and told to wait for 30 minutes for further observation. He arranged to have a friend pick him up to take him home from the pharmacy and was told that he could not drive himself home after this adverse reaction. The patient stated that he otherwise felt normal afterwards (aside from some ache from the forehead after falling).
19 2021-06-09 chest pain difficulty breathing; chest pain; environmental pneumonia; low grade fever/ fever 104.3; chills/ chi... Read more
Close
difficulty breathing; chest pain; environmental pneumonia; low grade fever/ fever 104.3; chills/ chill were high; body ache; bumps that hurt on in front of his legs; erythema nodosum; hilar lymphadenopathy; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient himself). A 19-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, solution for injection; Batch/Lot Number: Unknown) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm, on 01Apr2021 at 11:15 (at the age of 19 years old) as 1st dose, single dose, for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included asthma. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine and no other medications received within 2 weeks of vaccination. On 06 to 08April2021 (as reported), the patient began with low grade fever, chills, body ache. Then on, 14Apr2021, the patient began to complain about chest pain went to the hospital. The patient was told that he had environmental pneumonia on right lung, and he was given with antibiotics. On 17Apr2021, the patient went to the emergency room as fever was 104.3 and chill were high, and he had difficulty breathing. The patient was admitted and transferred to a Hospital where he was given with antibiotics, azithromycin (ZITHROMAX) and intravenous fluids; he was discharge on 21Apr2021. Later that night, the patient noticed bumps that hurt on in front of his legs and went to the doctor. It was indicated that the patient had erythema nodosum and was prescribed with prednisone 2x a day for 5 days. The patient took an X-ray that showed he had hilar lymphadenopathy and will go see a pulmonary specialist. He was also told to take the 2nd dose of the vaccine; 2nd dose was taken on 28Apr2021. The patient underwent laboratory test for COVID-19 (nasal swab) on 12Apr2021, 15Apr2021 and 17Apr2021 which all showed negative results. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination and has not been tested for COVID-19 since the vaccination. The adverse events: erythema nodosum, hair lymphadenopathy and pain in leg have resulted to doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit; while for the other adverse events have resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit and emergency room/department or urgent care. The outcome of the events was not recovered.

Patient c/o neckache 6/10 and headache immediately upon waking. Vitals continued to be monitored frequently and BP continued to be 80's/40's. Blood sugar 76. EMS called and arrived. Patient's blood pressure increased to 130/80 for approximately 10 minutes and then dropped again to 78/45. Patient taken to local hospital for further evaluation accompanied by parents.

had to treat him with an ammonia thing to wake him up; could not see/lost vision at one time immediately afterwards; vision got all spotty; pupils got bigger than normal; Blue lips; white face; blood pressure really dropped; felt cold; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (father) reported for a son. A 19-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left upper arm in muscle on 07May2021 17:00 (Batch/Lot number was not reported) at age of 19-year-old as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. There was no medical history. No family medical history relevant to events. There were no concomitant medications. No additional vaccines administered on same date of the Pfizer Suspect. No prior vaccinations (within 4 weeks). On 07May2021, his vision got all spotty and he could not see, pupils got bigger than normal after the vaccine, had blue lips, white face, blood pressure really dropped, and he lost vision at one time immediately afterwards, and he felt cold. The time of onset of events was around 5pm. Events did not require a visit to emergency room or physician office. They stated they had given a thousand of this vaccine and this had never happened before. They stated they had never seen what happened to his son before. The patient did not get the second one yet and was told not to get it. All events happened a few minutes after the vaccine during the sitting/waiting period. About after 5 minutes the most after administration this all started and they had to treat him with an ammonia thing to wake him up. It's the one you break it under the nose and they were ready to do an Epi Pen also if needed. He improved within half an hour to 45 minutes of this. No other vaccines given that day or 4 weeks prior. No problems with vaccines in past. Mentioned they all in his family did the Covid vaccine. The patient improved and they advised him not to get the second one. It was Facility to tell them that. The pharmacist from there just gave them a call wanting to know why the son didn't return for the second dose and he explained what happened since this pharmacist did not know what happened that day. Patient did not see doctor or go to emergency room since his condition improved dramatically after about 45 minutes or so. Father kept asking patient how he felt or if there was need to see doctor and patient declined. The outcome of events was recovering. Information about lot/batch number has been requested.

Close
19-year-old male no past medical history brought in by father with complaint of shortness of breath, chest discomfort, palpitations, tachycardia x2 days. Symptoms began 1 day after vaccination. EKG revealed diffuse ST elevations, machine read as *ACUTE MI*. Patient was given 325 mg ASA, placed on O2, and transferred to ER via 911. Patient was hospitalized overnight for observation. Troponins were elevated at 13. Patient had full cardiology work-up and cath lab that did not reveal any arthrosclerosis or underlying heart disease. Diagnosed with myocarditis, discharged on metoprolol and aspirin. Has pending follow-up with cardiology, currently still with mild symptoms.

19 2021-06-22 troponin increased, chest pain On the morning of Sunday, June 6, 2021, I woke up with dull pain in the center of my chest (right wh... Read more
Close
On the morning of Sunday, June 6, 2021, I woke up with dull pain in the center of my chest (right where the sternum is). My mother took me to urgent care. A doctor there did an EKG with came back slightly abnormal, and she recommended I go to the emergency room. The doctors there ran a few tests. By about noon or so, my chest pain had subsided and has since not returned. My only abnormal test was troponin. After the first troponin test, I was transferred from the ER to an observation area. After the fourth troponin test, Dr. ordered an angiogram. The angiogram occurred on June 8, 2021, at around 5:00 pm or 6:00 pm. It revealed no signs of damage or inflammation. I was discharged from the hospital the morning of June 9, 2021. Since then, I had a follow-up with my primary care provider, on June 15, 2021, and with the Dr. on June 23, 2021. Neither of them detected anything wrong with my heart. To summarize, I went to the hospital with chest pain that subsided quickly and has not returned since, and I remained in the hospital with elevated troponin.

Close
Client received the 1st dose of the COVID vaccine (Pfizer Lot #EW0186 expiration date 07/12/2021) at 1309. At 1326, the client called EMT over and said "I'm having itching and something in my chest." PHN responded. The client stated, "I'm not having any trouble breathing or any swelling. When I breathe in, I feel something in my chest. It comes and goes. I have itching in my left palm but its already going away." Client was alert and oriented times four. EMT and PHN escorted the client to the zero gravity chair. Vital signs taken at 1329 (blood pressure 130/60, heart rate 83, oxygen 97%). At 1330, PHN offered the client Benadryl which he refused and stated, "I don't feel the itchiness anymore." Client stated, "I don't like needles. I was nervous about getting the vaccine." Client denies any medical conditions and allergies. The client is taking Zyrtec and prescription eye drops. At 1338, client stated, "I haven't felt the feeling in my chest since we moved over here." Vital signs taken at 1340 (blood pressure 132/78, heart rate 76, oxygen 96%). At 1345, the client stated, "my chest feels fine." Vital signs taken at 1351 (blood pressure 130/74, heart rate 82, oxygen 97%). PHN provided client with education on when to seek emergency services, and to follow up with his primary care provider. Client left unassisted with a steady gait at 1356.

19 2021-07-17 heart rate increased Uncontrolled, elevated heart rate before sleep; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable cons... Read more
Close
Uncontrolled, elevated heart rate before sleep; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 19-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: ER8733) via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 29Mar2021 at 09:45 (at the age of 19-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient's allergies were not reported. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient was not tested for COVID-19. The patient had not received any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. On 30Mar2021 at 23:30, after 1.5 days of vaccination, the patient experienced uncontrolled, elevated heart rate before sleep. The events did not result in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. No therapeutic measure was taken as a result of adverse event. The clinical outcome of the event was recovering at the time of this report. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

19 2021-07-21 fainting Patient received the 1st dose of the Pfizer Vaccine and experienced a syncopal event causing dizzine... Read more
Close
Patient received the 1st dose of the Pfizer Vaccine and experienced a syncopal event causing dizziness soon after receiving the vaccine. The pharmacist responded immediately and emergency medical services were contacted immediately. The patient was standing at the time symptoms began and dizziness caused the patient to fall over. The patient was guided to a chair and the pharmacist took the patients blood pressure which was approximately 90/60. The patient did not exhibit any signs of difficulty breathing and was alert after sitting down. The patient had a small cut on their left thigh from falling over. The pharmacist cleaned the cut and bandaged it then retook the patients blood pressure after about 5 minutes. At that time the patients blood pressure had returned to normal (approximately 125/70) and the patient was feeling fine. Emergency medical services arrived and the patient was able to walk outside to the ambulance. EMS retook the patients blood pressure again and the results were normal and consistent with the second reading taken by the pharmacist. The patient felt normal and did not require any additional emergency medical services at the time. The patient was contacted approximately 2 hours after the adverse event and still reported feeling fine and was being monitored by his parents at home. The patient was instructed to contact EMS should any symptoms occur after going home.
19 2021-07-21 fainting PATIENT EXPERIENCED SYNCOPE WHILE SITTING IN A WAITING AREA CHAIR, APPROXIMATELY 3-4 MINUTES AFTER R... Read more
Close
PATIENT EXPERIENCED SYNCOPE WHILE SITTING IN A WAITING AREA CHAIR, APPROXIMATELY 3-4 MINUTES AFTER RECEIVING VACCINE. THE PHARMACY STAFF RUSHED TO HIS ASSISTANCE, 911 WAS CALLED, AND STORE MANAGEMENT ASSISTED. HE WAS AWAKE A FEW SECONDS LATER AND DAZED. WE MONITORED THE PATIENT UNTIL PARAMEDICS ARRIVED. HE WAS IN GOOD SPIRITS AS HE LEFT WITH THE PARAMEDICS FOR FURTHER MEDICAL ASSISTANCE DUE TO A CUT ON HIS CHIN,ETC.
19 2021-07-21 fainting The Patient had just sat down in chair outside the pharmacy after receiving his first doe of the Pfi... Read more
Close
The Patient had just sat down in chair outside the pharmacy after receiving his first doe of the Pfizer Covid vaccine from the technician and he fainted and fell forward onto the floor. The technician who had gave the shot and I rushed out help him. He regained consciousness right away but he had bit his lip which made his lip bleed a little and the glasses gave him a small cut under his eye. We had him lay down for a few minutes afterward and cleaned and bandaged his small cut. His mom did mention afterward that he sometimes get dizzy when he has blood drawn. This was never stated on the patient questionnaire. The patient waited the required time after the vaccine and said he no longer felt dizzy and felt fine. We put notes on patient's file of the event and to walk him to his seat and observe him closely with his 2nd dose.

Close
headaches; fatigue; bruising all over body; undetectable platelets; Immune thrombocytopenia; petechiae; Arm pain at site; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer (patient). A 19-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), first dose, via an unspecified route of administration, administered in arm left on 28Apr2021 (Lot Number: ER8735) at the age of 19 years old, at single dose for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history was none. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. There were no concomitant medications. There was no other vaccine in four weeks or other medications in two weeks. The patient experienced arm pain at site in 2021, headaches in May2021, fatigue in May2021, bruising all over body in May2021, undetectable platelets in 2021, immune thrombocytopenia in 2021, petechiae in 2021. Arm pain at site, mid-May: headaches, fatigue, bruising all over body. Hospitalized with undetectable platelets and Immune thrombocytopenia and petechiae. The patient was hospitalized for all events for 3 days. All events resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care, Hospitalization, Life threatening illness (immediate risk of death from the event). The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included Nasal Swab: negative on 23Jun2021. The outcome of the all events was recovering. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The lot number for the vaccine, BNT162B2, was not provided and will be requested during follow up.
19 2021-07-27 palpitations, chest pain Got heart inflammation, probably pericarditis based on the symptoms though that is usually paired wi... Read more
Close
Got heart inflammation, probably pericarditis based on the symptoms though that is usually paired with myocarditis. Also had some heart palpitations and a much more noticeable heartbeat accompanied with chest pain. Symptoms started the morning after getting the vaccine. Fatigue for 1 day, mostly recovered by day 2, fully recovered from all symptoms by day 3. No fever. Going to assume the heart was affected because the injection was in the left arm (near the heart). Might have caused a higher density of cytokines to be near heart tissue and cause inflammation. Also I didn't go to a doctor because no insurance, figured I would rather take my chances with a heart attack. Cause I would be guaranteed to have a heart attack after seeing that medical bill.

The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Patient did not take any other vaccines within four weeks prior vaccination. On 26Apr2021, patient experienced arm pain. On 27Apr2021, patient experienced heart and lung feels weird, and has heart palpitations, never had asthma but it feels like asthma, little bit difficult catching his breath. The events did not result in emergency room and physician office visit. The outcome of the event arm pain was recovered on 28Apr2021 while other events were not recovered. 20-year-old male with a past medical history of vasovagal episodes, cerebral palsy, dorsal rhizotomy and VP shunt followed by neurology, taking no medications presents to the ED for evaluation of a first-time seizure which occurred 1 hour ago 10 minutes after receiving a Covid vaccine. Mother states that the patient receive the Covid vaccine around 11:15 AM and 10 minutes later he became very pale the e-stim to left lower and patient he had generalized body convulsions lasting less than 1 minute and turned very pale/cyanotic. When he stopped seizing mother states that he was slightly confused as to what had happened and continued to be pale. Patient is completely at baseline at this time answering questions appropriately, however he still complains of having dizziness with sitting up or standing. Patient is answering all questions appropriately. He denies any numbness or tingling. He states he generally feels slightly weak but there is no focal weakness. No headache, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, recent head trauma, abdominal pain, chest pain or palpitations.

20 2021-04-06 fainting, pallor, loss of consciousness Patient received vaccine around 1255 pm on 3/31. Upon standing after waiting the recommended 15 min... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine around 1255 pm on 3/31. Upon standing after waiting the recommended 15 minute observation period, patient became dizzy, lightheaded. Patient's symptoms proceeded leading to brief loss of consciousness and pallor consistent with syncope. Patient was gently aided to the floor at 110pm. The patient's mother was present and accompanied the patient. Patient was given general supportive care from pharmacy and team members consisting of feet elevation water, and head support. At no point did the patient nor his mother request for emergency services to be contacted. A witness had EMS on the phone during supportive care. Before being able to inform EMS not to dispatch, they had arrived around 115pm. EMS took over care upon arrival. Blood pressure reading per EMS was 102/56. Patient was transported to hospital at 1325.

20 2021-04-07 loss of consciousness Dose received at 6:05PM. Patient was seated in waiting area and around 6:10PM a loud noise was made ... Read more
Close
Dose received at 6:05PM. Patient was seated in waiting area and around 6:10PM a loud noise was made due to metal chairs moving in the waiting area; upon turning around patient was face down on the floor with his head turned to one side. I ran to offer assistance and cushioned his head with my hands. EMS was dispatched immediately. Patient was already starting to come to after losing consciousness for approximately 10-15 seconds, looked confused for about 15 seconds and then seemed to return to a normal mental state immediately after. He was able to give his name and info and knew exactly where he was, etc. and he stated he felt much better. He was able to confirm he hit the side of his head on the floor, however it was not bleeding. I asked if he wanted me to call anyone for him but refused the offer. His blood pressure was taken at 6:15PM by us then again when EMS arrived at approximately 6:20PM and was 140/100. He was checked out by EMS, including a blood glucose reading of 81 and seemed to be okay. They offered to take him via ambulance to the hospital, especially given him hitting his head, but he refused the offer. He explained a similar incident occurred when he received IV contrast dye in the past. He was able to sit up and then stand up without any issues. He continued to wait in the waiting area for about 10 more minutes before leaving to ensure he felt back to normal. I followed up with him at 8:20PM via telephone and he stated he was feeling normal and had no questions/concerns. I assured him he could reach back out to me personally or the store here if he had any questions/concerns in the future.

Close
Dizziness upon standing and walking, nausea, clamy and warm skin, sweaty, pale, tunnel vision, loss of acute memory, vision, and hearing. Patient was watched from 3pm (right after dose) to 3:30pm. He was feeling these symptoms from 3pm to about 3:15pm. He was given water after 5 minutes and cold wash rags to put on his forehead and neck. He was also told to breath deep breaths slowly. He said his throat felt sore and was provided with a throat lozenge. Color in his face returned after roughly 10 to 15 minutes and he verbally said he was feeling much better. Pharmacy associates watched him for another 15 minutes to make sure he was okay.

Close
20 y/o Male received Pfizer vaccine 1 dose at 1:45pm, while in the recovery area, @ 1:55 when standing to exit as his 15 minute wait period had completed, c/o dizziness, was assisted back to the chair by the recovery nurse, stated, "I don't feel right", noted to have a staring gaze, speech slow but responsive, diaphoretic, initial vitals 1:56: 109/87, 89,20, stat 99% on RA, skin color pale. Repeat vitals @ 1:58 : 122/80, 104, stats 94, awake, very slow responsively, continued w/staring gaze, 911 called. Arrived at 14:03, Engine #2 arrived, patient evaluated, vitals stable @ 116/79, HR 75-78, Resp: 16-20, BG 136, EKG WNL, AAOX4, Patient declined transportation to ED, AMR cancelled, remained in recovery for add'l 15 minutes for ongoing monitoring, DC vitals @ 2:19pm: 11/78, 68, sats 97% on RA, exited from recovery w/Father, stable, ambulating freely, in no further acute distress.

20 2021-04-19 loss of consciousness, fainting After administering vaccine, patient stated he was very anxious - has a history of needle phobia. H... Read more
Close
After administering vaccine, patient stated he was very anxious - has a history of needle phobia. He then stated he was going to faint and I assisted him to the floor. He temporarily lost consciousness ( less than 20 seconds). He appeared diaphoretic. He regained consciousness and appropriately responded to my inquiries. I assisted him to a chair where he sat for 3 - 4 minutes then said he was feeling better and wanted to leave. His mother was in the waiting room and took custody. She confirmed she was present due to this happening before.
20 2021-04-19 loss of consciousness Student passed out sitting in chair a few minutes after receiving the vaccine. This was witnessed an... Read more
Close
Student passed out sitting in chair a few minutes after receiving the vaccine. This was witnessed and medical care was at student side immediately. SPO2-94% HR-80. 2:41p Student opened eyes spoke then passed out again while in chair. Student was lowered to ground x3 assist and legs elevated on chair BP-120/78, SpO2-96%, HR-57 cold and diaphoretic. 2:48p BP-100/72, HR-80, SpO2-99% student alert and talking legs repositioned on floor without issues. 3p assisted to standing position x2 assist then to chair. 3:10p ambulated with standby assist without issues. Vitals checked every 5-10 mins and remained stable. Student admitted to having similar episode in Summer 2019 with blood draw. Student had little to drink and nothing to eat this day. 3:15p Student?s roommate arrived to walk home with student. Encourage student to eat and drink plenty of fluids for remaining day and ensure that he eats and drinks fluids prior to 2nd vaccine dose. 3:30p Student was cleared by PA to leave at his convenience.

20 2021-04-19 pallor, loss of consciousness After IM injection pt became pale, diaphoretic and reported feeling dizzy. Pt was assisted from chai... Read more
Close
After IM injection pt became pale, diaphoretic and reported feeling dizzy. Pt was assisted from chair to floor to lay down and during transfer had positive LOC which resolved in less than 5 seconds. BLEs were elevated on a chair and VS were as follows: BP 86/55, HR 80. Pt was given water, snacks and cold compress was applied to forehead. After 5 mins pt was assisted to seated position and VS were as follows: BP 107/75, HR 85. Pt recovered within 10 mins and ambulated out of clinic in NAD. Was escorted to car by staff and was driven home by a friend.
20 2021-04-19 fainting Patient was given dose 1 of the vaccine and instructed to wait at least 15 minutes in the chairs in ... Read more
Close
Patient was given dose 1 of the vaccine and instructed to wait at least 15 minutes in the chairs in front of the RPH for observation. He waived at us and sat down. We asked if he was ok and he waived again stating he didn't feel well. He sat back down and we proceeded to check on him. As we were coming to check on him, he fainted and fell face forward on to the floor. We called 911 and rolled him gently to his back. He had a laceration above his eye from the fall. EMT came and assessed the patient. After observation, he was allowed to be picked up from his friend and taken to a clinic for stitches.

20 2021-04-27 fainting, loss of consciousness Patient was administered Pfizer vaccine and immediately had a Vasovagal syncope event. Patient fell... Read more
Close
Patient was administered Pfizer vaccine and immediately had a Vasovagal syncope event. Patient fell from a standing position and impacted head to floor. Patient regained conscious within 10sec, able to speak full clear sentences, A&Ox4, denied any pain, no gross deformity, bruising, or trauma noted. EMS notified and ambulance arrived to transport patient to ED for further evaluation. ED physician evaluated patient, performed EKG and Lab work and released patient to full care at home. Vital Signs following return to consciousness: BP: 110/80 HR: 80 RR: 16 on room air Due to the head impact and concern for greater evaluation. EMS Fire was notified. EMS arrived at 0910, assessed patient and agreed with determination for no cervical or lumbar pain. EMS allowed patient to ambulate to ambulance. Patient did not receive any medication during event and syncope resolved spontaneously.
20 2021-04-29 inflammation of the heart muscle, chest pain, fluid around the heart, troponin increased, ejection fraction decreased 1 day after the 2nd shot in the Pfizer COVID vaccine series he began to develop substernal pressure ... Read more
Close
1 day after the 2nd shot in the Pfizer COVID vaccine series he began to develop substernal pressure like chest pain . Patient was admitted into the hospital for 2 days (4/27-4/29) for this substernal chest pain. A CTPE, EKG, and CXR were ordered that were unrevealing as to the etiology of the chest pain. Troponins were elevated on admission with a slightly decreased delta (515->479). An ECHO was ordered that showed a LVEF of 35-40% with moderate global hypokinesis of the left ventricle, right ventricles moderately dilated, and no pericardial effusion. A Cardiac MRI was then ordered to determine etiology that showed subepicardial late gadolinium enhancement of the basal inferior and mid-inferior and inferoseptal wall consistent with acute myocarditis. Additionally, a small pericardial effusion without signs of inflammation, calcification, or cardiac tamponade physiology. Patient was then D/C on 4/29 after the cardiac MRI with no medical therapy with the recommendation to not partake in physical activity for one month. Will have follow up with cardiology clinic in 1 month and will participate in cardiac rehab.
20 2021-04-29 pallor, fainting Patient experienced syncope/fainting episode approx 15 mins after vaccination. Patient stood from ch... Read more
Close
Patient experienced syncope/fainting episode approx 15 mins after vaccination. Patient stood from chair and complained of nausea, asked for water. Legs buckled, patient fell to knees. Did not fall all the way to floor or experience head/body trauma. Patient was attended to by supervising pharmacist, and subsequently moved into chair with assistance. Pulse and respirations were normal, but patient was pale, diaphoretic, and complained of nausea and dizziness for another 15-20 minutes. No epinephrine or diphenhydramine was indicated or administered. Patient was observed until approximately 8:30pm, at which time he had made a full recovery. Patient left under his own power, and safely travelled to his home. Pharmacist called to check on patient and spoke with him twice (4/29, 9:50pm...4/30, 4:30pm). Patient reports feeling fine, no residual effects. Is eager to receive his second dose on 5/20/21.
20 2021-04-30 stroke Initial presentation Patient was in his usual state of good health until 4/19 when he received his f... Read more
Close
Initial presentation Patient was in his usual state of good health until 4/19 when he received his first dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine. Two hours after the injection he became nauseous and vomited multiple times. Overnight he experienced diffuse myalgia and suprapubic pain. He awoke the next day to a pustular rash on his chin, forehead, chest and back. The patient describes similar previous rashes that have resolved spontaneously. The next day he began to experience gross hematuria and presented to the ED with a temperature of 98.9, blood pressure of 100/69mmHg, heart rate of 110bpm, respiratory rate of 18 breaths per minute and an O2 saturation of 97% on room air. On examination, patient was ill-appearing with diffuse pustules on his face, chest and back, periorbital edema, and leukoplakia of the tongue and buccal mucosa. His abdomen was soft and tender to palpation in the suprapubic area and at both costovertebral angles. Hospital course In the ED the patient was found to have a metabolic acidosis of pH 7.33 with an anion gap of 16, lactate 2.6, neutrophilic leukocytosis (22k), acute renal insufficiency with a BUN of 45 and creatinine 3.81 (baseline is 0.76). The patient?s urine demonstrated packed RBCs and 5-10 WBCs. He was admitted to the medicine service for further management. On the medicine floor he was initially found to have rhabdomyolysis (CK 584), worsening renal failure (Creatinine 8), follicular conjunctivitis by skin biopsy, a low CD3/CD4 count (CD4 91, CD3 47, CD8 258) with normal complement, and bilateral tinnitus. CT A/P without contrast showed increased attenuation of renal pelves and ureters consistent with hemorrhage, but no renal stones or hydronephrosis was seen. The patient was treated with pulse dose 500mg IV Methylprednisilone for 3 days and then transitioned to 60mg Prednisone. The patient?s pustular rash and oral leukoplakia greatly improved while on pulse dose steroids, but his kidney function continued to decline (Creatinine rising from 8 to 11), and the patient?s bilateral tinnitus progressed to bilateral sensorineural deafness over 2 days. Bilateral hearing loss prompted an MRI of the brain which identified several punctate infarcts across multiple vascular territories in bilateral cortices and left cerebellum. The patient?s kidney function has continued to decline, with progressive hyperkalemia and hemodialysis was begun.

Close
04/29/2021 5:30pm - chills, pins & needles, soreness 8:00pm - 100.8 degree fever, chills, soreness, joint pain; two 200mg ibuprofen tablets take & cold wet towel placed on forehead 9:30pm - 101.2 degree fever, chills, soreness, joint pain 11pm - trouble sleeping, confusion, chills, soreness 04/30/2021 1:00am - fever, chills, soreness; two 200mg ibuprofen tablets take & cold wet towel placed on forehead 7:00am- 98.0 degree temperature, soreness, slight joint pain; one 200mg ibuprofen tablet taken 11:30am~5:00pm - slight occasional chest pain (around sternum) 7:00pm - soreness in arm only, headache

20 2021-05-02 lightheadedness At 6 minutes post vaccine, while in the observation area, patient had a vasovagal episode. He fell t... Read more
Close
At 6 minutes post vaccine, while in the observation area, patient had a vasovagal episode. He fell to the ground from the observation chair and immediately came to. Patient has small abrasion under right eye, some right shoulder pain. Prior to vaccination, patient disclosed fear of needles. Patient arrived around 2:30p initially, vaccinator prepared him to be vaccinated laying down on cot. Patient was nervous and decided to reschedule. Patient returned at 4pm and decided to receive vaccine. Patient did not want to be vaccinated laying down. Patient refused EMS and refused to be evaluated by physician in Emergency Department and stated he would follow up with his physician. Patient observed for extended period and released.

20 2021-05-03 troponin increased, inflammation of the pericardium, chest pain chest pain; elevated troponin; EKG changes in the setting of pericarditis.; This is a spontaneous re... Read more
Close
chest pain; elevated troponin; EKG changes in the setting of pericarditis.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. A 20-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration on 09Apr2021 (at age of 20 years old, Batch/Lot number was not reported) as single dose for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included crohn's disease and cerebral palsy. No Known allergies. Concomitant medications included mesalamine; macrogol 3350 (MIRALAX). The patient previous took the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection) on an unknown date (lot number not reported, at a single dose for covid-19 immunization. The patient not had covid prior vaccination also not tested post vaccination. The patient experienced chest pain, elevated troponin, and EKG changes in the setting of pericarditis on 10Apr2021. AE resulted in: Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care, Hospitalization (2 days). Treatment received included Colchicine. The outcome of the event was recovering. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.
20 2021-05-04 loss of consciousness loss of conscientiousness; patient as he was falling; This is a spontaneous report from a contactabl... Read more
Close
loss of conscientiousness; patient as he was falling; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other health professional (HCP). A 20-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 intramuscular, administered in Arm Left on 15Apr2021 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0164) as single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. On 15Apr2021, the patient was brought to emergency department (ED) immediately after vaccination. The patient had two minutes of loss of conscientiousness. As per his father who caught the patient as he was falling. The patient did not hit his head and the patient was stable. The patient did not receive treatment for the events. The outcome of the events was recovered on an unspecified date. It was unknown if the patient had COVID prior to vaccination and was unknown if tested for COVID post vaccination.; Sender's Comments: Based on the information currently available, a possible contribution of the suspect drug administration to the reported event cannot be excluded, due to a plausible temporal relationship. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to Regulatory Authorities, Ethics Committees and Investigators, as appropriate.

Pt arrived to clinic for Covid-19 Vaccine, first dose. No hx of allergies to food, medicine, or vaccine. Hx of anxiety, no history medication management for anxiety. Vaccine administered at approximately 1:20pm, pt advised to remain in clinic for routine monitoring for 15 min. RN reports pt appeared anxious prior to vaccine. 1:45 Pt denied signs and symptoms of allergic reaction after receiving Covid vaccine, and was allowed to exit clinic area. Pt left with steady gait, no distress reported. 1:49 Pt returned to clinic, c/o throat and tongue feeling warm, pt appeared anxious and pale. PT placed in seated position RN at pt side. 1:50 J. Staff at pts side. Vitals BP 170/110, HR 121, RR 26, 98% o2. EMS called by RN. Epi pen ready at pts side, no Epi administered at this time. 1:52 Pt continues to present pale, small cough noted, pt denies swelling to throat, reports warm sensation to tongue and throat, ?My tongue and throat feel different.? Noted redness to outer sclera bilaterally. Speech clear. Sat 98% HR 117 2:10 Vitals: BP 180/100, HR 130, RR 26, 98%, pt pale, speech clear, pt remains alert and oriented. 2:13-EMS arrived, report given to EMS by Pharm, pt remains alert but pale, PT left clinic via gurney with EMS.

Patient was very nervous prior to administration. After receiving the vaccination, pt walked back to his waiting area, then asked for assistance. He lost consciousness for a few seconds and briefly convulsed/arms contractured up. This lasted less than 20 seconds in total but he was slow to fully regain awarenesss/consciousness. This returned over the course of 1-2 minutes. EMS was called and responded. They spoke with the patient but by this time he had consumed 8-16oz liquid, eaten a snack, and was fully aware and alert.

20 2021-05-11 pallor 20 y/o male with no past medical history that presents with diaphoresis and paleness post vaccinatio... Read more
Close
20 y/o male with no past medical history that presents with diaphoresis and paleness post vaccination administration. Patient states that this is his 1st dose in the two-dose series. Patient denies headache, sore throat, difficulty breathing, shortness of breath, rash or itch. NP and Paramedics at patient side. Patient was taken to the partitioned area and placed in Trendelenburg. Patient was provided a protein bar and a bottle of water. Patient initially hypotensive (prior to Trendelenburg) but all other vitals normal (73/44 BP, 99% RA, 84 Pulse, 14 Resp). Glucose was attempted but monitor not working. Patient observed closely by the NP and the Paramedic. Patient was no longer diaphoretic or pale, patient stated that he was feeling better after resting and eating. Patient vitals normal prior to being discharged home (124/81 BP, 99% RA, 85 HR and Resp 12). Patient was able to ambulate without difficulty and no longer symptomatic.

Mild myocarditis; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 20-year-old male patient received bnt162b2, via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 27Apr2021 12:30 (Lot Number: EW0170) at unknown dosage #, single for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient experienced mild myocarditis minutes after the second shot (on 27Apr2021 12:45) with outcome of not recovered. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. Additional information has been requested.

20 2021-05-14 blood pressure fluctuation, loss of consciousness, pallor pt had been give the immunization and asked to wait in the waiting area, about 5 minutes later his s... Read more
Close
pt had been give the immunization and asked to wait in the waiting area, about 5 minutes later his sister yelled that they needed help. he had said he felt faint and then passed out falling to the side and out of the chair, she states that she saw him "seize" when he hit the ground, but stated that he did not hit his head. When I came upon him his eyes were open and he was able to answer questions. he stated that he did not have any problems breathing, but felt dizzy. He was very clammy so we took his bp and it was 142/65 pulse 64, gave him an ice pack and had him stay laying down. He sat up after awhile and took a few sips of water but started to feel light headed again so we had him lay back down. His bp went down to 105/58 pulse 61, but then came back up to 136/81 pulse 75 as he was starting to feel better. He started to get more color in his face and feel less clammy so I stayed sitting up. We put him in a chair eventually and the EMTs arrived shortly later. They did and evaluation, but as they were talking about whether or not to take him to the hospital he passed out again. The EMTs said he was probably having some anxiety to needles. He then said that he had passed out giving blood once. They took him to the hospital for further evaluation.

I got out of my truck and collapsed; I had a grand mal seizure, seizing for 5 plus minutes; Slammed my head repeatedly on the concrete during the seizure leaving my head bleeding and cuts all over me.; Slammed my head repeatedly on the concrete during the seizure leaving my head bleeding and cuts all over me.; I leaned forward slamming on the gas colliding with another vehicle.; I don't remember starting my vehicle; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 20-year-old male patient received his first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot Number: EP7533), via an unspecified route of administration at the age of 20-year-old at arm left on 21Apr2021 22:30 at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history included epilepsy, haven't had a seizure until now for 2 years. Prior to vaccination, the patient wasn't diagnosed with COVID-19. Concomitant medications included Men's Multivitamin GNC and fish oil received within 2 weeks of vaccination. Patient didn't receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. The was leaving he apartment complex to go to school after work around 7am 23Apr2021, the patient didn't remember starting he vehicle, but he leaned forward slamming on the gas colliding with another vehicle. he got out of his truck and collapsed, he had a grand mal seizure, seizing for 5 plus minutes, having to go to the emergency room, he slammed his head repeatedly on the concrete during the seizure leaving his head bleeding and cuts all over he. He was now unable to drive for 6 months and need to get an MRI an EEG and be put on medication. Adverse events resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care, Hospitalization. The patient was hospitalized for one day for events. Facility where the most recent COVID-19 vaccine was administered in workplace clinic. Since the vaccination, the patient hasn't been tested for COVID-19. The patient was received treatment for all events. The outcome of events was unknown. Follow-up attempts are needed. Further information is expected.

20 YO patient with no significant PMH who presents with headache, back pain, and chest pain. He received 2nd Pfizer COVID19 vaccine dose 5/8/21. Later that day he felt very tired. On 5/9/21, he developed a headache that worsened throughout the day, was felt over whole head, but more painful in temporal areas, and he became nauseous. On 5/11/21, he developed back and chest pain and had 2 episodes of NBNB emesis. The chest pain is sharp, located over the whole chest and extends to axillae. The back pain is worse in the right shoulder. The back and chest pain are worse with inspiration, movement, and supination. CMR confirmed myopericarditis. Patient treated with colchicine and NSAIDs and IVF, has cardiology f/u on
20 2021-05-16 loss of consciousness Approximately three to four minutes after the second dose, he reported feeling dizzy. A few seconds ... Read more
Close
Approximately three to four minutes after the second dose, he reported feeling dizzy. A few seconds later he lost consciousness with eyes rolled to the back of his head. He was unresponsive to verbal communication or attempts to shake him awake. He then began grunting and struggling for breath. His body began to shake/convulse and he lost control of his bladder. This lasted about five to ten seconds. He regained consciousness and reported that he felt as if he was "dreaming". He also reported feeling very hot, and had sweat dripping down his face. Paramedics were called to the scene where his vital signs were checked. All signs including temperature were normal. His first dose on /26/21 had an almost exact reaction, minus losing control of bladder, although that time nobody was around to assist him.

20 2021-05-17 loss of consciousness, pallor After the vaccination, there was no chair in pharmacy so that he could sit and wait the 15 minutes i... Read more
Close
After the vaccination, there was no chair in pharmacy so that he could sit and wait the 15 minutes inside the place, so we had to go to the car to wait the 15 minutes, that was when the person began to feel very cold and lost consciousness for about 2 minutes. His head fell and also his upper limbs stiffened with twisted hands as if it were a convulsion, as if it were a tonic phase. His skin turned white and he didn't react. I put alcohol gel all over his face and body, then he began to react, little by little his body color returned but he does not remember anything that happened in those minutes.
20 2021-05-18 inflammation of the heart muscle, troponin increased, chest discomfort, chest pain, ejection fraction decreased Patient presented with substernal pressure like chest pain within 1 day of his second Pfizer vaccine... Read more
Close
Patient presented with substernal pressure like chest pain within 1 day of his second Pfizer vaccine associated with fatigue and dyspnea on exertion. He was found to have markedly elevated troponins without EKG changes. He was admitted to the hospital for evaluation and monitoring where cardiac MRI showed myocardial infllammation consistent with myocarditis. There was no other apparent cause based on patient's history. He was found to have a reduced ejection fraction on echocardiogram as a result of his myocarditis. He continued to have dyspnea on exertion at discharge.

20 2021-05-21 chest discomfort Overactive thyroid; Shortness of breath; Chest tightness; Fever; Fatigue; Anxiety; Panic; This is a ... Read more
Close
Overactive thyroid; Shortness of breath; Chest tightness; Fever; Fatigue; Anxiety; Panic; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 20-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Lot Number: EW0151), via an unspecified route of administration in left arm, on 15Apr2021, as second dose, single, for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history included asthma and allergies to tree nuts and penicillin. The patient's concomitant medications included fluticasone propionate (FLOVENT), salbutamol sulfate (ALBUTEROL), and an unspecified multivitamin. The patient previously took montelukast sodium (SINGULAIR) and bacitracin/ neomycin sulfate/ polymyxin B sulfate (TRIPLE ANTIBIOTIC Ointment) and experienced allergies to both; and the first dose of BNT162B2 (Lot Number: ER8727) on 19Mar2021 at the age of 20 years for COVID-19 immunization (right arm). The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior vaccination. No other vaccine was administered in four weeks. On 15Apr2021, the patient experienced initial anxiety or panic after shot was given. On 16Apr2021 (next day), the patient had fever and fatigue. The second day after (17Apr2021), the patient had shortness of breath and chest tightness. After several trips to the emergency room, the primary care physician (PCP) did laboratory tests that diagnosed an overactive thyroid (17Apr2021). Symptoms still remain and are being treated by an endocrinologist. Treatments included methimazole, lorazepam (ATIVAN), and diltiazem. The adverse events resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office or clinic visit and emergency room or department or urgent care. The patient has not been tested for COVID-19 post vaccination. The patient had not recovered from the events.

HE RECEIVED HIS VACCINE, SAT DOWN AS INSTRUCTED AND WITHING FEW MINS, PASSED OUT AND FELL FACE DOWN ON THE GROUND UNCONSCIOUS FOR A FEW SECS. HE WAS ATTENDED TO IMMEDIATELY BY THE RPH ON DUTY. 20 2021-05-22 palpitations, cardiac arrhythmia, ejection fraction decreased, inflammation of the heart muscle, chest pain Experienced mild chest pain two days after vaccination. Visited the ER, and was Hospitalized due to ... Read more
Close
Experienced mild chest pain two days after vaccination. Visited the ER, and was Hospitalized due to a decreased ejection fraction and elevated cardiac enzymes. My ejection fraction returned to normal the following day, and I showed a decrease in cardiac enzymes. The pain also subsided about 36hrs after starting. I remained at hospital for a few days to have a cardiac MRI which showed patchy myocarditis. I was discharged that day, and have been taking metoprolol and avoiding physical exertion. Later, on May 13th I returned to the ER due to an increase in heart palpitations. They turned out to be PVC, which is generally harmless, but I began taking a potassium supplement since my levels were low. I've been taking it easy since. Currently, I am expected to avoid exercise and exertion for six months, but am waiting for a follow-up to get more details.

He was partially caught by RPH and nurse immediately attended to him. The patient woke immediately and said he could breathe easily and slowly sat up. Close
Patient developed pleuritic chest pain. Presented to ER and had CT angiogram to eval for pulmonary embolism. Unfortunately, study was suboptimal but showed possible subsegmental PE vs mixing defect and consolidation in lingula consistent with pneumonia vs pulmonary infarct from PE. Scan initially read as more likely pneumonia but patient without consistent symptoms and re-read as concerning for pulmonary embolism. Patient otherwise healthy without other risk factors for PE. Repeat CTA 2 weeks later with better quality without e/o PE and improving but not resolved opacity in lingula. LE dopplers 3 wks after onset w/o DVT. Hypercoaguable labs pending.

20 2021-05-26 hypotension ~10 seconds after administering the shot into the left deltoid, patient's eyes started to roll back,... Read more
Close
~10 seconds after administering the shot into the left deltoid, patient's eyes started to roll back, became unresponsive, and started falling back in the chair. This lasted for ~15 seconds. After this, the patient immediately regained consciousness, had no issues breathing, and was able to talk. Patient reported light-headed. 911 was called immediately upon reaction, first responders came in and took patient's BP and glucose. Glucose 91 mg/dL, BP was low (forget exact value), but returned to normal (~117/80) after about 10 minutes. Patient seemed fully conscious and aware, opted to not go to the hospital and signed a declination form of transport. First responders deemed that the patient was aware and did not necessarily need transport to the ER. Patient requested a ride home from friend/family member and is going home to rest.

20 2021-06-07 heart attack, chest pain pain; heart attack; couldn't talk, the pain was so hard; pain in his left arm; Indigestion; chest pa... Read more
Close
pain; heart attack; couldn't talk, the pain was so hard; pain in his left arm; Indigestion; chest pain; small temperature that was one degree higher than before; wiped out tired-extremely exhausted and tired; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's mother). A 20-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine, lot number and expiry date unknown), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in right arm on 13May2021 at 11:00 as a single dose for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient is very strict on his health. The patient is a vegetarian, he is very health conscious. The patient did not receive any other vaccinations within four weeks prior to the first administration of the COVID vaccine. The patient previously received the first dose of bnt162b2 on Apr2021 for COVID-19 immunization and experienced tenderness at the shot site and was very tired. On the morning of 14May2021, the patient had a small temperature that was one degree higher than before and the patient was wiped out tired-extremely exhausted and tired. Then the patient started experiencing chest pain within days of the second dose. The patient woke up on 15May2021 with chest pain that was persistent through 18May2021. On 19May2021, the chest pain got worse. The reporter thought the patient had indigestion so she gave the patient Tylenol, Pepcid, and clear soda and the patient felt a little better. On 20May2021, the patient was clutching his chest and had pain in his left arm. The patient couldn't talk, the pain was so hard. The patient went to the emergency room at 12:00 and the healthcare team said that the patient was experiencing a heart attack (reported time of heart attack was 10:00). The patient was not admitted to the hospital. They said the chemical that the large muscle in the heart makes, it was elevated which was how they determined it was a heart attack. These lab numbers were drawn every three hours and they came down but never went away. The patient had two Troponin draws and they were both elevated. They also did an EKG on the patient which showed a heart attack. The patient was told to see a cardiologist and was sent home. The reporter is watching the patient and the patient is still in a little bit of pain but not as much. The patient went to his primary care provider on the day of the report and the doctor doesn't see this as a displaced issue. The doctor does not know what would cause this in the heart. The patient is to see the cardiologist on Tuesday, 25May2021. The reporter is unsure if this is related to the vaccine but it was almost a week after the patient's second dose. The outcome of the event small temperature that was one degree higher than before was recovering and the outcome of the event wiped out tired-extremely exhausted and tired was not recovered. The outcome of the other events was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested

Close
On Friday patient woke up with severe chest pain. He had to be taken to the emergency room. His troponin levels were above 1300 which indicated a heart attack so they admitted him to the hospital overnight. However, the blood work indicated an infection and Ibuprofen was the only medicine that helped with the pain. While at the hospital a series of tests were done to find out what was going on. Once the patient was stable enough he left the hospital and he is now undergoing more tests and getting his medical records transferred to the doctors here. We are still in the process of finding out the exact issue and will hopefully get some answers soon.
20 2021-06-10 troponin increased, chest pain, inflammation of the heart muscle 3 days after vaccination had acute onset of burning chest pain, worse with lying down and deep inspi... Read more
Close
3 days after vaccination had acute onset of burning chest pain, worse with lying down and deep inspiration. Initial EKG was normal but then developed ST changes. Presented to ED where troponin was elevated to 6259, peaked at 7595. MRI in hospital was consistent with myopericarditis. Discharged 6/11/21 on cochicine.

Close

20 2021-06-16 chest discomfort, chest pain, troponin increased, inflammation of the heart muscle started on 6/16, 36 hours ago, chest pain, chest pressure, myocarditis, elevated troponin
20 2021-06-16 chest pain neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depression; neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depr... Read more
Close
neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depression; neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depression; flu like symptoms; fevers; chills; diarrhea; chest pain; shakiness; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable The reporter. This The reporter reported for a 20-year-old male patient (Reporter's son) via medical information team. A 20-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection, Lot Number: Unknown), via an unspecified route of administration on 14May2021 (20-year-old at the time of vaccination) as 1st dose, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included illness from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. He has been to the doctor for sick visits 20 times in 20 years. The reporter also stated that there are no mental health issues noted in their family history. The reporter also stated that the patient was overall healthy with no significant medical history in the past. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The reporter reported that patient received the first dose of the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine on Saturday and by Monday was having flu like symptoms, fevers, chills, diarrhoea, chest pain, shakiness, as well as other neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depression. He has been to the doctor for sick visits 20 times in 20 years. After receiving the COVID 19 vaccines, the patient has been seen by the doctor 3 times in one week. The patient's side effects have lasted 3-4 weeks. The reporter would like to know commonly reported side effects of the vaccine and their duration. The reporter would like to know the efficacy of only one dose of the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine as the patient was hesitant to get the 2nd dose due to the side effects noted from the 1st vaccine. The reporter was advised per "attached" dose for efficacy after one dose. The reporter was not satisfied with this data and wanted to know more about what she had been read about online. The reporter was advised caller agent as could do some more research and contact her back with possible additional data which caller agreed to doing. Upon call back on 14Jun2021, advised caller per (website "PRIVACY") from 10Dec2020. The cumulative incidence of COVID-19 cases over time among placebo and vaccine recipients began to diverge by 12 days after the first dose, and 52.4% vaccine efficacy (95% confidence interval: 29.5, 68.4) was observed between dose 1 and dose 2, indicating the early onset of a partially protective effect of immunization. Two doses of vaccine provide the maximum protection observed. Ten cases of severe COVID-19 were observed with onset after the first dose. Nine cases occurred among placebo recipients and one among BNT162b2 recipients. The reporter would like to know dosing interval between shot one and two. Patient had their 1st dose on 14May2021 and has not received the 2nd dose yet due to side effects from what they felt was caused by the 1st dose of Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine. The reporter received response as "you should not get the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine if you had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of the vaccine or if you had a severe allergic reaction to any ingredient of the vaccine. The decision to receive the second dose for any other reason cannot be made by Pfizer. We refer you to speak to your healthcare provider about the risks of the vaccine compared to the risks of potentially not being fully protected against COVID-19 infection. Your healthcare provider knows your health situation and has access to information that can better help inform this decision". The reporter wanted to know should the patient get the 2nd dose of the Pfizer COVID 19 vaccine after the reported side effects of flu like symptoms, fevers, chills, diarrhoea, chest pain, shakiness, as well as other neurological symptoms such as anxiety and depression. The reporter received response as do not administer Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine to individuals with known history of a severe allergic reaction (e.g., anaphylaxis) to any component of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine. The outcome of the events was resolved in 2021 Follow-up attempts are needed. Information about lot/batch number has been requested

20 2021-06-20 chest pain For 2 days he had arm pain and hot flashes. Day 3 he felt better but had some arm cramping. 84 hours... Read more
Close
For 2 days he had arm pain and hot flashes. Day 3 he felt better but had some arm cramping. 84 hours after the vaccine he woke with tremors for several hours overnight; he then continue to experience muscle twitching but the tremor resolved the next morning. That day he noticed he felt very fatigued. The twitching and spasms lasted about 3 or 4 days. The legs will still spasm at nighttime and he still feels fatigued with less exercise tolerance. His baseline was 2-3 miles walking without difficulty prior to the vaccine, lately a mile will wipe him out. He also noticed intermittent midline pain around his breastbone that has improved. He hasn't had any shortness of breath. He had poor circulation to his hands and were cold and white but that resolved. He did not have sensory changes. His symptoms overall have been improving.

Close
Patient was admitted with neurologic complaints (arm numbness and tingling) and chest pain/tightness. Was found to be hypertensive, thrombocytopenic and in AKI. Was evaluated for mutltiple problems but found to have aTTP. Patient received plasma exchange, high-dose steroids, rituximab and caplacizumab. AKI resolved, neurologic complication resolved and thrombocytopenia resolved. Patient was discharge 6.21.21 with prescription for caplacizumab.

Close
After 5 mins of receiving 1 st Pfizer covid vaccine at 10:55am, pt felt nauseous and dizzy. Pharmacist on duty instructed the patient to lay down facing up and started taking his blood pressure every 3 mins while giving the patient the electrolyte Vitamin drink( similar to Gatorade). His blood pressure and pulse readings were 100/60 (60), 93/51 (54), 104/62(68); 101/68(62), 108/79(67),109/79(67). So his blood pressure and pusle went down for 1 reading then it went back to his normal reading of 109/79 within 10 mins. After laying down for 15 mins and drinking vitamin drink, pt felt better as his nausea/dizziness went away. He felt okay and left the pharmacy at 11:30am. Pt reported no reactions to any vaccines before. His girlfriend called the dad to report the incident and the dad told her that his twin brother experienced the same reaction earlier today when receiving his covid vaccine at another site. His brother felt fine after 30 mins monitoring

The patient medical history was not reported. The patient previously received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, lot number=EN9262) via intramuscular route of administration in left arm on 22Jan2021 as 1st dose, single for covid 19 immunisation. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the vaccination. On 19Feb2021 03:00, Patient reported chest pain and difficulty breathing and reported to ED. He was given Benedryl and morphine and stated that he was fine four hours later. He followed up with his PCP. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of chest pain (chest pain), difficulty breathing (dyspnoea). Treatment received for the adverse event was Benedryl and morphine. The outcome of the vents was recovered.; Sender's Comments: A causal association between BNT162B2 and the reported serious unlisted event chest pain cannot be excluded based on a compatible temporal relation.

20 2021-07-15 hypotension, loss of consciousness Pt 20year old male- came to the pharmacy for a walk in covid vaccine. He filled out the vaccine co... Read more
Close
Pt 20year old male- came to the pharmacy for a walk in covid vaccine. He filled out the vaccine consent form. I asked him if he was feeling ok today - he said yes. he presented as looking in healthy condition. I then asked him if he has ever had a bad reaction to a vaccine and he said not that he knew of but that he did not like needles. I told him that was normal, explained the shot was a quick pinch no stinging and would be over before he knew it. I encouraged him to relax his arm muscle and as soon as he did I gave the vaccine. I started to tell him he could take Tylenol or ibuprofen if he should get a sore arm and to make sure he is drinking plenty of water as hydration helps our bodies- he then asked if he could have some water and then tilted his head back and was passed out for i'd say 4 seconds. I massaged his arm and neck as he became kinda ridged and talked him back. he was out for about 4 seconds. I yelled for our store co manager who happened to be close by to come to the pharmacy and call 911. When he regained consciousness he started to sweat. he said he felt cold and thirsty. I gave him some water to drink. I explained to him what had happened and told him that we had called 911 out of precaution. I discussed with him calling parents and he wanted to call himself - he made the call to his mom on his cell phone to have her come pick him up. EMS arrived in about 10 minutes. they said his blood pressure was really low 100/60 and wanted to take him in but the patient refused. he also refused getting his blood sugar tested as he now told us he was deathly afraid of any medical procedure. ems left. I offered him some more water and chips. he drank 2 full bottles of water and ate a small bag of chips. his mom showed up a few minutes later to drive him home- we explained to her what had happened.. I told her to monitor his blood pressure at home (she said she had a machine)she said she should have known better than to let him come alone as she knew he reacted bad to medical situations. He left about 30 minutes after he got his vaccine. walked out on his own needed no assistance.

Medical history included asthma from an unknown date and ongoing. Concomitant medication(s) included salbutamol sulfate (PROAIR [SALBUTAMOL SULFATE]) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. Nurse stated, Initially when he has a dose of the first dose like two three days after he was experiencing, he also had a muscle that was given, he had a muscle injection site was painful, that arm was sore that was given, but he also started experiencing shortness of breath and same left sided chest pressure and I called his pediatrician and that's why we are just watching him because it wasnt to the point where he was full blown shortness of breath, full blown chest pressure stayed last for a couple of days then getting it worst. But he had the chills, he had fatigue is still there and it started to subside and then couple days after since it subside, fatigue never left but then he started to get chills again and fatigue was even more pronounce and then started more congestion and then he has ear infection, which we took him to doctor 2 days ago and he has started antibiotics. So the whole time from the time he got the dose till now he is been not feeling good, so now with the antibiotics he is feeling a little better and on 04Jun or 05Jun, like Friday to Saturday he was expecting little shortness of breath and then he was having a little bit of left side chest pressure, he had the arm pain initially and the site of injection was really painful and then the fatigue probably started the same time Friday Saturday he just, he didn't looked good at all, he just looked white. The patient experienced left sided chest pressure (concern of myocarditis), like a chest pain on the left side, shortness of breath, chills on an wasn't feeling good with joint pain wasn't feeling good with joint pain/wasn't feeling good after he received the vaccine; not feeling well; whole time from the time he got the dose till now he is been not feeling good, fatigued/still feeling fatigued on an unspecified date, ear infection on 19Jun2021 and a lot of congestion, muscle injection site was painful, arm was sore; arm pain, the site of injection was really, muscle injection site was painful, arm was sore; arm pain, the site of injection was really painful, he didn't looked good at all, he just looked white on an unspecified date. The patient was treated with antibiotics for ear infection. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included sars-cov-2 test result: negative. Caller stated His sons next dose (of Pfizer COVID vaccine) is due Wednesday. But until now he has not been feeling good. I don't want to give him the vaccine when he's sick. Does that make a difference with the effectiveness if I delay the second dose and she heard people had worse side effects for the first few days with fevers, body aches, nausea, fever and subsided and then they take their 2nd dose and are better after the 2nd dose, also stated her sons symptoms were not acute, but is not sure if it is coincidental if his ear infection was due to the vaccine. The outcome of the events were reported as unknown.; Sender's Comments: Based on the current available information and the plausible drug-event temporal association, a possible contributory role of the suspect product BNT162B2 to the development of event myocarditis cannot be totally excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

When reviewing forms with patient the patient disclosed a shellfish allergy. He described the symptoms of his skin turning red, shaking, and swelling in his throat as swelling in the past. He indicated that he had needed to use an epi pen in the past for his allergy. He still wanted the vaccination and knew we had an epi pen handy. He was given the vaccination in his left arm and was set up next to the staff development employee who was timing and monitoring patient's for symptoms. An epi pen was given to the monitor so it would be handy. The patient's right hand started shaking within a minute and it was hard to tell if it was from being anxious. Patient continued to communicate verbally and stated he wanted to use the epi pen. 911 was called by the staff and the staff member with the epi pen took it and the patient out of the main area. Paramedics transported him to the hospital with slight tachycardia and never did administer epi pen while in facility. Patient was always conscious and able to verbally communicate.

21 2021-02-07 chest pain Trouble breathing; Lightheaded/dizzy; Chills; Sore all over; Weakness in legs; Chest pain; This is a... Read more
Close
Trouble breathing; Lightheaded/dizzy; Chills; Sore all over; Weakness in legs; Chest pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). This 21-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Lot number EK9231), via an unknown route, on 12Jan2021 at a single dose on the left arm for COVID-19 immunisation. No relevant medical history and concomitant medications were provided. No known allergies. Pre-vaccination COVID test was not performed. On 13Jan2021, at 05:00 PM, the patient had lightheaded/dizzy, chills, sore all over, weakness in legs, chest pain and trouble breathing. On 14Jan2021, COVID test (Nasal Swab) was done and resulted negative. The events required an emergency room visit. Then, the patient was hospitalized for 3 days due to the events. Therapeutic measures taken as result of the events included ibuprofen and 2 other medications. The patient was recovering from the events.

21 2021-03-26 loss of consciousness Patient received his vaccine shortly after 5pm and was transitioned to the observation area in front... Read more
Close
Patient received his vaccine shortly after 5pm and was transitioned to the observation area in front of the pharmacy. Shortly after he sat down in the observation chair another employee noticed that he started having a reaction and became unconscious. 2 individuals came over to help Pt. When they arrived, he was sliding down the chair and became conscious but was not talking. lowered patient to floor and administered an Epi Pen at 5:07.called 911. After patient regained consciousness, he seemed stable and did not recall knowing what happened and did not display any additional signs of an adverse reaction. EMS arrived and checked his vitals and Pt was given the option to go to the hospital or go home. Pt refused to go to hospital and was given a ride home.

Patient was not injured from fainting (This writer was able to catch him and guide him to the ground). Patient remained in pharmacy for about 45 minutes. Patient was given water, a cold compress, and candy (Patient felt that his blood sugar was low and requested candy). Patient left feeling well.

Close
Felt anxious about the shot and got it at 10:48, started feeling dizzy at around 10:55 during the 10 minute waiting period, then started to black out and I immediately told the nurse who's quick actions prevented me from fully fainting (laying me down and giving me food/water and elevating my legs). Blood pressure was fine she said along with O2 levels. Left around 11:25 after I felt able to. We both think this was likely related to the anxiety about getting the shot itself (I have anxiety in general so it was not paired with a mistrust or anything about the vaccine) and began fainting 7 minutes after getting the vaccine. I was anxious about any possible symptoms and needles/shots/blood draws make me feel uneasy. However, this issue was not present with the first shot.
