21 2021-04-10 loss of consciousness Patient received second Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine at 1:55pm. Patient was told to stay in store for 15 ... Read more
Close
Patient received second Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine at 1:55pm. Patient was told to stay in store for 15 minutes. Patient then reported feeling nausous and headed to the bathroom around 2:00pm. Patient reports passing out in the bathroom stall around 2:02pm. Pharmacist was notified by the patient of the incident at 2:04pm. Patient reports hitting his head. EMS was called via pharmacy clerk. Pharmacist took patient's blood pressure (148/62) and pulse (68) at 2:07pm. Patient reports to pharmacist that he had not eaten anything yet for the day and does have a fear of needles as well as history of passing out when getting blood drawn. Pharmacist provided a bottle of water and a plain chocolate bar for the patient to consume while waiting for EMS to arrive. EMS checked over patient since he complained of pain at the base of skull as a result from fall in the bathroom. EMS checked blood pressure (138/74) and blood sugar (78) at 2:18pm. EMS cleared the patient but did education the patient to report any signs or symptoms of concussion. Patient was then escorted home via his girl friend.

21 2021-04-12 body temperature decreased, loss of consciousness, hypotension Patient said he felt light-headed after his shot. He was advised to continue sitting in the vaccine ... Read more
Close
Patient said he felt light-headed after his shot. He was advised to continue sitting in the vaccine area. Since he was feeling light-headed, the immunizing pharmacist told me to get the blood pressure cuff. When I got back, the patient passed out. The pharmacist and I moved the chair from underneath him and he gently put him on the floor. He quickly woke up and the pharmacist began to ask him questions such as his name and where he was to make sure he was ok. He was able to answer those questions fine and we placed him in a chair so he can rest. When he was in the chair, he began to pass out again. He quickly woke up again but wasn't feeling good. The pharmacist checked his blood pressure and it was low. His temperature was at 93F. The pharmacist continued to stay with him and he made sure that someone else was able to come and pick him up. Once he felt ok, he had the patient go sit in the post-vaccination waiting area until he had his ride pick him up.

Patient was in the health COVID 19 clinic for his 1st dose Pfizer vaccine. Vaccine was administered and patient was sent to the observation area for a 15 minute wait. Upon arrival to the observation area he sat down in a chair and states that he " begin to feel dizzy and then blacked out". Patient was found on the floor by observation nursing staff. He was alert and oriented x4 and vitals were with in normal range. Vitals were as followed: BP 118/74, Heart rate: 79 and regular, 02 98 on room air. Patient was assisted to the emergency pod and he stated that "this happens all the time with needles, and plus I haven't had anything to eat this morning." 21 2021-04-19 loss of consciousness Patient received the COVID vaccine (Pfizer dose 1, lot #EW0171, expiration date 8/2021) in his left ... Read more
Close
Patient received the COVID vaccine (Pfizer dose 1, lot #EW0171, expiration date 8/2021) in his left deltoid at 1437. The client was observed to fall out of his chair in the observation area, fall to the ground, and hit his head. The client made no attempt to protect his head or break his fall. RN, PHN, RN, and RN responded at 1438. PHN called EMS at that time as well. The client was observed to jerk his arms twice. The client was unconscious for approximately 90 seconds, and was turned on his side at this time. When the client regained consciousness, he was alert and oriented, complained of no pain in his head or any dizziness or lightheadedness. No difficulty breathing. Pupils were equal and reactive to light. At 1439, the vital signs obtained were: blood pressure 130/90, heart rate 57, O2 98, respiratory rate 26. The client denied any history of seizures, epilepsy, or any other medical history. The client stated he has no allergies and that he takes no medications. Upon examination, there were no cuts observable on the client's head. The client denied any feelings of dizziness before his loss of consciousness but stated he did not eat any breakfast or lunch that day. At 1443, the repeat vitals were as follows: 128/94 blood pressure, heart rate 60, respiratory rate 22, temperature 98. A manual pulse was 88 and thready. At 1447, EMR responded to the scene and assumed care of the client. Client transported to hospital.

21 2021-04-24 fainting Patient received vaccine in left arm (deltoid). Was in post vaccination observation area. About 5 mi... Read more
Close
Patient received vaccine in left arm (deltoid). Was in post vaccination observation area. About 5 minutes after the injection, while sitting in the observation chairs, the patient fainted and hit his head on the floor. Pharmacist and patient's father got him back up into the chair. Patient quickly regained consciousness, but felt nauseous and warm. Patient was given a little water. But could carry-on a conversation. Patient vomited a little into a trash can. About 10 additional minutes went by. Patient was able to get up out of the chair and walk out of the facility with the help of his family. Patient had a little bit of bump on head where he had struck the floor, no bleeding occurred. No additional medical assistance was contacted at that time by the facility, family, or the pharmacist. Pharmacist called the patient several hours to after to see how he was doing, but did not get a response. The pharmacist left a voicemail. It is unknown to the pharmacist whether or not the family decided it was necessary to get medical follow-up or not after the incident.

chest pain; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (Caregiver). A 21-year-old male patient (grandson) received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number was unknown) via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date at age of 21-year-old at single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE) on an unspecified date at age of 21-year-old for COVID-19 immunisation. Caller stated his grandson (21-year-old) received his second dose of the Pfizer COVID vaccine yesterday and this morning when he woke up he has been having chest pain on and off. caller wanted to know if that has been consistent with the second dose. The outcome of the event was unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot/batch number cannot be obtained.

He immediately became unresponsive and his body went stiff. He was carefully lowered to the floor, still stiff with ragged breathing. Patient was given an Epipen which brought him back to responsiveness. Patient was able to answer questions following Epi and admitted to being scared. 21 2021-05-04 chest discomfort, troponin increased, chest pain, palpitations 21 year old previously healthy male had 2nd dose of COVID vaccine on 4/23. He had fever and chills o... Read more
Close
21 year old previously healthy male had 2nd dose of COVID vaccine on 4/23. He had fever and chills over the next two days that resolved spontaneously. On 4/26, he began having palpitations with onset of substernal chest pain described as a piece of metal on top of his chest. He also had nausea and vomiting. After 1 hour, he took one ibuprofen which resolved symptoms. On 4/27, he again had chest pain but immediately took ibuprofen which resolved symptoms. He saw his PCP on 4/28 and had abnormal EKG with ST and T wave abnormalities, elevated troponin of 10, and he was sent to the ED for further evaluation. He was given 324mg aspirin and admitted for observation. He did not have any additional symptoms, and echo was normal. Troponins down trended to 2 by 4/29, and he was discharged on a 5 day course of indomethacin with follow up with his PCP, no cardiology follow up required.

POST VACCINE ADMIN, PATIENT REPORTED HE FELT LIGHTHEADED, QUEEZY, STARTED TO GET TUNNEL VISION. STAFF ASSISTED PATIENT BACK TO FLOOR AND RAISED LEGS IN AIR. ASSISTED TO STRETCHER AND PLACED IN TRENDELENBERG, TAKENE TO OBS. STATES RELIEF ONCE ON STRETCHER. PER ON SITE MD, CLASSIC VASOVAGAL REACTION, RESOLVED. 0936 LYING BP 106/73 HR 70 RR 18 SATS 100% RA 0940 SITTING BP 118/73 HR 65 RR 18 SATS 100% RA 0942 STANDING BP 110/66 HR 71 RR 18 SATS 100% RA; REPORTS SOME DIZZINESS RETURNED, SAT BACK ON STRETCHER 0948 STANDING BP 98/67 HR 74 RR 20 SATS 100% RA; ASSYMPTOMATIC 0950 STANDING BP 88/58 HR 70 RR 18 SATS 100% RA; REPORTS MILD DIZZINESS BUT IMPROVING 0954 STANDING BP 109/72 HR 75 RR 18 SATS 100% RA; REPORTS S/S RESOLVED, AMBULATING WITH STEADY GAIT AND REQUESTING TO LEAVE, NO FURTHER ISSUES.

21 2021-05-09 pallor 21yoM states that on 25 March 2021, he noted 25 minutes after his 1st dose of Pfizer vaccines, he no... Read more
Close
21yoM states that on 25 March 2021, he noted 25 minutes after his 1st dose of Pfizer vaccines, he noted a throat tightness, feels tight, scratchy, noted a hoarse throat with some voice changes. He felt throat tightness made it hard to breath, he had associated lightheadedness, felt anxious, almost like a wheezing sound when breathed in and out in his upper neck. When he stood up, he did feel like he needed to hold onto something to steady himself, had some tunnel vision, improved with sitting down and closing his yes and taking deep breaths. He felt warm at the time, not cold or clammy. His friend said he looked ghostly white, no flushing, no hives, no angioedema. No sense of impending doom. He did take Zyrtec the day that he received the vaccine. He waited the 15 minutes after vaccine without symptoms, and had walked back to class by the time it started. Between the vaccine and symptoms onset, he denies eating anything, being stung by anything. He told a friend about his symptoms, and he returned to the hospital via base taxi arrived at ER. Symptoms were still occurring about 60 minutes after vaccination when he arrived at the ER. In the ER, he underwent exam, was given oral Benadryl. His symptoms of scratchy throat lasted for 2 days afterwards with some associated fatigue, post-nasal drip. He denies other symptoms. No fevers or chills. Small amount of pain and a ?knot? at the injection site the next day, but minimal according to the paitent. Denies hives, angioedema, SOB, wheezing, nausea/vomiting, no diarrhea, abdominal pain, nasal pruritus/congestion, ocuarl itching/redness, no syncope. No h/o vaccine reactions before. No h/o passing out before at all, specifically not to needles, blood draws, or vaccines before. No h/o venom or drug allergy. He does report a history of apple allergic reaction 1 year previous when eating a raw apple, felt his throat close within 15-30 minutes, no hives or other systemic symptoms. He took oral Benadryl and went to ER. He was given oral Benadryl, no Epipen. He followed up with his PCM regarding possible apple allergy and was told to avoid apples, but was never tested for apple allergy. Since then, when he drinks apple juice, his throat will start hurting, but otherwise, he has avoided raw and cooked allergies. He does report seasonal rhinitis symptoms that are worse in the fall. He takes allegra as needed to treat these symptoms. He is not carrying an Epipen currently

Close
Pt mentioned prior history of fainting after IVs. Seemed apprehensive to receive vaccine but did want to receive it. Before being able to apply bandaid to injection site, pt wiped their arm (x2) and had blood on hand. Seemed uncomfortable with sight of blood. Pt was asked to take a seat and wait for 25-30 minutes to be monitored since having prior history of loss of consciousness. Pt went to waiting area and was walking around when he lost consciousness and fell to the ground. Fell on his back and did not hit his head. Was able to answer questions about his name/DOB/current date. Pt was immediately responsive and alert. 911 was called. Pt refused medical care other than cold compress and water. Pt was alert and walking on their own at the time of leaving

21 2021-05-17 inflammation of the heart muscle, inflammation of the pericardium acute myocarditis; Pericarditis; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable a physician. A 21-y... Read more
Close
acute myocarditis; Pericarditis; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable a physician. A 21-year-old male patient started to receive 2nd dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, LOT/Batch number and expiration date unknown) via an unspecified route of administration on 29Apr2021 at age of 21-year-old at single dose for COVID-19 immunization. Medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. Patient previously received 1st dose of BNT162B2 on an unspecified date for COVID-19 immunization. Prior to vaccination, the patient wasn't diagnosed with COVID-19. Since the vaccination, the patient hasn't been tested for COVID-19. Acute myocarditis/pericarditis started on 01May2021, 2 days post vaccination, diagnosed on 03May2021, 4 days post vaccination (second dose vaccine). The events resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care visit. Events were serious as hospitalization. Patient received anti inflammatory medications for the events. Outcome of the events was unknown. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: A possible contributory effect of suspect BNT162B2 on reported events cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Severe, Systemic: Exhaustion / Lethargy-Severe, Systemic: Fainting / Unresponsive-Severe, Systemic: Hypotension-Medium, Systemic: Seizure-Mild, Systemic: Shakiness-Medium, Additional Details: Patient was immediately nauseous after vaccination, but that resolved quickly. Minutes after sitting down for the observation period, patient seemed to jerk and looked like he was seizing. He did not have trouble breathing. He was lucid after going in and out of consciousness for a minute or so. He was hypotensive and pale, but after water and some candy, patient was feeling much better. After the 30min observation period, his blood pressure was up and he was able to walk without trouble.

Unknown vaccine clinic site. Patient was seen at Per internal reported event: 21 y.o.male with PMH significant for asthma who was admitted 5/15/2021 with CP. Pt had Pfizer COVID vaccine #2 on 5/12. He developed fever and myalgias on 5/13. These had recovered by 5/14 - only complaint was sore arm and underarm swelling on the L. By 5/15, pt had severe CP with dyspnea. Taken to ED - noted to have elevated troponin and ST elevation on EKG. Now s/p LHC today - coronaries clean. Echo without wmas. Cardiology suspects acute myocarditis. No pericardial effusion to suggest pericarditis.
21 2021-05-18 inflammation of the heart muscle, ventricular tachycardia, inflammation of the pericardium, heart attack, chest pain Patient is a 21 y.o. male with no past medical history who got his second dose of COVID (Pfizer) vac... Read more
Close
Patient is a 21 y.o. male with no past medical history who got his second dose of COVID (Pfizer) vaccine on Saturday presented with chest pain since Sunday. Patient says that he was in his USOH until yesterday when he started having substernal chest pain which was getting worse with inspiration but also with specific movements. He does have pain even at rest sometimes but he thinks that it's exacerbating by breathing. Had some nausea/vomiting as well. Denies other symptoms. Not really sob or leg swelling. In the ER, his Trop I was 10.7 and his WBC was 12.2. His EKG was NSR with short PR and STE I, II, III, AVF, V4-V6 Patient is a 21 y.o. male with no past medical history who got his second dose of COVID (Pfizer) vaccine on Saturday presented with chest pain since Sunday with some pleuritic characteristics. He was found to have a very elevated trop I to 10.7, leukocytosis to 12.2 and STE in I, II, III, AVF, V4-V6. His POCUS in the ER was without significant pericardial effusion and probably normal EF. Differential at this point includes pericarditis vs myopericarditis (there are some myocarditis cases reported in Israel post Pfizer vaccination, predominantly in young male patients) vs less likely ACS. Will need admission and further work up and treatment -Admission to Cardiology -NPO in case team tomorrow decides to proceed to LHC -Full echo and cardiac MRI tomorrow -Telemetry monitoring -Repeat EKG q4h overnight -send CRP, ESR -trend Trop to peak -would not start heparin gtt at this point -Please start tonight ASA 650 TID + Colchicine 0.6 mg BID 21-year-old man admitted with signs and symptoms of acute myo-pericarditis or in the setting of recent COVID-19 vaccination. He apparently had the findings are vaccine 2 days ago and developed pleuritic chest pain. His ECG shows pathognomonic changes for pericarditis in the is a small troponin elevation. He has no past medical history or exertional symptoms to suggest CAD. Bedside echocardiogram showed preserved left ventricular systolic function. He was admitted and placed on aspirin and colchicine. A cardiac MRI today showed evidence of myopericarditis. He had 3 beats of nonsustained VT on tele.

After Pfizer vaccination patient was being observed for 15 minutes for adverse reaction. Patient passed out and fell face first to the floor. Patients nose was bleeding. A rapid response was called. Patient was placed in a wheelchair and taken to the ER.Patient normal vitals on presentation. Not acutely toxic appearing. Exam with mild ecchymoses along the left maxilla and along the left neck concerning for possible head injury. EKG shows sinus bradycardia. Head CT shows no evidence of acute intracranial hemorrhage. It does note a posterior left orbital floor fracture with blood in the left maxillary sinus. He has no evidence of visual acuity changes or visual complaints. No signs of entrapment. Feel he is stable for discharge at this time. I spoke with on-call ophthalmology, doctor. He states that the patient walk-in tomorrow for follow-up.

21 2021-05-23 heart rate increased my son was on a strenuous bicycle trip and reached his campground for the night. in the late evening... Read more
Close
my son was on a strenuous bicycle trip and reached his campground for the night. in the late evening he called me to report that he was suffering from nausea and rapid heartbeat (tachycardia). we assumed this was caused by heat exhaustion, but later I saw news reports about myocarditis being investigated as a possible side effect from the Covid-19 vaccine. my son fits the rough profile (young man) and experienced these symptoms three days after his second vaccination, so I thought this should be reported. He completed his bike trip (200 miles) and feels fine after taking one day to rest.

21 2021-05-27 inflammation of the pericardium, chest pain Pericarditis diagnosis: This is a 21 year old male who presented to the emergency department on 4/2... Read more
Close
Pericarditis diagnosis: This is a 21 year old male who presented to the emergency department on 4/27/21 with a two-day history of chest pain. He was seen in a emergency department on 4/26 and reported a normal EKG, blood work, and x-ray. He was discharged home. His was worsened so he reported to an urgent care in . That team had a concern for pericarditis, so referred the patient to the emergency room. He had a reproducible pain over the costal margin but did describe a positional component. Provider felt they still had to consider pericarditis as well as costochondritis. The suspicion for pulmonary embolism or acute coronary syndrome or very low. The suspicion also for myocarditis was low. His EKG did show some J-point elevation versus ST elevation in the anterior and lateral leads. There was no evidence of reciprocal depression. His troponin test was normal. His CBC and metabolic panel were normal. He had had CRP which was mildly elevated at 4.6. A bedside point-of-care ultrasound showed no evidence of a pericardial effusion. Provider felt it was reasonable to treat him for pericarditis although his EKG is not classic for this. It was recommended he use his scheduled ibuprofen 600 mg 3 times a day. He was also given a 1 month course of daily colchicine 0.6 mg. It was recommend he follow closely with his PCP to see if he needs to have this colchicine course extended. He will follow-up with his primary doctor in 1 week for repeat check.
21 2021-05-28 ejection fraction decreased, fast heart rate, hypotension Starting the day after the second dose of Pfizer mRNA, he developed prodrome with fever/chills, N/V/... Read more
Close
Starting the day after the second dose of Pfizer mRNA, he developed prodrome with fever/chills, N/V/D, systemic macular rash, and fatigue that persisted until presenting to the ED 9 days later. He was noted to be tachycardic and hypotensive with a severe leukocytosis, elevated inflammatory markers and + troponin, and an LVEF 35-40%. He was referred to tertiary care center, had a cardiac MRI that showed little inflammation but LVEF now 12%. On 5/21/21 he was started on high dose steroids and placed on mechanical circulatory support with VA ECMO. Cardiac function quickly improved and he is ready to come off VA ECMO 5/29 with an LVEF improved to > 40% during weaning trials.

Close
Patient said he had an extreme headache and slight difficulty breathing and his heart racing within 2 minutes of being vaccinated. His blood pressure was taken and was 164/94, and he was given water to drink. Within 5 minutes, the headache was beginning to subside and his blood pressure returned to normal levels at 129/64. After 10 minutes the headache was gone and the patient said he was feeling much better. He was monitored for another 15 minutes before being released to go home.

Mother indicated that client sat down and requested water to drink. Mother began to look for water and noticed client begin to slump in chair. Staff assisted in easing client to the ground. Feet were elevated. EMS and NP paged. VS #1 BP: 106/57, HR: 49, O2: 98%. Gatorade and water provided along with snacks. Client assisted into sitting position, VS #2 BP: 129/62, HR: 66, O2: 98%. Observed pale lips, cold and clammy. Mother offered hx of fainting after blood draw at a young age. VS #3 BP: 119/64, HR: 74, O2: 98%. Client c/o dizziness, feeling cold and was clammy. Client assisted onto back and feet elevated. At 0923, 911 called. VS #4 BP: 128/55, HR: 51, O2: 99%. EKG strip read by NP - normal sinus. VS# 5 BP: 114/63, HR: 63, O2: 99%. Ambulance arrived on location at 0927. VS #6 BP: 114/73, HR: 75, O2: 98%. Client transported to ambulance at 0930 for assessment. At 0946, EMS released client into the care of his mother and client exited the location in their vehicle. Client admitted he had not consumed any alcohol or drugs.

Close
A patient with no past medical history presenting with chest pain and troponin leak 2 days following Pfizer COVID-19 vaccination. LHC was negative. Work up and imaging was consistent with Myocarditis. Echocardiogram was consistent with mildly reduced systolic function. The patient was discharged with pain and anti-inflammatory medications. 21 2021-06-19 chest pain, chest discomfort Overnight after shot just typical symptoms, some slight chills and next day just a little tired Day ... Read more
Close
Overnight after shot just typical symptoms, some slight chills and next day just a little tired Day 2 after shot, April 11th. Chest pain, squeezing in chest. Unusual but manageable and didn?t feel terrible otherwise,maybe slightly tired. Tried leaning forward to make feel better. Day 3 and 4 chest pain/heart squeezing continued and was bothersome and, went to Urgent Care this day April 13th. EKG was a little abnormal and told to follow up with a cardiologist and take Advil. The heart squeezing feeling continued. Early morning hours April 14th very sick, excessive shaking (no fever), extreme nausea, faint feeling, dry cough (laying on bathroom floor). Not much, if any chest pain at the time. Went to ER. Not much chest pain during ER visit but nauseous and shaking etc. Test were run. Told that the symptoms were a delayed reaction to the vaccine and to follow up with a cardiologist because possible abnormal EKG and to take Advil as needed. Overnight at home, no chest pain but an hour of the shaking and nausea returned but not as bad as before. Over next couple days the chest pain/squeezing, slightly shakes and light headedness would come and go and by 4-16 feeling pretty great. The heart feeling mildly at most in the background but not debilitating. Starting week of April 20th maybe 4-5 flare ups with chest pain and no pattern but not debilitating. Could happen at rest. April 27th bigger flare up more debilitating, had to lie down, heart squeezing pain and maybe some wheezing when breathed in but not tightness in throat. Lasted about 30 minutes. Was just doing schoolwork with friends at the time so not under any physical or emotional stress at the time. After this from April 20 to May 3rd feeling heart symptom mildly but not debilitating and could resume normal active life. Had cardiology appt. May 3rd with nurse practitioner. According to NP the 12 Lead EKG run that day correlated with abnormal EKG from ER. Normal sinus rhythm with sinus arrhythmia Rightward axis Pulmonary disease pattern. Incomplete right bundle branch block Abnormal ECG. Given 4 lead heart monitor to wear for a week. Also ordered a CV CT angiogram coronaries with calcium scoring. The test could not be scheduled through them until July. Also told could go on hiking trip out west and to stop and rest if felt pain. For parents reassurance about hiking trip, had a second opinion over teleconference call with Dr., myocarditis specialist to confirm would be safe on hiking trip. Dr. said he should be good to go. He said these heart symptoms related to the second vaccine could fade over time. Hiking trip May 20th to May 30th. Did fine with exertion and just a few small episodes of the chest pain, light headedness and maybe a little shaking but these were at rest. Also, 4 lead heart monitor report was good. Returned from trip May 30th and no chest pain or symptoms for approximately 3 weeks through June 17th. June 18th went to urgent care for sore throat and ear. Prescribed amoxycillin. Took the amoxycillin and one Advil sinus, that evening had a heart squeezing episode return. This was the first time in almost 3 weeks. Did not take any more Advil sinus in case that caused the episode. Had another slight episode that evening. Hiked next day June 19th and fine. Then felt it slightly again after eating that afternoon of the 19th, also chest did feel a little tight all day. Then felt it again that evening. Still taking Amoxycillin as of today.
21 2021-06-20 troponin increased, inflammation of the heart muscle, chest pain 21-year-old male with no significant past medical history who received his second vaccine of the Pfi... Read more
Close
21-year-old male with no significant past medical history who received his second vaccine of the Pfizer COVID series on Wednesday, 16JUN21. Afterwards, he developed myalgia and chest pain that began on 17JUN21, which worsened prompting his arrival to ED. His troponin was found to be elevated and there were non-specific ST elevations on his electrocardiogram so he was admitted for observation while starting colchicine for myocarditis. His chest pain resolved in the emergency department prior to admission and did not return during his stay. His troponin peaked and down-trended. The findings on his electrocardiogram resolved. A formal echocardiogram was performed on 21JUN21 with no significant findings. He is to continue on colchicine 0.6mg PO BID for 3 months (END 8/11/21) and then follow up with cardiology for possible further workup if needed.

He progressively become more pale in the face and lips. EMT was altered and his BG and BP were taken. His BG, BP and HR were all reported low. The EMT gave him M&M's and chocolate milk to help elevate his BG. The patient declined ER visit, but was advised by EMT to follow up with PCP.

Close
A couple of days later, I experienced what I can best describe as a "fluttering heart." Beginning around noon two days after my first COVID vaccine was administered, I began to feel a high heart rate and heart palpitations. Later that evening and into the night, I experienced low blood pressure (i.e., 104/55) for an extended period and my oxygen levels dropped to the low 90s--this concerned me because I am a healthy athlete and play a cardio-intensive sport. These symptoms worsened while I laid down to go to sleep and continued for a couple of days. After my second vaccine, however, these symptoms did not appear with the same severity; rather, they were very mild.

21 2021-06-29 loss of consciousness 21 year old male, received 1st dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (Lot # EW0167 expiration 5/3/21 @ 1450)... Read more
Close
21 year old male, received 1st dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (Lot # EW0167 expiration 5/3/21 @ 1450) on left deltoid at 1024. Patient sitting at vaccinator table and RN explained risks/benefits of vaccine and received verbal consent from patient to give vaccine. Patient told, RN that he is "scared of needles". RN offered for patient to be vaccinated in the zero gravity chair and patient declined. No past medical history, no allergies, no hx of fainting or seizures. Patient is taking the medication, doxycycline, for face acne. A few seconds after patient received vaccine, he had loss of consciousness, tensed up with a few jerky movements for about 10 seconds. 2 RNs moved patient down to floor and elevated lower extremities. Patient immediately regained consciousness and A&O x4. Patient was diaphoretic. Ice pack placed on back of neck. At 1024, EMS was called by a Ancillary. EMT took vitals and RN recorded vitals at 1026: BP 120/80, HR 56, Sp02 99%. Patient states he is "feeling much better". Patient placed in zero gravity chair. Patient reports he had breakfast (cereal and water) before arriving. Another set of vitals taken at 1031: BP 120/85, HR 60, Sp02 98%. At 1032, EMS arrived and assessed patient. Vital signs were stable. After EMS used lancet to obtain a blood glucose level, patient started feeling "hot" and dizzy again. Patient diaphoretic. At 1040, Vitals by EMS: BP 91/45 on right arm and HR 53 while in zero gravity chair. At 1042, EMS had patient stand up to assess his vitals: BP 89/43 on right arm and HR 57. At 1045, Vitals by EMS: BP 70/33 on right arm and HR 63, taken while standing up. Patient diaphoretic and feeling a little lightheaded. Patient sat back down in zero gravity chair and ice pack placed on back of neck. At 1047, Vitals by EMS: BP 96/56 on right arm and HR 55, taken while in zero gravity chair. Patient left with EMS at 1054 to Hospital. Patient was with his coworker and boss, who was notified of the situation by EMS.

This is a spontaneous report from a contactable other hcp. A 21-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: solution for injection) dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Right arm on 12Jan2021 13:30 (at a age of 21-years- old) (Batch/Lot Number: EK3302) as dose 2, single for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included none. There were no concomitant medications On 22Dec2020 historical Vaccine BNT162B2 dose 1 Lot number: EK5730 right arm. On 16Jan2021 06:30 the patient experienced stabbing chest pains, angina, heart spasms, difficulty breathing (hospitalization). The patient was hospitalized for stabbing chest pains (chest pain) for 1 days. The patient was hospitalized for angina (angina pectoris) for 1 days. The patient was hospitalized for heart spasms (cardiospasm) for 1 days. The patient was hospitalized for difficulty breathing (dyspnoea) for 1 days. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood test: unknown result computerized tomogram thorax: unknown result, sars-cov-2 test: negative on 19Mar2021, x-ray: unknown result. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of stabbing chest pains (chest pain), angina (angina pectoris), heart spasms (cardiospasm), difficulty breathing (dyspnoea). On an unspecified date in 2021, the outcome of the events were recovered with sequelae. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on the information currently available, events with the suspected vaccine BNT162B2 in this patient cannot be completely excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to RAs, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate

Fever; Chills; Sweating; Body aches; muscle fatigue; Very rapid heart beat. Myresting is in the 60s, today is the 80-90s. I have stood up, walked a fewfeet, and sat back down and my heartrate was 110.; Lethargy; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable health care professional, the patient. A 21-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: EN6206), via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 22Mar2021 at 07:45 AM (at the age of 21-years-old), as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient did not have any relevant medical history. The patient did not have any concomitant medication. The patient was not allergic to medications, food and other products. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient had not received any other vaccines within four weeks, prior to the COVID-19 vaccine. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. The patient experienced lethargy on 22Mar2021. The patient experienced fever, chills, sweating, body aches, muscle fatigue and very rapid heartbeat on 23Mar2021 at 03:00 AM. It was also reported that usually when the patient woke up, his heart rate was at 40s and the morning was at the 60s. Resting heart rate was 60s, but it was at 80-90s following vaccination. When the patient stood up, walked a few feet, and sat back down the heart rate was 110 (unit and reference range was not provided). The events resulted in a visit to the doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The clinical outcome of lethargy, fever, chills, sweating, body aches, muscle fatigue and rapid heartbeat was recovering at the time of reporting. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

I have had severe shortness of breath and breathlessness, chest pain, heart racing, heart fluttering, heart pounding, chest tightness, nausea, extreme fatigue, coughing, headache. I have no stamina at all, just slight exertion causes my heart to start racing and pounding, I can't climb stairs and I haven't been able to work in weeks, now I'm probably going to lose my job I fear and then will have no health insurance. I have more tests this week to try and find out if I have endocarditis, so I am racking up all kinds of bills. So far no one believes me or will help me! ALL of this started within a few days of the second Pfizer dose of COVID vaccine. Biggest mistake of my life. I feel like I'm dying and no one will help. You are literally killing me.

He was observed for another hour after which final vitals were taken and he was still within normal range (129/86, %SO2 98, PP70). He was able to call a friend to pick him up.

Close
I gave Pt his vaccine at approximately 4:10pm and asked him to wait 15 minutes before leaving. At approximately 4:15pm Pt's head went back and forth hitting his head on the wall, then he passed out. Upon hearing there was an accident , I immediately went to the patients side, where I found him sweating and his heart racing. I asked Pt was he ok and he replied that his heart was racing. We call 911 and waited with Pt until they arrived. At approximately 4:30pm the EMS arrived and evaluated the patient. By 4:40pm, the EMS left and requested Pt to stay until his ride came to assist him.

Close
Fast heartbeat; Anxiety; Nervousness; Stomach pain; Problems with his eyesight; Like stomach reactions like he is going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting; Malaise; Headache; Fever; going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non-healthcare professional (patient's father). A 21-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 07Jun2021 (21-year-old at the time of vaccination) as dose 2, single for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included not reported. The concomitant medications were none. The patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE solution for injection, Batch/Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date on 2021 as dose 1, single for covid-19 immunization. On an unspecified date on 2021, the patient presented symptoms he had never had such as, fast heartbeat, malaise, anxiety, nervousness, headache, stomach pain, problems with his eyesight and fever. The patient had to be admitted into the emergency room, had several studies done and no abnormalities were diagnosed. The reporter stated that Pfizer covid vaccine on 07Jun2021. After the vaccine the patient had a fast heartbeat, general malaise, felt nervous, headache, a stomach-ache, and a fever. The patient had to go to the emergency room, and they performed tests and analysis on him and nothing came up. This event started about a week after the vaccine and his heart rate was speeding up. The heart rate and anxiety and headaches and like stomach reactions like he is going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting. The symptoms are different on different days. The heart rate only happened once and everything has continued to happen. This happened after the second dose of the vaccine. They sent the patient from the emergency room to another place and admitted him for 2 days. The reporter is unsure of the dates of admission. They sent the patient to a hospital where there was a cardiologist and the patient stayed there for 2 days. As Per fact sheet, what are the risks of the Pfizer BioNTech covid-19 vaccine, revised: 25Jun2021, fast heartbeat is listed as one of the signs of a possible severe allergic reaction. Most of these side effects don´t have a mean duration documented, some of the side effects have a range of appearance from 1-36 days. The reporter asked for treatment recommendations for patient. The events were serious - hospitalization. The outcome for the event's fast heartbeat, visual impairment, abdominal discomfort, pyrexia, going to vomit but doesn't end up vomiting were unknown and other events were not resolved. Information about batch/lot number has been requested.

His heart is beating too fast/a rapid heartbeat; Chills; Fever; He has been feeling like very very different; He feels like his muscles is not, he feels like he is not himself; He cannot sleep with his heart like that; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer (Patient mother). A 21-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/lot number: EW0181) via an unspecified route of administration in left arm on 07Jun2021 (at the age of 21-years-old) as dose 2, single for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history and concomitant medications were No. The patient previously received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: Solution for injection, Batch/lot number: EW0174), via an unspecified route of administration on 07May2021 as dose 1, single for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient did not receive any other vaccine prior to COVID-19 vaccine. The patient mother reported that the patient got his second shot like almost month and half ago but since then from an unspecified date, he has been feeling like very, very different like his heart is beating too fast and he feels like his muscles is not, he feels like he was not himself, and a week later he started with symptoms of chills, fever and a rapid heartbeat, like he can't control it. Patient mother took him to the hospital, but they found nothing, he was hospitalized for a few days from an unspecified date, but they found nothing. He was healthy before, so patient mother knew that this was related to the vaccine. Patient mother stated that he can't sleep with his heart like that, and she was very worried and was just calling to know what she can do or what's happened with him or she don't know because she already took him to the hospital, they kept him to the hospital till 8 and they couldn't find nothing, so she was like worried, and it was desperate already. The reporter seriousness was assessed as serious (hospitalization). The patient underwent lab tests that included a lot of checkup of the health, and everything says normal range on an unspecified date. When asked about treatment, the patient mother replied as, "No they didn't give nothing". The outcome of the events was unknown. Follow-up attempts are completed. No further information is expected.

Four minutes after receiving Pfizer Covid 19 Vaccination (#1 of series), client lost consciousness. Client was diaphoretic, pale. Consciousness returned almost immediately. BP 100/70, Pulse 62, Oxygen Saturation 96%. Client reported feeling nausea as well. Client instructed to place head between legs and take deep breaths. No medication was provided. Ice applied to neck. 5-8 minutes later client was escorted to clinic exam room via wheelchair and placed in supine position. Client observed an additional 30 minutes while symptoms gradually improved. Client ambulated on own to his vehicle after observation period.

22 2021-04-04 fainting, loss of consciousness Patient passed out, syncope episode while waiting in lobby after vaccine administration. Technicia... Read more
Close
Patient passed out, syncope episode while waiting in lobby after vaccine administration. Technician alerted pharmacist. Pharmacist immediately got red immunization emergency bag and approached patient. I introduced myself and prepared to activate the emergency response system (as recommended during CPR) but he had good pulse and respiration and immediately he spontaneously recovered! We asked him to stay to be observed and offered him some water and food. He accepted the water. We did a wellness check phone call with him later in the afternoon to confirm that he was doing well, and he was.
22 2021-04-05 fainting Patient described episodes of fainting after medical procedures. After initially appearing fine aft... Read more
Close
Patient described episodes of fainting after medical procedures. After initially appearing fine after the vaccination, the patient fainted about 10-15 minutes after the vaccine was administered. Patient was let to lay on the floor as he almost fell out of the chair he was sitting. No injuries reported from falling or being moved to the floor. Patient spent approximately 10 minutes on the floor until feeling well enough to stand and move about. Once standing the patient was able to get move freely and did not have any more episodes while on site. Patients family was supportive and well educated on how to handle his situation.
22 2021-04-06 pallor, blood pressure fluctuation The patient became pale and light headed within minutes of his vaccination. He also reported his vi... Read more
Close
The patient became pale and light headed within minutes of his vaccination. He also reported his vision dimmed. He reported he has a history of this reaction with any injection. We gave him water and took his blood pressure, it was initially 69/58 with a pulse of 46. Five minutes later it was 164/93 with a pulse rate of 41. Five minutes later it was back down to 82/50 with a pulse of 87. Five minutes later he was feeling better, his color and site normalized and his blood pressure was 117/70 with a pulse rate of 69. We let him sit for a while longer and when he was comfortable he got up, walked around, and left.

He was accompanied by his roommate who also had a vaccine immediately after him. Patient was sitting upright in chair looking down at phone. Had a syncopal episode, fell to floor, had seizure activity that lasted 5-10 secs. Patient awakened on his own, confused. Tried to get off of floor. Asked to stay on right side of floor. Vitals obtained. A/Ox2. Patient diaphoretic, pale, with shivering. Abrasions to right side of forehead and right posterior shoulder. BP 89/56, HR 56, O2 99% at 1257. Patient able to go from sitting to standing position to be sat in chair. Father notified of events. Father wanted patient to stay here at site for one hour. Within 5 mins of sitting in chair, patient became diaphoretic and pale again with focal stare. Per patient, "I can't hear or see you at the moment." EMS activated. BP obtained again, 78/52, HR 63, O2 at 99%. EMS arrived and assessed patient. Decided to take to Hospital. Father called and notified. Father will meet son at emergency dept.

22 2021-04-18 inflammation of the heart muscle The patient appears to have developed acute myopericarditis within 3 days of receiving the vaccine.;... Read more
Close
The patient appears to have developed acute myopericarditis within 3 days of receiving the vaccine.; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. A 22-year-old male patient received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTEC COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection, Batch/ Lot Number and expiry date were not provided), via an unspecified route of administration on 31Mar2021 (at the age of 22-years-old) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient did not have any allergies to medications, food or other products. Patient did not receive other vaccine in four weeks of vaccination. Patient did not receive any other medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. Patient has not COVID, prior vaccination. On 03Apr2021, the patient appears to have developed acute myopericarditis within 3 days of receiving the vaccine (adverse event result in Emergency room/department or urgent care). Patient received treatment with acetylsalicylic acid (ASPIRIN) and colchicine. Patient has been tested for COVID in 2021, post vaccination, Test type: Nasal Swab and result was negative. The outcome of the event was recovering. Additional information on lot/batch number has been requested.; Sender's Comments: Based on the known vaccine safety profile the causal association between the reported event patient appears to have developed acute myopericarditis within 3 days of receiving the vaccine and the usage of the vaccine BNT162B2 is unlikely but cannot be completely excluded because of strong temporal association between the event and the suspected vaccine. The case will be assessed once the new information is available. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Patient received I.M.( covid vaccine) in left deltoid he became pale and diaphoretic felt weak. NP immediately assessed him as he lost consciousness for maybe 10-15 seconds was easily aroused with sternal rub and alcohol inhalant . BP 116/62, O2 sat 100%, HR was 50. Given 3 cups of water candy and ice pack , color returned completely oriented and sat for observation for 30 min. He has had this occur with tattoos, phlebotomy and other shots. He admits to having syncopal episodes in the past, told to f/u with PCP but left clinic completely stable.

22 2021-04-19 heart rate increased Felt fine day of vaccine, Sunday, just minor arm pain. Woke up the next morning with pretty severe f... Read more
Close
Felt fine day of vaccine, Sunday, just minor arm pain. Woke up the next morning with pretty severe fatigue and more arm pain. Around 11am I had pretty bad chills that lasted about an hour, along with minor nausea. Additionally, throughout most of the day my heart rate was usually between 90-100 bpm, even while lying down and doing nothing. Going to sleep on Monday night I woke around 3 times during the night with cold sweats. Waking up on Tuesday morning, my heart rate is still elevated, arm is still sore, but the fatigue isn't as bad. However, at around 9am on Tuesday morning I started to develop itchy hives and a rash on the back of my legs. After the first dose I only had a sore arm, no symptoms like these, and I do not have any known allergies.

22 2021-04-24 chest discomfort, chest pain Approximately five days after receiving the vaccine, I had a strange feeling in the left side of my ... Read more
Close
Approximately five days after receiving the vaccine, I had a strange feeling in the left side of my chest as if something was swollen. It was not pain, but rather a feeling as if something inside was "enlarged" or heavy. Shortly after, I also had sharp pains on the left side which would come once or twice a day and last 1-2 seconds at most. As of now (day 13), I either do not feel the heaviness anymore or I am not noticing it anymore. The sharp pains have become very infrequent but I do often feel a mild soreness in the left side of my chest which lasts for about half an hour and gradually subsides.

Close
Passed out; pounding headache/headache symptoms are getting worst; body ache; tiredness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer. A 22-years-old male patient (Son) received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Solution for injection), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration on 08Apr2021 (Batch/Lot number UNKNOWN) as single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. My son is having a tough time with the vaccine. Everyday he has a couple of side effects. He started with body ache and tiredness on unspecified date Apr2021. He had a pounding headache. His headache was moderate today. However, the headache symptoms are getting worst. Generally, the symptoms last a day his have been getting worst for 7 days. He has been taking Tylenol and Advil. But the Advil doesn't even seem to hep anymore." headache is a common side effect reported with the vaccine. If the symptoms persists or get worst please consult your HCP. Please note blood clot has not been associated with the vaccine. Patient is been experiencing what I considered to be pretty severe, I guess reaction in term of aches and headache. This morning he woke up with the pounding headache, he kid described it as pounding and I just I guess I want to ask because everywhere I read, it says mild headaches are common and aches and I understand that but I guess understanding why this, this is considered somewhat as severe reaction or is there anything he can do to alleviate the symptom and should he, I guess my question is actually I guess my question also is should he not possibly get the second dose if he is experiencing such bad headaches with the first dose. When paraphrased the concern, reporter stated, Yes, basically we are thinking if can do to alleviate it and then he could not get the second dose, if you have any advice, I guess and just let you know he went to his health center in the college he went to get a COVID test and a flu test just to make sure he doesn't have actual Covid or flu and those report I got yesterday and so they told him that it's most likely still vaccine reaction. When probed for event start date, reporter stated, I would say a day after, I would say 09Apr2021, I guess it's phantom (not clarified) with symptom, the first day he was just tired, as far as the headache that started on the 09Apr2021. He (son) also passed out after the vaccine, which I also did that I didn't have Pfizer I (reporter) had Moderna and I had that same reaction, so I think that sometimes happens to some people but that's it happens also. When probed for vaccination anatomical site, reporter stated, Outside of the body I guess, I don't know that for sure. Patient still having the problem (event), and out event outcome, reporter stated, Yes, I think persisting, I think it varies. Patient has been taking Advil (Ibuprofen) and Tylenol (treatment). The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included influenza virus test: negative on 12Apr2021, sars-cov-2 test: negative on 12Apr2021. They told him that it's most likely still vaccine reaction. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of body ache (pain), tiredness (fatigue), pounding headache/headache symptoms are getting worst (headache). The outcome of the events was reported as unknown. QR Comment: Call handler not filed split case. Might have been split case. Information about the lot/batch number has been requested.

I took some Ibuprofen for the chills and rested pretty much all day 4/16/21- I felt better still sweating and sore but nothing out of the ordinary 4/17/21- A little tightness of the chest when I woke up but nothing crazy and then around 11 AM & 12 PM, I had serious chest pain. Exactly the way it was in 11/2019 (First episode of Myocarditis). Went the the ER for care 4/18/21- Ended up staying in the CICU (Cardiac ICU) for 2 days because I had more chest the morning of the 18th

Close
Pt was standing at check out when he became dizzy. He was sat in a chair and conversing with the nurse. His eyes rolled back and his head bent forward. Suddenly his head went back and his body was rigid and began to shake violently for approximately 20 seconds. He became conscious but disoriented about 45 secs after episode. EMS intervened and patient was assessed and monitored. Patient refused transport to hospital but said he would contact his physician.
22 2021-04-28 fainting severe blurred vision; shortness of breath; shaking; stiffness in his jaws; patient who fainted; Thi... Read more
Close
severe blurred vision; shortness of breath; shaking; stiffness in his jaws; patient who fainted; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable pharmacist. A 22-year-old male patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (BNT162B2, Solution for injection, Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on an unspecified date (received at the age of 22-years-old) as SINGLE DOSE for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history SVT (supraventricular tachycardia) (diagnosed with SVT by his cardiologist, however it was never confirmed), palpitation, and had fainted in two different situations in the past. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient fainted after the first dose of COVID-19 vaccine as soon as he stood up. He was unconscious for about 5 seconds. He was experiencing severe blurred vision, shortness of breath, shaking and stiffness in his jaws. He was 22 years old, 170 pounds, and 6 feet tall. He has history of palpitation. In the past he was diagnosed with SVT by his cardiologist, however it was never confirmed. In addition, he had fainted in two different situations in the past. Based on what the patient says, his health issues and why he faints was never fully understood by medical doctors. Outcome of the events was unknown. Information about Lot/batch number is requested.; Sender's Comments: A possible contributory effect of suspect BNT162B2 on event syncope cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Close
Patient received second Pfizer vaccine- no reaction to first vaccine. Patient placed on 30 minute observation for anaphylaxis to pistachio nuts. Received vaccine at 1440. At approximately 1450 patient complained of feeling bad and having a rapid heart rate; placed on pulse oximetry HR 103 (validated with radial pulse of 104/min) and O2 Sat 98%. Patient requested to void; patient stated he felt very anxious. Patient escorted to BR; became lightheaded enroute. Placed supine on sofa; legs elevated; encouraged slow deep breaths; with purse lips. VS- at 1455 = 184/80, 99%, 147 Reg/tachycardic. RR 24/min. Patient continued to feel more lightheaded with warm clammy skin. States his heart rate was worsening. VS at 1500 = 180/90, HR 145, RR 24 with unlabored breathing, o2Sat 98%. Arms tingling, lips pink, skin pale, no circumoral edema; no hives-speech controlled and unlabored. 911 called for further evaluation and clinical support. Patient agreed with plan of care. No LOC throughout event.

Close
After client's Phizer immunization he c/o dizziness. Client was asked if he had eaten, he states, "I did not". Nurse offered apple juice and water. After drinking the fluids he still c/o dizziness. Skin color pallor and was assisted to the floor and feet elevated. Applied ice pack to of neck. Client taken via w/c to medical tent staff provided more care. Client was placed on cardiac monitor it showed sinus arrhythmia w/ PACs . Both parents at client's side and agreed to have client sent to local hospital via EMS for further evaluation. Mom did report that client has had dizziness after receiving influenza vaccinations but did not report this at time of registration nor to vaccinator prior to receiving his 1st Phizer dose.

22 2021-05-05 fainting, pallor At around 4:30 PM patient had a syncope episode immediately after receiving first Covid dose of Pfiz... Read more
Close
At around 4:30 PM patient had a syncope episode immediately after receiving first Covid dose of Pfizer. Vaccinating nurse guided patient from chair to the floor with legs elevated, as patient verbalized feeling he was going to pass out. Patient verbalized he had both hands tingling and feeling numb. Patient also stated he was cold and appeared pale. Patient vitals b/p 140/92, pulse 89, O2 sat 100%. Patient was provided sweater and started to feel warm per patient. Symptoms began to resolve naturally and patient stated he was ready to sit up. Patient sat up against wall, and 5 minutes later sat up and transferred back into chair. Patient verbalized feeling well and no longer experiencing tingling/numbness in both hands. Pale skin was no longer observed.

positive cardiac enzymes; myocarditis; hypotension 3 days post 2nd vaccination who was admitted; left-sided chest pain; sob; diaphoresis; dizziness; paresthesia's to his hands; transient fever; chills; headache; body aches; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable physician. A 22-year-old male patient received the second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: UNKNOWN) via an unspecified route of administration, in the left arm on 17Apr2021 (Batch/Lot Number: ER8731) (at the age of 22-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included scoliosis from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing , depression from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing. There were no concomitant medications. The patient previously received the first dose of BNT162b2 on 22Mar2021ont at 08:45 in intramuscularly in the left arm (Lot Number: ER8727) for COVID-19 immunisation. The patient had not received any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID-19 vaccine. In Apr2021, the patient developed transient fever, chills, headache, and body aches which resolved 24 hours after his 2nd Pfizer vaccine, followed by left-sided chest pain, shortness of breath (SOB), diaphoresis, dizziness, paresthesias to his hands; hypotension 3 days post 2nd vaccination, on 20Apr2021, patient was admitted to hospital with positive cardiac enzymes, initially troponin T baseline at 663, 1 hour follow-up troponin T at 943 with troponin T delta at 42%. A 3-hour troponin T at 1913 with a troponin T3HR delta at 189% and CPK >1000 with the diagnosis of myocarditis. Covid screen was negative, Covid antibody was negative, HIV was negative, drug screen negative and rest of work up for other causes so far negative. On 20Apr2021, he was transferred to another hospital for further cardiac care. Treatments for the events included pressor, cardiac medications, cath, etc. Patient remains hospitalized. In Apr2021, the patient recovered from the events, body aches, headache, chills, transient fever. The patient had not recovered from the events, positive cardiac enzymes, myocarditis, hypotension, left-sided chest pain, SOB, diaphoresis, dizziness, and paresthesias to his hands.; Sender's Comments: A contributory role of BNT162B2 to the reported events cannot be fully excluded based on temporal relationship and lack of alternate explanation at this time. Case will be reassessed if additional information is received. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

Close
Seven days after received Dose 1 of Pfizer Covid-19 vaccine, right arm was swollen and uncomfortable, the next day was purple. He want to urgent care center who thought he had "Covid arm" and was put on prednisone. Arm worsened, so he went to ER in middle of night on 5/4/21. He was given shot of Lovenox and sent home to return in am for ultrasound. Ultrasound next morning showed right subclavian vein DVT. He was put on Eliquis and told to follow up with hematologist. He is working on getting appointment with a hematologist before flying home, where he will do further work up with hematologist there.

Pericarditis; cardiac enzymes have continued to go up, not down; myocarditis; ST evaluation on the EKG; Increased troponins and enzymes, troponin levels were elevated; Severe Chest Pain; Chest tightness; Lightheadedness; didn't sleep at all and were uncomfortable all night and had pain; didn't sleep at all and were uncomfortable all night and had pain; feeling really crappy and they thought it was like the flu; feeling really crappy and they thought it was like the flu; Tiredness and Fatigue; Headache; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's mother). A 22-year-old male patient received second dose BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation Solution for injection, Lot number EW0170 and expiration date not reported) via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 26Apr2021 10:00 as single dose for covid-19 immunization. Medical history included ongoing incredibly rare metabolic disorder. Concomitant medications were not reported. The patient previously took first dose of BNT162B2 on 05Apr2021, lot number: ER8735, administered in left shoulder for covid-19 immunization. The patient experienced tiredness and fatigue and headache on 26Apr2021,severe chest pain, chest tightness, lightheadedness, didn't sleep at all and were uncomfortable all night and had pain, feeling really crappy and they thought it was like the flu on 27Apr2021, pericarditis and Increased troponins and enzymes, troponin levels were elevated on 28Apr2021, cardiac enzymes have continued to go up, not down, ST evaluation on the EKG and myocarditis on an unspecified date. The reporter stated that she has identical twin sons that are 22 years old and they received their second dose on Monday morning, 26APR2021. Reporter states all 5 member of the family have gotten the Pfizer vaccine. Reporter states the twins were hospitalized on Wednesday with myocarditis/pericarditis, inflammation around the heart. Reporter states she knows there have been incidents reported. Reporter states she saw in Israel there were 62 out of unknown amount of people and some members of the military. Reporter states that two identical males with the DNA same, that had the vaccine at the same time, had the reaction at the same length of time, and it would go a long way to help understand the complication. Reporter added, they have the same lifestyle and live at the same house. The reporter stated that they received the vaccine at 10:00a.m. on 26APR2021 and then that evening they were felling pretty tired and fatigued and a little headachy, but nothing anyone worried about because they all had that same reaction. Call states Tuesday morning they were feeling really crappy and they thought it was like the flu and it would pass. Tuesday evening they said they didn't sleep at all and were uncomfortable all night and had pain. Wednesday the pain didn't go away., and the twins had ST evaluation on the EKG that they have. Reporter sated they decided to take one in and said the other twin had the same symptoms but he kept saying his wasn't as bad as his brothers because he didn't want to go to the hospital. Reporter states the doctor advised her to come back home and bring the other one in. Reporter states they had the same echo cardiogram, and their troponin levels were elevated. Caller states their cardiac enzymes have continued to go up, not down. Treatment: States they have them on Ibuprofen and Colchicine, which is the therapy for Pericarditis and they are using Toradol for breakthrough pain and severe chest pain. The seriousness of the event pericarditis was reported as (hospitalization, medically significant), cardiac enzymes have continued to go up, not down, myocarditis and ST evaluation on the EKG reported as medically significant and other events was reported as non-serious. The event pericarditis was resulted in emergency room visit. The outcome of the events pericarditis, cardiac enzymes have continued to go up, not down, severe chest pain, chest tightness, increased troponins and enzymes, troponin levels were elevated, tiredness and fatigue, was reported as not recovered feeling really crappy and they thought it was like the flu was reported as recovered on 27Apr2021, headache and lightheadedness recovered on 28Apr2021 myocarditis, ST evaluation on the EKG, didn't sleep at all and were uncomfortable all night and had pain was reported as unknown. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

myocarditis; Strange weird bilateral wrist pain severe; Pericarditis/inflammation around the heart; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient's mother). This consumer reported similar events for two patients (twins). This is the first of two reports. A 22-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: EW0170), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in the left arm, on 26Apr2021 10:00, as 2nd dose, single, for COVID-19 immunization, at a pharmacy/drug store. Medical history included ongoing rare metabolic disorder. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. Historical vaccine included the first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number: ER8735) received at age 22 years, on 05Apr2021, for COVID-19 immunisation. On 26Apr2021, the patient received the second dose of BNT162B2. In the evening of the same day, 26Apr2021, the patient experienced tiredness/fatigue, and headache. In the morning of 27Apr2021, the patient was feeling really crappy and they though it was like the flu and it would pass. In the evening of 27Apr2021, the patient didn't sleep at all and was uncomfortable all night and pain. On the same day, 27Apr2021, the patient had severe chest pain, chest tightness, and lightheadedness. On 28Apr2021, the pain didn't go away, and the twins had elevated ST evaluation on the EKG (electrocardiograph). ST evaluation was done by the reporter's husband who is a retired firefighter emergency medical technician. The reporter decided to take the patient to hospital and said that the other twin had the same symptoms but kept saying his wasn't as bad as his brother's because he did not want to go to the hospital. The doctor advised the reporter to bring the other twin. The twins had the same echo cardiogram on 28Apr2021 (unknown results). On 28Apr2021, their troponin levels were elevated, and their cardiac enzymes continued to go up. On the same day, 28Apr2021, the patient had a strange weird bilateral wrist pain severe. It was reported that the twins were hospitalized on 28Apr2021 with myocarditis/pericarditis and inflammation around the heart. Treatment for myocarditis/pericarditis included ibuprofen and colchicine; and Toradol for breakthrough pain. The reporter stated that the twins are two identical males with the same DNA, had the vaccine at the same time, had the reactions at the same length of time, have the same lifestyle and live at the same house. The reporter said it would go a long way if they help her understand the complication. The patient recovered "strange weird bilateral wrist pain severe" on 29Apr2021. 22 2021-05-17 pallor Client received his vaccination successfully without incident. However, as he stood by to observe hi... Read more
Close
Client received his vaccination successfully without incident. However, as he stood by to observe his friend receive his injection, client became dizzy and nauseous. Client walked over to trash can and threw up. Dr. present for assessment client. Client appeared pale and confirmed SOB, denied dizziness and nausea. VS: #1 BP: 83/45, P: 58, O2: 98%; #2 BP: 103/59; #3 BP: 122/86, P: 96. Dr. encouraged client to drink a bottle of water and a bottle of Gatorade. Client was compliant. After-which, client denied SOB, dizziness and nausea. Color returned to his face. Dr. released client to be observed for 15 more minutes under the observation tent. Client denied discomfort, dizziness and nausea at time of departure. Client was stable when he exited the premises.

Patient experienced extreme fatigue and increase seizure frequency, and a new type of generalized seizures. This began 2 days after the injection, worsened, and then resolved by day 16. Rescue medication (ativan) was used at home on 3 occasions. Patient had a video visit with neurologist, who ordered tests thatr returned mostly nirmal votes (elevated whites consistent with immune response to vaccination). Prior to this, patient had been mostly seizure-free since October 2020.

22 2021-05-25 chest pain, excessive bleeding Bleeding; Shortness of breath; Chest pain; Fever of 102; Viral myocarditis; This is a spontaneous re... Read more
Close
Bleeding; Shortness of breath; Chest pain; Fever of 102; Viral myocarditis; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (parent). A 22-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 2 via an unspecified route of administration assuming left arm, at age 22 years, on 05May2021 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0153) as 2ND DOSE, SINGLE for COVID-19 immunization. The patient's medical history was reported as no. Concomitant medications were not reported. Patient historically took first dose of BNT162B2 at age 22 years on 14Apr2021 for COVID-19 immunization. Reporter's son unfortunately appeared was hospitalized for adverse reaction (bleeding) and the physician told reporter to report this. Patient had has viral myocarditis of heart on an unspecified date on May2021 after he got his second dose on 05May2021. On 06May2021, patient started having symptoms of shortness of breath, chest pain and fever of 102 (unit: unknown) after the second dose, so he went to emergency room. Then on Friday , 07May2021, he ended up with bleeding, so admission date is 07May2021 and he is still in the hospital at the time of reporting, they don't know how long. Patient also underwent lab test and procedure that includes laboratory test on May2021, 2 weeks before, patient was fine until the second dose. The outcome of the events was unknown.

22 2021-05-25 fainting At 2:15pm patient was seated in the observation area after receiving vaccine. Patient was observed ... Read more
Close
At 2:15pm patient was seated in the observation area after receiving vaccine. Patient was observed while his head fell back and appeared to have fainted. Patient stated he had not eaten since yesterday. Vital signs were taken blood pressure noted at 117/56, pulse 62, 02 sat 99%. Patient was given a snack and verbalized he felt better. Vital signs were taken again fifteen minutes later and were noted at blood pressure 118/70, pulse :82, O2 99%. Patient was driven home by a friend.
