23 2021-06-27 pallor Immunization prep and administration were normal per protocol with no issues. Approximately 5 minute... Read more
Close
Immunization prep and administration were normal per protocol with no issues. Approximately 5 minutes after exiting the immunization room the patient approached the consultation window and stated he felt as if he were going to pass out. The pharmacist asked the patient to stay where he was and attempted to run around to the waiting area to help him sit. Before the pharmacist could make it to the patient he collapsed. The patient was in a seated position slumped against the wall, very pale, and profusely sweating. Pharmacist helped him to sit up straight and the patient started responding to questions. Other team members alerted EMS and got a water bottle for the patient. We moved him up to a chair and to the immunization area when he was able and waited for EMS to arrive. Patient was treated by EMS and left the building with them under his own power.

Patient describes generalized fatigue paired significant discomfort on the left side of his chest, below concentrated just below the breast. Denies any shortness of breath. Pain is described as a dull ache and began the day after the vaccine was administered and has yet to abate. Pain level does not fluctuate despite activity or lack of activity.
23 2021-06-29 nosebleed, pallor Patient walked to th chair for observation, within a minute patient leans forward then fell over cha... Read more
Close
Patient walked to th chair for observation, within a minute patient leans forward then fell over chair to his right and landed on face. I(pharmacist) ran to his side, I though he was having a seizure ,yelled to my technician to call 911 , but with further assesment I knew he didnt have a seizure, he fell on his face and his arms tucked under his abdomen, so he couldn't lift himself up properly. I sat him up,he was responsive to my questions, pulse was very faint and he started to sweat,pale,clammy . His nose was bleeding from the fall. Within 9 minutes paramedic showed up , took blood pressure and glucose check. After assesment they didn't feel it was necessary to go to emergency room. Patient didn't eat breakfast,got him apple juice and chocolate. This never happened to him before. His friend came to meet him and make sure he was ok, he left voluntarily ,and back to himself.

This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 23-year-old male patient received his first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot number: EP6955) via an unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 19Mar2021 at 08:45 (at the age of 23-years-old), as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history was not reported. The patient did not had any allergies to food, medications, or other products. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested positive for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other medications within 2 weeks of vaccination. On 19Mar2021 at 13:00, the patient experienced fast heartbeat, slight shortness of breath and nausea. The patient did not receive any treatment for the reported events. The adverse event did not result in a visit to the doctors or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The clinical outcome of the events fast heartbeat, slight shortness of breath and nausea was not recovered at the time of this report. No follow-up attempts are needed. No further information is expected.

Fever; his confusion started at 4:00AM today; he had bad diarrhea from 4:00AM-5:30AM.; his dry eyes started around 12:00PM yesterday; his stomach started to hurt between 8:30-9:00PM last night; He had muscle spams last night; not feeling well; his first Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine shot was in his left deltoid, and his left upper arm hurt; he couldn't sleep last night; about 4:00PM yesterday (4-7 hours after getting his Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine), he was feeling weird, and it had gotten worse; his heart beat was fast and his heart rate was up to 120bpm last night; his blood pressure was 160/98; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer or other non hcp (patient). A 23-year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, Formulation: Solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Deltoid Left on 16Mar2021 09:30 (Batch/Lot Number: EU6204; Expiration Date: 30Jun2021) as dose 1, single (age at vaccination 23-year-old) for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included ongoing attention deficit hyperactivity disorder Verbatim: ADHD , ongoing Blood pressure high ,anxiety, insomnia, muscle spasms, Panic attacks ,DUI accident , septorhinoplasty from 2020 to an unknown date. Reported he was prescribed Lyrica due to a DUI accident , rhinoplasty from 2020 to an unknown date He said he had a septorhinoplasty a year ago. Concomitant medications included gabapentin, carisoprodol ,bisoprolol fumarate (ZEBETA), amfetamine aspartate, amfetamine sulfate, dexamfetamine saccharate, dexamfetamine sulfate (ADDERALL) taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. The patient previously took trintellix for antidepressant therapy and experienced drug ineffective, trintellix for antidepressant therapy and experienced constipation, trintellix for antidepressant therapy and experienced nausea, clonazepam and experienced heart rate decreased. On16Mar2021, the patient experienced about 4:00pm yesterday (4-7 hours after getting his pfizer biontech covid-19 vaccine), he was feeling weird, and it had gotten worse, his heart beat was fast and his heart rate was up to 120bpm last night, his blood pressure was 160/98, his blood pressure was 160/98, his first Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine shot was in his left deltoid, and his left upper arm hurt, he couldn't sleep last night, his dry eyes started around 12:00PM yesterday, his stomach started to hurt between 8:30-9:00PM last night, Fever, He had muscle spasm last night and on 17Mar2021, patient experienced that his confusion started at 4:00AM today, he had bad diarrhea from 4:00AM-5:30AM. It was reported, He was diagnosed with ADHD between 2012-2014. He said he took a generic Adderall 20mg Immediate Release tablet, twice a day (20mg in the morning & 20mg at 2:00PM). He said he had been on Adderall for about 8 years. His muscles spasms were from a prior accident he had. He said he was hit by a car going 48mph while he was riding his bicycle. He got the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine shot yesterday (16Mar2021). He said he was not feeling well. He said about 4:00PM yesterday (4-7 hours after getting his Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine), he was feeling weird, and it had gotten worse. He said his heart beat was fast, he had high blood pressure, his stomach hurt, he had muscle spasms, he could not sleep, he had diarrhea, a fever, dry eyes, and left upper arm pain. He said he was normally healthy, and did not have the COVID-19 Virus before. He said he wanted to report his symptoms to Pfizer. He had ADHD and high blood pressure. He clarified he took his blood pressure last night and his blood pressure was 160/98. He said he took his blood pressure medication, Zebeta, and his anxiety medicine, Clonazepam, at the same time last night. He said he takes Zebeta (Bisoprolol Fumarate) for his high blood pressure. He said he takes 1/2 of a Zebeta 5mg tablet (2.5mg) once a day, as needed, a few times a week when his blood pressure was high. He said the Zebeta was not like Propranolol. He said his blood pressure was fine. He said the Zebeta also lowered his heart rate. He clarified he takes Zebeta and all his other medications at the same time, and that his heart rate may have been lowered by the Clonazepam he took. He said he takes a Clonazepam 0.5mg tablet twice a day. He said he normally takes 1mg Clonazepam, but can take a Clonazepam 0.5mg tablet, as needed. He stated he had been taking the Clonazepam for as long as Adderall. He said he started taking Adderall first. He clarified he started taking Clonazepam for bad nightmares. He said he had tried all other types of medications for his nightmares. He said he started the Clonazepam in 2014 for his bad nightmares, and now the Clonazepam was prescribed for anxiety and panic attacks. He said he sees a therapist once a week. He said he checked his "pulse ox" last night, and his pulse ox was good. He said his heart rate was up to 120bpm last night. He said he kept a watch on his heart rate, and his heart rate was around 100-110, which was higher than normal. He said his heart rate was still elevated while he was laying down, stating his current heart rate was 113bpm. He said when he exercised his heart rate normally goes up to between 140-160bpm. Clarified he woke up at 4:00AM this morning (17Mar2021) with diarrhea. He said he had bad diarrhea from 4:00AM-5:30AM. He said he ate something for breakfast and took a fiber gummie. He said the fiber gummie would help harden his stool, and he did not want to take anything to cause constipation. He said he had not had diarrhea since about 5:30AM. He provided the fiber gummie product information as: Fiber Well Fit Supplement 5grams fiber. He had a fever. He stated he was going to check his temperature while he was speaking with the Pfizer agent, but did not provide his body temperature. He clarified a weird symptom he experienced after getting the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine was dry eyes. He said his dry eyes started around 12:00PM yesterday (16Mar2021). He said he bought Liquid Tears eye drops that were either (Company name) brand or (Company name) brand. He said the Liquid Tears was a saline eye drop with no medication in it. His stomach started to hurt between 8:30-9:00PM last night. He said he had a normal dinner and had taken his daily medications at 6:00PM yesterday. He was confused, too. He clarified his confusion started at 4:00AM today (17Mar2021). He said he did not charge his phone overnight, which was not normal, and a lot of other weird things. He said he knows it was not his medications causing his confusion because he had not started any new medications. He said he had been taking the same medications for quite some time. He got everyone (his mother and father) signed up for the COVID-19 Vaccine, and he was the only one experiencing issues. He was prescribed Lyrica due to a DUI accident, saying he knows Lyrica was a Pfizer medication. He clarified he was on Gabapentin first. He said he was on the maximum dose of Gabapentin (either 2000mg or 6000mg) in 2016. He said he was then was put on Lyrica. He said the Lyrica did not work as well as the Gabapentin. He clarified the Lyrica 75mg was stronger than the Gabapentin, and he didnot like how tired he was while taking the Lyrica 75mg. He said he took the Lyrica 75mg for a month or 2, and then was put back on Gabapentin. He said he was no longer taking either the Gabapentin or Lyrica. He said it was 6-7 years ago that he had taken Lyrica 75mg. He said he knew beforehand what the COVID-19 Vaccine side effects were, like chills, but diarrhea was not on the list of COVID-19 Vaccine side effects. He was not immunosuppressed. He said he had a septorhinoplasty a year ago. He could not sleep last night. He said he had diarrhea. He said his arm (left) hurts, but he does not care about that. He clarified he had his first Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine shot in his left deltoid, and his left upper arm hurt. He said his left upper arm felt worse than getting a tetanus shot. He said he had really sensitive skin, and was white as a ghost. He said he did not have any swelling on his left upper arm and had put ice on his left upper arm earlier. He said he know, and intramuscular shot takes a few hours to get into the blood stream, and he did not know if the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine passed through the blood brain barrier. He had muscle spams last night. He clarified he had the muscle spasms prior to the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine. He said the muscles spasms were from a prior accident he had. He said he took one SOMA (Carisoprodol) last night (16Mar2021), clarifying the Carisoprodol was prescribed for his muscle spasms. He said he was prescribed a low dose of Carisoprodol for his muscle spasms. He said he usually takes Carisoprodol 250mg tablet up to twice a day (250mg at midday & 250mg at night). He said he had been taking Carisoprodol for 3 years. He said he took the 1 Carisoprodol 250mg tablet with the Zebeta (beta blocker) last night and he had no crazy muscle spasms. He said the Carisoprodol was dispensed in a pharmacy bottle and didn't have the NDC, Lot and Expiration Date listed. He had a complete blood panel a few months ago, and everything was fine. He had anxiety, ADHD and insomnia, saying that was why the takes his medications. He stated he did not take his Adderall this morning. He said he takes a generic Adderall 20mg Immediate Release tablet, twice a day (20mg in the morning & 20mg at 2:00PM). He said he had been on Adderall for about 8 years. He said the generic Adderall 20mg Immediate Release tablet was dispensed in a pharmacy bottle and had no NDC, Lot & Expiration Date listed. He does not drink coffee, and wanted to make sure that was noted on the report. He takes an Amitriptyline 50mg tablet at night. He stated he has been taking Amitriptyline 50mg for about 3-4 years. He said the Amitriptyline 50mg was dispensed in a pharmacy bottle, and he does not have the NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date. He said before the Amitriptyline, he used to take a Trintellix 20mg tablet once a day. He said the Trintellix 20mg was made by Takeda and was a terrible anti-depressant. He said he took Trintellix for about a year and a half, and the Trintellix did not do too much, he said the Trintellix was not working. He said the Trintellix gave him terrible constipation and nausea. He said he still had 4 Trintellix manufacturers bottles at his father house. He said the Trintellix 20mg was probably expired, and he had kept the Trintellix 20mg because it cost about $500 a bottle. He could not take SSRIs, like Paxil, Sertraline, and Lexapro. He said the SSRIs caused problems like sexual dysfunction. He said he does not have the NDC Number, Lot Numbers, and Expiration Dates for the SSRIs he used in the past. He said he was still with his pediatrician at the time he was taking SSRIs, and had since thrown out all his SSRI prescription bottles. He had some questions about the ingredients in the Pfizer BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included blood pressure measurement: 160/98 on 16Mar2021 , heart rate:100-110, heart rate:113, heart rate: 140 on an unknown date, heart rate: 120 on 16Mar2021 bpm , complete blood panel: everything was fine on an unknown date, oxygen saturation: good on 16Mar2021. Therapeutic measures were taken as a result of events includes Gabapentin, Carisoprodol, Clonazepam, Zebeta, Adderall. The clinical outcome for events his heart beat was fast and his heart rate was up to 120bpm last night, he had bad diarrhea from 4:00AM-5:30AM, his dry eyes started around 12:00PM yesterday was recovering and outcome for events hypertension, his stomach started to hurt between 8:30-9:00PM last night, Fever ,feeling unwell was unknown while rest of events was not recovered. Description of Product Complaint: He was on Gabapentin, and then was put on Lyrica. He said the Lyrica did not work as well as the Gabapentin. He clarified the Lyrica 75mg was stronger than the Gabapentin, and he did not like how tired he was while taking the Lyrica 75mg. He said he took the Lyrica 75mg for a month or 2, and then was put back on Gabapentin. He said he was no longer taking either the Gabapentin or Lyrica. He said he had taken the Lyrica 75mg 6-7 years ago, and he no longer had the prescription to provide the Lyrica NDC, Lot, and Expiration Dates. He said in 2016 he was on the maximum dose of Gabapentin, and no longer had the Gabapentin NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date. He used to take a Trintellix 20mg tablet before he started taking Amitriptyline 50mg. He stated the Trintellix was a terrible anti-depressant. He said he took Trintellix for about a year and a half, and the Trintellix did not do too much. He said the Trintellix was not working. He said the Trintellix gave him terrible constipation and nausea. He said the Trintellix was dispensed in a manufacturer bottle, and he did not have the NDC, Lot, and Expiration Date to provide. He said he still had 4 Trintellix manufacturer bottles at his fathers house. He said the Trintellix was probably expired, and he had kept the Trintellix because it cost about $500 a bottle. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Patient passed out as he attempted to stand roughly 15 minutes after receiving his first dose of the Pfizer COVID vaccination. Patient hit his head on a door as he fell. Patient was given water and allowed to lie down for several minutes until he felt able to sit. Patient was then monitored until a family member could pick him up. Estimated greater than 30 minutes.
23 2021-07-27 nosebleed Abdominal pain; Diarrhea; Nose bleeds that took a long time to stop and that were quite heavy; Inten... Read more
Close
Abdominal pain; Diarrhea; Nose bleeds that took a long time to stop and that were quite heavy; Intense nausea; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer, the patient. A 23-year-old male patient received the first dose of BNT162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE; Lot Number: UNKNOWN) via unspecified route of administration in the left arm on 04Apr2021 at 13:00 (at the age of 23-years-old) as a single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included asthma, functional dyspepsia, anxiety, depression, obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) and emetophobia. The patient was allergic to tree nuts. Concomitant medications included amitriptyline (MANUFACTURER UNKNOWN) on an unknown date and for an unspecified indication. Prior to the vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within four weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. On 05Apr2021 at 11:30, 24 hours after the vaccination, patient had diarrhea and further experienced multiple nose bleeds that took a long time to stop and were quite heavy, intense nausea and abdominal pain. The events did not result in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, and emergency room/department or urgent care. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The clinical outcome of events multiple nose bleeds, intense nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea were resolving at the time of this report. No follow-up attempts are needed; information about lot number cannot be obtained.

24 2021-01-07 loss of consciousness, pallor Patient walked out fine after receiving the vaccine. Was able to walk up to the registration desk an... Read more
Close
Patient walked out fine after receiving the vaccine. Was able to walk up to the registration desk and carried a conversation with the staffs. He sits down in the waiting area to be monitored. We heard his phone dropped, looked up and saw him tilting over on the right side was about to fall off the chair. Staff grabbed him and held him back onto the seat, proceeded to picked up his right arm and held him in place. He looked unconscious while staff held him. He came back to his senses approximately 10 seconds later. After he regained consciousness, staff took his blood pressure which was 111/44, SpO2 was 100%, and heart rate 58. Patient looked pale but not critical. Conversed with our staff and stated that this has happened before when he receives other vaccinations. Patient's father is a physician and reported that the patient is scared of needles and did not need any medications from anaphylaxis kit or crash cart. We gave him water and he left after sitting for a while.

He developed episodes of rapid heart rate which has caused shortness of breath during the night. These episodes continue today. He is going to the Emergency Room.

Close
Patient started developing throat swelling, shortness of breath, and paresthesia of the left upper extremity and neck approximately 10-15 minutes after receiving the first dose of the Pfizer Covid Vaccine. Visual examination detected slight facial and periorbital swelling but no posterior oropharyngeal edema. Patient was slightly hypertensive (150/93) and tachycardic (105 bpm) upon arrival in the ED. Patient had no rash or urticaria. Diphenhydramine 50 mg, famotidine 20 mg, and lactated ringers administered IV. Patient was observed for several hours in the ED, and discharged in stable condition.

At 1625, call placed to outside EMS. Patient complained of feeling disorientated after first dose of vaccine. After second dose patient complained of feeling tightness in his chest, some shortness of breath, and an itch in his throat. Patient on EMS monitor with a HR of 90 and oxygen saturation of 100%. EMS offered patient IV Benadryl which patient refused. EMS activated outside EMS service and was taken to ER. Patient agreed to plan of care He was transported to the emergency department via ambulance at 1635.

Close
unable to bear weight on legs/could not walk or bear weight; shortness of breath; fever; nausea/nauseous; pain in left shoulder radiating to left chest 4/10; Chest pain at the side 5/10; tried to get up to walk but was very shaky and could not get up to walk/unable to walk/could not walk or bear weight; dizzy/light headed; almost instantly was sharp stinging in injection site; tried to get up to walk but was very shaky and could not get up to walk; WBC 14000, no unit of measurement, normal was 11000; This is a spontaneous report received from a contactable pharmacist and consumer (patient). A 24-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; Solution for injection; lot number: EL3302 and expiry date: May2021), via intramuscular route on deltoid left on 25Jan2021 15:57 at 0.3 ml single for COVID-19 immunization at hospital. Patient did not receive other vaccine in four weeks and in last two weeks. Patient's medical history, family medical history and concomitant medications were reported as none. Patient had no known allergies. Historical vaccine included BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot number; EL1284; expiry date: Apr2021) via intramuscular route on left deltoid on 04Jan2021 at 10:45 AM for COVID-19 immunization; Hep B Adult Energix-BPFS (HEPATITIS B VACCINE, lot number; 2793Z) on left deltoid on 12Jan2021. Patient received 3 previous doses of HEPATITIS B VACCINE. It was reported that, the patient complained of pain in left shoulder radiating to left chest 4/10 and nausea immediately following injection, Chest pain at the side 5/10 (on 25Jan2021 at 14;00, after second dose of COVID vaccine). Taken to the ED (emergency department) via wheelchair at 1700. No rash, no swelling of lips/tongue or throat. No treatment was given for the events nausea and pain in left shoulder. No COVID was presented prior vaccination and post vaccination. Patient stated almost instantly was sharp stinging in injection site, he felt nauseous, dizzy, light headed, and had chest pains, he tried to get up to walk but was very shaky and could not get up to walk on25Jan2021 at 14:00. Stated that he was wheeled to the emergency room, he was admitted to the emergency room for almost 8 hours. Clarified he was not admitted to the hospital that he did leave that night. He was able to stumble out of the emergency room to go home. Clarified he got the vaccine on 25Jan2021 (his second dose). Stated he woke up next morning on 26Jan2021, unable to bear weight on legs, chest pain, and shortness of breath, fever. HCP prescribed Arnuity for the chest pain. WBC 14000, no unit of measurement, normal was 11000. Patient was unable to walk, nausea, dizzy, lightheaded and having some chest pain and patient was not hospitalized, spent 8 hours in Emergency Room. Outcome of the event fever was recovered on 27Jan2021; nausea, dizziness, was recovered on 31Jan2021; Unable to walk, lower extremities weakness of, shortness of breath was recovering; the event chest pain was not recovered; and for remaining events it was unknown.

24 2021-02-25 fainting, loss of consciousness On Friday morning 2/26/21, we had a 24 yo male patient who had an anaphylactic reaction after his fi... Read more
Close
On Friday morning 2/26/21, we had a 24 yo male patient who had an anaphylactic reaction after his first dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine. He was instructed to wait on the chair, but had stood up at some point but was still in the pharmacy waiting area. A team member noticed he had fainted and called for help. The pharmacist on duty and immunizing tech came immediately to help him to a chair. At that point, he was conscious and talking. Then within a few seconds he started convulsing on the chair and lost consciousness. His eyes were open and head tilted back. A team member immediately called 911 and pharmacist administered 0.3mg Epipen to the thigh. We removed his face mask to check his breathing and also to allow him to breathe more easily. We also adjusted his head more forward and he started coughing. After about 15 seconds, he regained consciousness and could answer questions. EMT arrived soon after and took over. Patient does not have allergies or any history of anaphylaxis/ severe reaction from vaccinations. He did express some fear of needles and did not eat breakfast yet.
24 2021-02-26 pallor Pt. c/o lightheadedness and dizziness. Reports "this happens every time I get a vaccine or injection... Read more
Close
Pt. c/o lightheadedness and dizziness. Reports "this happens every time I get a vaccine or injection". Denies c/o itching, swelling, or rash. No SOB. Pt. pale. Moved to reclining chair and symptoms quickly resolved. BP 98/68, HR 76, O2 SAT 98% RA. Pt. drank H20, remained alert and oriented to person place and time. Repeat BP 104/72. Checked by NP and cleared for discharge.

Pt released 30 min post vaccine pt ambulating out of the facility and declined any further treatment

Close
VAR form was reviewed with patient prior to vaccinating. It was noted that he has a history of syncopal episodes with vaccines. Patient was advised to sit for 15 minutes after receiving the vaccine so we could observe him. After receiving the vaccine, patient was escorted to observation chair. Immunizer advised registration technician that patient had a history of fainting, so to keep a watchful eye on him. Patient said I need to get some ice and stood up before we were able to advise him to sit and we would assist him. Upon standing, patient had syncopal episode. Patient did not has loss of consciousness an denied any injury from the fall. Patient was assisted back to the observation chair and monitored for the next 15 minutes.
24 2021-03-07 hypertension, heart rate increased, chest discomfort Minutes after receiving my vaccine my left arm began to go numb with a full head headache following ... Read more
Close
Minutes after receiving my vaccine my left arm began to go numb with a full head headache following soon after. I was then moved to the observation area where my chest got tight, I had difficulty breathing and my temperature fluctuated which made me shake. When hives began to show on my face, neck and ears the on-site medical staff gave me a shot of epinephrine and Benadryl and put me on oxygen, during this time an ambulance was called by the staff. When I got to the hospital my heart rate and blood pressure was high, I was given oral steroids to help my anaphylaxis. For days after being released from the hospital I continued to have deep muscle pain and weakness in my left arm as well as a very strong headache

Close
The vaccine was received through hospital at Community Health. Pt states that after he got his first Pfizer COVID shot 2 weeks ago he began having excessive fatigue, it got better after a week but pt states still "extremely tired". Pt states that he also had a rash develop the day after the vaccine and it was on his chest and back initially but has spread all over his body. The rash is not pruritic but is very tender to touch. Pt states increase amount of migraines, almost daily. Aleve helps the HAs. He had migraines years ago but they had virtually resolved. He also reports intermittent joint pain in the last few days and some central chest discomfort with deep breaths. He has a hx of chronic IBS like bowel issues after experiencing an infection abroad that took 4 rounds of antibiotics to treat. Treatment: 5 day course of Prednisone 20 mg BID. Tylenol 100 mg TID for aches and HAs. Follow up with PCP.

Nausea and Headaches occurred about 5 hours after the injection, since then they have come and gone periodically, usually lasting about 30 minutes, then going away for a few hours. I have been experiencing tightness in my chest and dyspnea upon exertion since about noon, Tuesday, March 23. NSAIDs have helped relieve some discomfort. Last night, I woke up with racing heart palpitations and tingling in my extremities. Today, I have experienced a sore neck and cramps in my legs, tingling in my extremities, and chest tightness with tachycardia. I have spent the week studying for an exam on Friday, so I plan on going to urgent care afterward.

24 2021-03-24 fainting Patient was given the 1st dose of the Pfizer- BioNtech vaccine and was told to wait in observation a... Read more
Close
Patient was given the 1st dose of the Pfizer- BioNtech vaccine and was told to wait in observation and few minutes later the patient fainted and had what appeared to be a seizure. Pharmacists onsite responded immediately and EMS was called.
24 2021-03-29 fainting got up about 5:15AM to use the restroom, parents heard a huge crash and we came running - he had col... Read more
Close
got up about 5:15AM to use the restroom, parents heard a huge crash and we came running - he had collapsed and fainted in the bathroom, against the toilet, (with shelves and glass crashing down him - he grabbed the shelves and had a few cuts and bruises), was unresponsive, no color in his face, could not stand or move, could barely speak - slumped against the toilet. Parents called 911 and tried to get him to respond, he was listless but opened his eyes - we lifted him and moved him to recliner in living room. Fire Dept./EMT's arrived within a few minutes, blood pressure was 87/43, glucose was normal. EMT's determined it was a reaction to the vaccine and asked if he wanted an ambulance or if parents should drive him for further care - he opted for us to drive him (his Mom called the Dr. on staff first - Dr. said it was a reaction to the vaccine and he should not get a 2nd dose). Patient's Dad took him to Urgent Care - they ran an EKG (normal), and stayed there until his blood pressure showed (although still low) normal/acceptable again. I looked at the CDC website for covid anaphylaxis and it appears it was an allergic reaction (cardiovascular), on the site, he had these symptoms: "Cardiovascular: fainting; hypotension (abnormally low blood pressure); pallor. ... Symptoms of anaphylaxis often occur within 15-30 minutes of vaccination, though it can sometimes take several hours for symptoms to appear."

24yo male with witnessed syncopal event with 45s LOC after receiving vaccine. Pt reported history of aversion and sycopal events with needles and blood. Pt was evaluated, monitored, and given oral nutrition/hydration. He improved after 20min and was released.

24 2021-04-01 pallor, loss of consciousness On Friday, April 4, 2021 client (DOB 5/3/1996) received his first dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (LOT... Read more
Close
On Friday, April 4, 2021 client (DOB 5/3/1996) received his first dose of Pfizer COVID vaccine (LOT # EW0150, EXP 7/2021) at approximately 12:56pm. Per EMT report: at 1:06pm, client fell out of chair, landed on his left knee and regained consciousness immediately. Upon assessment, client stated his left knee pain was a 3 out of 10 scale. At 1:07pm, client was sat in the zero-gravity chair in supine position and given a bottle of water. Client stated he "felt pressure in ears-mainly right ear." EMT & 2nd EMT coached client to breathe normally. At 1:09pm vitals were taken: BP: 120/70, HR: 52, RR: 10, O2 sat: 95%, skin: pale, moist, cool, eyes: PERRLA, LOC: A&O x4. Lead RN was notified and advised vitals be taken every 5 minutes for an additional 30 minutes. At 1:13pm vitals were retaken: BP: 120/70, HR: 69, RR: 12, O2 sat: 94%, eyes: PERRLA, skin, pale, moist, cool, LOC: A&O x4. On assessment, client stated he has no history of fainting, no allergies, and not taking any medication. Client stated he had a small amount of food and water intake and was not currently experiencing nausea. At 1:20pm, client stated the pressure in his ear subsided and was experiencing no headache, light-headedness or dizziness. At 1:25pm vitals were retaken: BP: 120/70, HR: 69, O2: 98%, skin: warm, pink, dry, LOC: A&Ox4. At 1:35pm, vitals: BP: 120/78, HR: 72, RR: 12, O2: 96%. Client was lowered to sitting position in gravity chair. No changes in vital signs were assessed by EMTs. At 1:40pm one final set of vitals were taken: BP: 120/76, HR: 66, RR: 13, O2 sat: 97%, eyes: PERRLA, A&O x4, skin: pink, warm & dry. At 2:15pm, client was able to safely stand up. No further interventions indicated. Client was educated by Lead RN & EMT on signs and symptoms of adverse reactions and when to go to the ED/call MD. Client was also encouraged to sign-up. Client left vaccination site at approximately 2:15pm with a steady gait. A family member was able to pick him up and drive him home.
24 2021-04-01 fainting 24-year-old white male visited the vaccine clinic this morning. At 09:36 Am patient received the fir... Read more
Close
24-year-old white male visited the vaccine clinic this morning. At 09:36 Am patient received the first dose 0.3ml of Pfizer vaccine lot #ER8734 to his left Deltoid . At 09:46 AM While patient in the observation area, he complained of feeling light headed and not feeling to well. While assessing the patient, he had a syncopial episode with eyes fixed, jerking body movement for 5-10 seconds. Patient immediately assisted the floor , all safety measure provided. Oxygen applied. VS: BP 100/60, o2 sat 98% . Pulse 78, resp 18. Patient denies any medical condition. However, he sated" I usually pass out when I take shots" . 10:00 Am sitting Blood pressure 110/72. Patient condition improved, and assisted back to chair. At 10:05AM still complaining of light headedness and requested to lay back to floor. Blood Pressure supinely 100/80. Patient stated " i feel much better when I am laying down. Water provided as requested. Pos t po fluid patient voiced feel much better. Sitting blood pressure rechecked at 10:14 am BP 110/80. Patient assisted back to chair. Closed observation maintained. 10:29 am Patient stated " I am feeling 100% of myself now, standing blood pressure 130/80. Patient denies any further light headed. Patient instructed to follow with his Primary Physician also his was referred for his second dose of vaccine . Patient left clinic in stable condition.

Pfizer COVID-19 Vaccine Patient presents today for medical observation of feeling dizzy, sweaty and pre-syncopal episode s/p COVID - 19 vaccine # 1. Patient was monitored for a total of 30 minutes. Patients vital signs initially SBP in the 80's and HR in 40's, patient placed in Trendelenburg position with increase in BP to 109/76 and HR 68. Denies feeling of chest tightness, swelling of the face/lips/tongue and pruritus. Patient reports resolution of symptoms prior to being discharged.
24 2021-04-04 chest pain This 24 yo male reports receipt of his first Pfizer Covid vaccine lot #EN6199 to his Left deltoid. ... Read more
Close
This 24 yo male reports receipt of his first Pfizer Covid vaccine lot #EN6199 to his Left deltoid. He advised within <15 minutes following the vaccine he sensed the left side of his neck was swelling. He notified Immunization staff who brought him to the ER via w/c. He stated the ERMD did not perceive/palpate any swelling or nodules, and treated him with IV Benadryl with resolution of s/s. He did not require any other doses of benadryl. He received his 2nd Pfizer covid vaccine on 3/30/2021 lot#ER8734 to right deltoid. He stated within 15 min again, he had the sensation of throat stiffness (as if muscles really tight/tensed) and this made it difficult to breath and caused his chest to hurt. He was taken to the ER again and given Benadryl again with resolution of symptoms. He was released later without any reoccurrence of symptoms. He states he went to work on 3/31 where he began to feel bad/achy-feverish. Today he had a fever (not taken), total body aches but mostly to his left hand. He reports feeling fatigue and unable to do normal AM routine of working out. He could only stretch today. He denies any trauma, recent illness, difficulty breathing, swallowing, eating, ha, n/v/d, or other symptoms.

Immediate Effects: 10 Minutes - Heat Flash, Feeling of Fainting, Gasp for Air (Lasted 20 seconds) Post-Immediate Effects: 45 Minutes - Extreme Difficulty Breathing while driving; Symptoms of Panic Attack Set in (Never Had a Panic Attack Prior - Arms, Legs and Lower Jaw was tingling and numb; Could not speak; Difficulty in Dialing 911 from rapid finger movement.) Received Medical Attention from EMT and chose to go home when severe symptoms subsided after 20 minutes. Long Term Effects: Day 2 to Present: Difficulty breathing, confusion, unable to do any physical task (walking up stairs) without being dizzy, disoriented and gasping for air, pain near arteries in neck, knee and heart - with each pulse. On 4/12/2021 - Urgent Care Visit - Long Term Symptoms Present. PulseOx read 96; Tested Negative for COVID-19. Nurse Practitioner recommended ER if condition worsened. On 4/17/2021 - ER Visit - Severe Long Term Symptoms Present. Blood Panel Done; Chest X-Ray, EKG, Brain MRI. ER Doctor recommended seeing neurologist, immunologist and cardiologist.

24 2021-04-20 loss of consciousness Patient received first vaccination dose and immediately reported feeling faint and "blacking out" to... Read more
Close
Patient received first vaccination dose and immediately reported feeling faint and "blacking out" to nurse administrating vaccination. Nurse instructed patient to lay down and prop legs on chair. At 4:18pm nurse altered pharmacist of patient feeling faint. Pt with pulse of 58 BP 112/59, patient with sweat on brow, reporting no issues with breathing or other allergic symptoms. Pharmacist evaluating patient found that patient had had a large meal, had exercised for ~25 minutes, and may be dehydrated. Pharmacist provider patient with bottle of water, patient refusing snacks and or food. 4:22 patient reports feeling 80% better, was able to sit down. Pt denies EMS services, and discloses to pharmacist that while he is not afraid of needles; however, he has generalized anxiety and believes it may have contributed to event, pulse 66, BP 119/59. 4:30 pulse 56, BP 119/66. 4:38 pulse 53, BP 114/65. 4:53 pulse 52, BP 116/59 patient reports feeling fine. 4:55 patient leaves pharmacy to shop in store. 5:03 Patient comes back to pharmacy and signed that he is doing well, pharmacist requests call when patient makes it home safely. 5:23 Patient calls from home reporting he is okay.
24 2021-04-20 inflammation of the pericardium, inflammation of the heart muscle, troponin increased, chest pain DIAGNOSTIC STUDIES: 1. Chest x-ray that was normal. 2. CT angiography of the chest showing no abnorm... Read more
Close
DIAGNOSTIC STUDIES: 1. Chest x-ray that was normal. 2. CT angiography of the chest showing no abnormalities. 3. Echocardiogram showing no significant abnormalities. HOSPITAL COURSE: A 24-year-old male, primary care patient, received a second dose of the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccination 3 days prior to admission. Following this, he had a fever, chills, body aches, and then developed severe chest pain. The pain was worse lying flat, better when sitting up and leaning forward and worse with a deep breath. He had gone to an urgent Care and was recommended going to the emergency room. The patient's troponins were elevated and his EKG was fairly classic for pericarditis. He was felt to have probably viral myopericarditis and was admitted for observation. He was placed on aspirin and colchicine. He seems stable from Cardiology to be discharged on this regimen as well as symptomatic treatment. It was not known whether the COVID vaccine was implicated with this or not. DISCHARGE DISPOSITION: CONDITION: Stable and improved. MEDICATIONS: 1. Colchicine 0.6 mg b.i.d. 2. Aspirin 650 mg t.i.d. 3. Oxycodone/acetaminophen 5/325 mg every 4 hours p.r.n. for pain. 4. Zofran 4 mg sublingual q.8 hours p.r.n. for nausea. DIET: Regular. ACTIVITY: As tolerated. FOLLOWUP: With Cardiology on May 3rd. If worsened pain, shortness of breath, or high fever, return for evaluation sooner. In which case, steroids may be administered.

Client received vaccine and started to feel lightheaded, dizzy and nauseous. Client exited car for fresh air and symptoms worsened. Client lowered himself to the ground to prevent falling. Fire Rescue arrived to evaluate patient. Client diaphoretic, pale, but A+Ox3. Vitals all wnl, symptoms began to resolve as client rested and hydrated. Client was able to ambulate independently back to his vehicle where he continued to recover. Client declined transport for further evaluation and stated he felt better. Per Fire Rescue no further evaluation needed at scene. Client released at 10:45am.

24 2021-04-28 loss of consciousness fell out completely; passed out/fell off at the store; feeling dizzy; had terrible headache; chills;... Read more
Close
fell out completely; passed out/fell off at the store; feeling dizzy; had terrible headache; chills; weak with shilling; i started sweating; I'm still feeling very sick; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 24-year-old male patient received first dose of bnt162b2 ((PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE; lot EW0158; Expiration Date: Jul2021), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in left arm on 14Apr2021 12:00 as single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Medical history included eye allergy. Concomitant medication included amoxicillin sodium, clavulanate potassium (AMOXICILINA CLAV) taken for eye allergy from 12Apr2021. On 14Apr2021, he received the first dose of the vaccine about an hour ago and waited five minutes and went to the bathroom. He had a severe reaction while patient was in the bathroom, he started to feel dizzy, had a terrible headache and chills. He walked out of the bathroom at the store and fell out completely in front of the pharmacists. The patient also experienced weak with shilling (as reported) and started sweating. The pharmacists called 911 and the responders checked his vitals and blood pressure and all of that and everything was fine. Patient clarified he passed out completely for almost 5 minutes. Patient stayed there with everyone until, they were waiting to see how he was doing. He reported he was feeling much better now, still feel a bit dizzy, not 100% but not as bad as when it happened. It has improved and he definitely felt terrible at the time. He was monitoring himself at home to see if he notices something weird going on. He does not have a headache right now and was feeling much better. When he was having the effect, he was mentally sharp, and knew what was going on. He thought about letting himself walk outside the bathroom so he could be seen. He didn't lose track of what was going on and body reacted adversely. He remembered stuff and everything and he felt good. Patient stated the chills went away; however, would not say they went away completely, he was recovering. The events did not require a visit to emergency room or physician office and the paramedic said it was not necessary right now because all the vitals and everything else seemed fine. There was no therapy received for the events. There were no additional vaccines administered on same date of the vaccine and no other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to vaccination. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 and since the vaccination, the patient had not been tested for COVID-19. Outcome of events feeling dizzy, terrible headache, chills was recovering; still feeling very sick was unknown; outcome of the rest of events was not recovered.
24 2021-04-28 pallor After receiving the Pfizer vaccine the patient had a small drop of blood. I grabbed a cotton swab an... Read more
Close
After receiving the Pfizer vaccine the patient had a small drop of blood. I grabbed a cotton swab and asked the patient to hold still. He said that he did not handle blood well. About 5 minutes after receiving the vaccine the patient stated that he was feeling like he needed to lay down. I laid him down in the booth area and obtained a BP 102/48, HR 43 normal cuff, supine position, left arm. Technician and I then elevated the patient's feet on a chair as the patient was appearing pale. Technician and I placed a ice pack on the back of the patient's neck as he was feeling hot/clammy. After about 15 minutes the patient was feeling much better and his blood pressure returned to normal - 108/55 HR 53, normal cuff, supine position, left arm. Patient stated that he was a avid cardio exerciser. The patient was then instructed to wait another 10 minutes and then he checked in before leaving and said he was feeling great.

Patient was pale and said they felt hot and nauseous, He was provided water and a trash can. His companion said the patient hadn't eaten all day and went to get him something to eat. After the patient rested, drank some more water and ate part of a sandwich they felt better and were ready to go home.

The patient had no medical history. The patient had no known allergies. Concomitant medication included diphenhydramine taken for an unspecified indication, start and stop date were not reported. The patient had no other vaccine in four weeks. The patient had no COVID-19 prior vaccination. The patient was not tested for COVID-19 post vaccination. On 17Apr2021 at 11:30 AM, the patient fainted about 15 to 20 minutes after dose. The patient did not receive any treatment for the adverse event (AE). The patient recovered from the event on an unspecified date.

During screening questions patient reported a one time history of passing out after a vaccine when he was a teenager. Patient received first dose of Pfizer Covid vaccine and sat in chairs to be observed. About 15 minutes later I walked out to check on the patient and he was staring straightforward, sweating, and pale. When asked if he was okay he stated his vision was looking blurry and felt dizzy. Took patient's blood pressure, elevated his legs as I couldn't move him safely at the time, gave him water to drink, applied cool compresses to neck and forehead. Patient was observed by a clinic staff member during entire event. Rechecked patient's blood pressure 5 minutes later at resolution of symptoms. Patient then left with adult visitor that came with him.

patient fainted and fell out of chair onto face. We called 911, EMS came and took his vitals. He recovered rather quickly and said he was feeling much better.

24 2021-05-04 palpitations, chest pain Chest pain, palpitations, facial pain
24 2021-05-04 fainting, pallor Around 12:05pm on 5/5/21, Five minutes after receiving the vaccine, the patient fainted while in the... Read more
Close
Around 12:05pm on 5/5/21, Five minutes after receiving the vaccine, the patient fainted while in the waiting room. We came out to assist and at that point the patient was already sitting up, but on the floor. We were able to speak to him and gave him some water to drink. We called 911, when we were aware he had fainted. I was the pharmacist on duty, but not the one that vaccinated him. So I stayed with him. There was a moment when he took his sweater off saying he was hot, and I saw sweat bullets on his forehead. So I got some paper towels for him and took his temperature, which read around 98 degrees. A few seconds later he turned pale and fell over, hitting his head on one of the shelves. I quickly got him off the shelf and held his head in my arms . He opened his eyes and started talking and wanting to sit up, but we kept him laying down and continued to ask him questions to keep him alert. He was able to answer the questions, knew where he was, who he was, who he was with . The paramedics then arrived and he was taken out of the store on a stretcher. We provided a copy of the report he filled out to the paramedics .
24 2021-05-04 fainting He states he had the first Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine in the series on 4/13/2021. He states that two d... Read more
Close
He states he had the first Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine in the series on 4/13/2021. He states that two days later on 4/15/2021 he felt like his feet were heavy. He continues to experience that sensation in his feet, and even feeling like his feet are asleep at nighttime and when he first gets up in the morning. The asleep feeling in the feet gets better when he gets up and moves around but the heavy sensation in the legs does not get better. He states that his mobility is affected though that his legs feel heavy and he is not as easily mobile as he used to be. He feels his balance is off. Patient later reported that he did have and episode of syncope about 5 minutes after he got the vaccine but otherwise was doing okay until 4/15/2021. He presented to the ED with these symptoms on 5/3/2021 at approximately 7:14pm and was admitted to the hospital for evaluation. Patient states that he normally exercises regularly and has been having a great deal of difficulty especially with squatting and now has difficulty walking up stairs, feels very weak and his legs feel heavy. He reports that the numbness and tingling sensation of his feet when sleeping is new and he has never had it in the past. Symptoms get worse with exertion and prolonged activity. Neurologist was consulted and several tests were ordered. Neurology consult noted that patient had a prior COVID 19 infection in November 2020. Per neurologist notes: His symptoms first started about two days after he received Pfizer COVID vaccine on April 13, 2021. He recalled feeling his feet heaviness and it was hard to pick them up. He also had some calf pain. He also had difficulty with doing his stretches and yoga positioning. A week ago, he began to have difficulty with picking up a ball or anything from the ground. He also developed pins and needles at the fingertips at the same time he developed tingling sensation of his feet. He also has lower back pain. He tested positive for SARS-COV-2 antigen on November 12, 2020. He recalled having symptoms lasting for a few days consisting of diaphoresis, cough, and flu-like symptoms. Per neurologist, symptoms seem to resemble acute inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy (AIDP). Patient was treated with IVIG for 5 days.

Close
5/6 - 2nd dose of Pfizer COVID mRNA vaccine 5/7 - fatigue, malaise, muscle aches, fever 5/8 - near resolution of symptoms 5/8 - dinner with family and 6-7 beers; chest pressure sensation at bedtime with fatigue, malaise, some dyspnea 5/9 early AM - woke with acute L chest pain, stabbing, radiation through chest, worse with exertion, 7/10 in severity, pleuritic, also with dyspnea 5/9 - presented to ED. Afebrile, hemodynamically stable, CBC and CMP overall wnl other than mild hyperglycemia. CPK 500s. ESR 4, troponin 3.77, EKG with t wave inversion in III, chest xray normal, d-dimer negative. COVID/resp viral panel negative. Initially admitted to the ICU and treated as NSTEMI/ACS with heparin drip, aspirin, beta blocker, and statin. left heart cath with normal coronaries and TTE was normal. Troponin peaked at 7 and downtrended to 5. a1c is pending. 5/10 early AM - symptoms had resolved. Cardiology recommending cardiac MRI to further evaluate but working diagnosis is myocarditis. He has no precedent viral illness, and no history of tick bite but does live in a wooded area and goes for hikes, states he always checks for ticks after being outside.

24 2021-05-16 fainting, pallor, loss of consciousness Client received vaccine at 9:35am. Client was immediately syncopal and fell and hit head on floor. R... Read more
Close
Client received vaccine at 9:35am. Client was immediately syncopal and fell and hit head on floor. RN who administered vaccine noted possible brief tonic clonic activity during syncope. Patient pale and sweating. Client awoke within seconds after fall and was panicked and trying to stand back up. RNs reassured patient and helped patient back into safe lying position. Legs were elevated, VS assessed, ice applied to back of head. No bleeding noted. When patient felt ready and was alert/oriented, nurse raised patient to sitting position and moved into wheelchair. Patient still pale and sweating. Lead RN called EMS due to concern for potential head injury with fall. Patient states that he is lightheaded again and loses consciousness again in wheelchair as RN and EMT are wheeling patient out to be received by EMS squad. EMT supporting patient airway during second LOC - RN notes that airway support (with EMT hands) may be too tight as patient red faced and some throat gurgling. EMT adjusts grip. Patient regains consciousness within 1-2 minutes after second LOC. Patient disoriented - is able to say why he is there and what his name was but cannot remember his age. EMS arrives and takes over care. EMS assessed patient and recommended to transport patient to ED for further assessment. Patient refuses transport to the hospital. EMS squad waits with patient until family member arrives. Patient states family member will transport to hospital. Patient leaves clinic site with family member in car. First set of vitals/assessment after first LOC at 0940 142/96 BP; 74 pulse; 16 respirations; 97% spO2; 97.7 temp; PERRLA. No bleeding on head; scrape noted L elbow. EMS was called at 9:49am. EMS arrived at 9:54am. Patient states no major medical history, not on any meds. Patient has fainted one time previously after broken thumb.

24 2021-05-19 inflammation of the heart muscle, palpitations, chest discomfort, lightheadedness, troponin increased, chest pain 24-year-old male with no prior medical problems presents for evaluation of chest pain. Patient comp... Read more
Close
24-year-old male with no prior medical problems presents for evaluation of chest pain. Patient complains of midsternal chest pain that started approximately an hour ago. He states that it woke him up from sleep. Pain is sharp without any radiation or other associated symptoms including diaphoresis presyncopal symptoms or palpitations. He denies any significant air hunger or shortness of breath. He otherwise had been feeling better after what he tall was post COVID vaccine symptoms. Patient received a 2nd dose of pfizer vaccine 3 days ago. He states that within 24 hours he had symptoms of myalgia fever and feeling unwell. That has been resolving patient has been feeling better until the chest pain today. Patient otherwise denies any other medical problems in. He denies any history of drug use including any recent cocaine or other drug abuse. Elevated cardiac enzymes and chest discomfort are likely secondary to myocarditis and secondary to vaccination/ inflammatory reaction. Although there is low likelihood of obstructive coronary artery disease as well. I recommended cardiac catheterization for clarification. He does not want to have the procedure done, understands the risk of undiagnosed coronary artery disease and risk of MI. He would like to be discharged home. I reviewed the images of echocardiogram and it seems that he has a small area of hypokinesis in infero basal segment. Recommended to take aspirin and be seen in Cardiology office in 2 weeks. Advised to abstain from exercise and significant physical activity till that time and return to the hospital if any symptoms. Subjective: I saw patient in consultation for evaluation of chest pain and elevated cardiac enzymes. Patient is a 24-year-old healthy male who had COVID-19 vaccination with his second Pfizer shot 4/14/21. He developed fever, chills, nausea and vomiting 1 day after vaccination. He did not have any reaction to the 1st dose. He presented to the hospital with substernal chest discomfort which woke him up from sleep, radiated to throat and had a throbbing feeling. This lasted for 1 to 2 hours and subsided completely in the hospital. He smokes 5 cigarettes a day, is physically very active and exercises regularly. He is not on any medication at home.

on reviewing var patient described having vasovagal syncope when given tb test and tattoo. He wanted to get vaccine. Then talking with emt on duty at time security walked him to emt and was observed after that. Close
Patient received the COVID vaccine (Pfizer dose 1, lot #EW0182, expiration date 05/22/2021) in his left deltoid at 1425. At 1428, as the pt was walking to the observation area, he was observed falling to the ground. The pt?s girlfriend, protected his head from hitting the ground. EMT staff, Lead RN, and Co-Lead RN responded at 1429. The pt?s girlfriend, told the staff that he was passed out for about 10-15 seconds. Upon arrival from staff, the pt was responsive and alert and oriented x4. The pt denied any pain in his head, difficulty breathing or SOB. Pupils were equal and reactive to light and the client was very diaphoretic (sweaty). At 1430, vital signs were BP: 122/58, P: 55, O2: 97%, and RR: 20. The pt denied history of seizures, any other medical history, allergies and takes no medications. The pt stated ?I am afraid of needles but have never fainted after a vaccine or blood draw?. The pt mentioned the last time he ate was breakfast at 0930. At 1435, the pt no longer felt dizzy or lightheaded and walked over to the observation area to sit in the anti-gravity chair. At 1435, the pt finished a granola bar and juice. Vital signs were taken again at 1445, BP: 128/75, P: 85, O2: 98%, and RR: 16. Lead RN and Co-Lead RN educated the pt on signs and symptoms of adverse reactions and when to go to the ED/call MD. Pt was also educated on sitting in the anti-gravity chair for his second dose of Pfizer. Pt left facility at 1447 walking with a steady gait with girlfriend, pt?s mother picked them up.

Started developing chest pain a week after taking the first dose. A 24-year-old male patient received bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration on 12Apr2021 as 1st dose, single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient started developing chest pain a week after taking the first dose (13Apr2021). Progressively worsened since then till present. At present also have fatigue, diarrhea and tiredness. Yesterday, had bouts of sharp chest pain so got an X-Ray from ED which showed pleural effusion and slight fullness of main pulmonary artery. Doctor stated it was indicative of CP. In the initial few days after the first dose, had high fever, chills, nausea and brain fog. High fatigue and tiredness persisted from right after the vaccine till present. The patient was very healthy and have never had a heart complication before. The timing might be indicative of a causation between the vaccine and the present medical condition. Ae resulted in doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit. There is no other vaccine in four weeks, no other medications in two weeks, no treatment for ae, no covid prior vaccination. The patient tested covid post vaccination (RT-PCR) with Nasal Swab on 03May2021, covid test result was Negative. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. List of any other medications the patient did not receive within 2 weeks of vaccination. The outcome of the events was not resolved. Information on the lot/batch number has been requested.

24 2021-05-24 chest pain 2 weeks after my second pfizer dose I experienced intense chest pains for ~4 straight days. The pain... Read more
Close
2 weeks after my second pfizer dose I experienced intense chest pains for ~4 straight days. The pain was located in my upper-left chest / peck area. With each inhalation I experienced significant pain (a 5 out of 10, at least). This lasted for several days and slowly went away. However, about 2 weeks later and again 3 weeks later I felt this pain again. I've never had chest pain before. I am young, healthy, don't consume alcohol regularly, do not smoke, and I exercise often. I brushed off the chest pain as "the human body is weird and does weird things". However, now seeing that myocarditis may be an apparent side-effect, I want to report this strange occurrence.

24 2021-05-25 chest pain, heart rate increased, inflammation of the heart muscle, chest discomfort MYOCARDITIS. I experienced extreme chest pain, tightness, shortness of breath, painful heart beats,... Read more
Close
MYOCARDITIS. I experienced extreme chest pain, tightness, shortness of breath, painful heart beats, I could feel each beat. I hunched over in my bed groom grabbing my abdomen and fell onto my bed and almost passed out from whack I?d assume is lack of oxygen. I could barely breathe for about five minutes and felt relatively severe pain particularly in the right side of my chest. I could feel every muscle, tendon, and artery inflamed, enlarged, and hurting. My chest felt like it filled up with a balloon. Heart rate went up too. I have NEVER EVER felt ANYTHING like this in my LIFE. Not even close. It was a brand new sensation to me first time I?ve ever felt anything like this at all, and very intense and frustrating. Keeping in mind I am in perfect health. I am a body builder with a perfect physique. I work at a high end restaurant and have an extremely good diet. I have a normal sleep and sexual routine, I don?t use any medications whatsoever even Tylenol or ibuprofen. I have no pre existing conditions. I have no history of heart or cardio problems. My family has a history of low blood pressure. I have next to no stress or anxiety in my life. I am 24 years old I work out and run miles, five to six days a week. I don?t use nicotine, tobacco, and I haven?t had a drink of alcohol in ten years (14yrs old). I smoke marijuana on a daily basis. After about ten minutes the incident went down and I was able to breathe a little better but still had pain and tightness in my chest. I have had shortness of breath ever since. This is being written the day after the event about 26 hours later. I ran a mile last night and went to the gym it seemed to help both my breathing and the pain and tightness but it has not fully gone away. I feel my heart straining somehow as I am typing this. One thing to note is I did not want to get vaccinated but was pressured to do so, and before getting it I was very nervous and honestly upset. The woman administering it was not helpful at all and actually mocked my unsureness and was very rude and unprofessional. She didn?t answer any technical questions I had. During my interaction with her between my nerves and her behavior I?m absolutely certain my heart rate was elevated at the time of getting the shot. I have only had one shot. The episode of myocarditis occurred two weeks after my first shot. Two days after my scheduled second shot, which I missed because of work and was going to reschedule before this occurred. I am not going to be getting the second shot. Will be following up with my primary care doctor as soon as possible. Haven?t had time.

Close
Patient with known Syncope reactions to needles answered no on intake form. Patient administered vaccine and immidiately passed out. Patient was transitioned to floor. feet elevated and blood pressure returned. rested for 25 min. tried to resume sitting position and passed out again. transitioned again and ok. Hydrated and gave sugar. checked pulse and BP and was normal. took an exaggerated rest period. patient left on own power once fully recovered. Then it was mentioned by the patient that we have a needle phobia and pass out.

I did notice some mild seizure like physical symptoms as he woke up - arms and shoulders jerked a little for a few seconds. he said that the same, but worse, reaction happened after his first dose.

Close
Patient received the vaccine around 9:38 AM and was placed in a chair for observation. Within 3 minutes the patient had fallen onto the floor on his side out of the chair. The pharmacist on duty at the time myself ran over and asked patient if he was ok and touched his shoulder. The patient regained consciousness and was moved to the vaccination room and put feet up for evaluation. The patient loss consciousness for 10 more seconds. Vitals were taken immediately (see below) and patient was interviewed for adr's. Patient had extreme diaphoresis, said he had no diplopia but did have blurred vision . Patient said his head hurt and was given 500 mg apap for one dose. He said his ears were hot. Patient said he had no pain other than his head hurting. Patient had no uticaria or redness . Patient appeared pale. He was given extensive amounts of water and a snack. He said that sounds were slightly muted. He said he had senstivity to lights.

Symptoms seemed to worsen again 3-10 days after the second dose. Still get sharp pains in my chest near my heart today. Today I looked up my symptoms and they seem comparable with Myocarditis so I decided to make this entry.

24 2021-06-07 inflammation of the heart muscle, chest discomfort, troponin increased Monday, got 2nd Pfizer vaccine. Tuesday, sick with fever and chills. Wednesday 2am, Thursday 1pm, Fr... Read more
Close
Monday, got 2nd Pfizer vaccine. Tuesday, sick with fever and chills. Wednesday 2am, Thursday 1pm, Friday 8am: 3-4 hour cramping in hands, arms, shoulders, neck, upper back, with chest tightness. Tylenol, ibuprofen, heating pad, showers to no effect. Friday morning (May 14) I visit Primary Care during episode. Abnormal EKG. I drive to emergency room. 2 abnormal EKGs. I get a Cardiac Cathedar operation, followed by an echo in outpatient. Blood draw shows troponin levels at 29k and 26k. Presumed myopericarditis. 2 days in hospital, released May 16. Heart rate stabilized the night of May 14. Aspirin 650mg (ended Monday May 31), colchicine 0.6mg, Lisinopril 5mg, Metoprolol 25mg. Omeprazole upped to two 20mg tablets instead of one. Getting a heart MRI Wednesday, May 9. Back at work on Wednesday, May 19.

Passed out roughly 4 minutes after injection; Low bpm afterwards when paramedic showed up (30-40); sweating; EKG showed PVC of heart; dizziness; disorientation; low energyand weakness; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 24-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), dose 1 via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 20May2021 10:30 at age of 24 years old, (Lot Number: W01768721) as 1st dose, single for covid-19 immunisation. Medical history included known allergies: Augmentin. Any other medications the patient received within 2 weeks of vaccination was none. Clinical course reported that: Passed out roughly 4 minutes after injection. Woke up after 2 minutes sweating. Low bpm afterwards when paramedic showed up (30-40). 2 IV bags administered. EKG showed PVC of heart. Still have dizziness and disorientation as well as low energy and weakness 4 days later. Adverse events onset date reported as 20May2021 10:30 AM. Events resulted in Doctor or other healthcare professional office/clinic visit, Emergency room/department or urgent care. Outcome for events was not recovered. The patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19 prior to vaccination, and since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The patient did not receive any other vaccines within 4 weeks prior to the COVID vaccine. Information on Lot/Batch number was available. Additional information has been requested.

This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 24-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, lot number and expiration date not provided), 1st dose via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 13May2021 13:00 at age of 24 years old as a single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient's medical history and concomitant medications were not reported. The patient experienced heart pain, pushing down on the chest, and being very heavy, feels really weak, short of breath, he can't get deep breaths in, uncomfortable, all on 16May2021. The outcome of all events was not recovered. Clinical course: Caller stated he got the vaccine 13May2021, the first dose. Caller states he had bad heart pain, that he was 24 years old and it was like it was not sharp but it was like it felt heavy all the time, like his chest was heavy like somebody was pressing on it (on Sunday he began to have heart pain that he describes as being worse in the morning, pushing down on the chest, and being very heavy). Stated he felt really weak. Caller stated these started on Sunday, 16May2021 last week and it was pretty uncomfortable. Caller stated he wanted to know what to do next, should he reported to his doctor or got it checked and was it normal. Caller stated he was also short of breath, he can't get deep breaths in and that started the same day 16May2021. Caller provided all his symptoms were persisting. States they all started in the afternoon. Caller stated it was the Pfizer Covid 19 vaccine. Stated the 1st dose was 13May2021 in his left arm at 1pm. Caller does not have dose, NDC, lot or expiry date to provide as he does not have his card. Events were not required to visit emergency room or physician's office. There had no evets occurred I following prior vaccinations. There had no any other vaccinations within four weeks prior to the first administration date of the suspect vaccine. Patient's Medical History and relevant test were none. Vaccine was not administered at Military Facility.

Close
Since my second shot of the vaccine, I have been experiencing chest pain. My chest feels tight and hurts a little bit. Any psychical exertion causes the tightness and pain to increase a lot, like i'm being stabbed by a knife. If I go on a walk, it gets really bad and I start to feel it in my throat and back. It subsides if I lay down or sit still for a while. It seems to be caused by movement and exertion. Also, my left toe is now partially numb. It is not fully numb, but feels like pins and needles when I touch it. This has been happening since I got the second shot I think.
24 2021-06-12 heart flutter, heart rate increased, blood pressure increased Days following dose 2, I began having fluid retention and elevated blood pressure. Over time, it ha... Read more
Close
Days following dose 2, I began having fluid retention and elevated blood pressure. Over time, it has worsened. I am now having dizzy spells that can last 10 minutes to 6 hours up to twice a day, confusion/brain fog and heart flutters/elevated heart rate usually accompanied with fatigue. My previous doctor treated me by increasing the metoprolol and adding hydrochlorothiazide for fluid retention. I saw a new healthcare provider who is sending me to a cardiologist, neurologist, lipidologist and endocrinologist to figure out what is going on. I can not function in daily life. I cannot stand when dizzy and cannot drive. Symptoms appear to be worsening. In the meantime, he prescribed Ubrelvy to rule out migraines. None of this appeared until after dose 2 of Pfizer.

24 2021-06-14 loss of consciousness, blood glucose increased, blood pressure increased passed out; feeling dizzy; fell out of his chair on to the ground; B/P 136/90; BGL 148; feeling naus... Read more
Close
passed out; feeling dizzy; fell out of his chair on to the ground; B/P 136/90; BGL 148; feeling nauseous; tingly feeling in arm and chest; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Hcp. A 24-years-old male patient received bnt162b2 (BNT162B2), dose 1 intramuscular on 31May2021 11:45 (Lot Number: EW0171) at 24-years-old as 1st dose, single for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was not reported. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. On 31May2021, the patient waiting in observation and started feeling dizzy then passed out and fell out of his chair on to the ground. Obtained baseline vitals B/P 136/90, BGL 148, O2 96% pulse 69 PT was alert immediately after falling we gave water and observed further got another set of vitals B/P 120/78 02 started feeling nauseous and called 911. overall felt nauseous and tingly feeling in arm and chest no pain, and passed out. The patient received first aid for events. The outcome of events was recovered on 31May2021.; Sender's Comments: Based on known drug safety profile, there is reasonable possibility of causal association between the events Loss of consciousness, Dizziness, Fall, Blood pressure increased, Blood glucose increased, Nausea, Paraesthesia and the suspect drug BNT162B2. Based on known drug safety profile, there is reasonable possibility of causal association between the event Loss of consciousness, Dizziness, Fall, Blood pressure increased, Blood glucose increased, Nausea and Paresthesia the suspect drug BNT162B2. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

I also got the second Pfiszer-BioNTech shot on January 9th. On April 2nd, I was laying on the couch watching a movie and I had petechaie on my back from the couch. I also had it in a few spots on my chest. I did not have any bleeding. During my work shifts, I was fatigued during most of them that month. I saw my primary care doctor on April 29th and got labs drawn. The next day he called saying that my platelets were 5,000 and I did not have petechaie or bleeding at that time. Treatment has been 4 consecutive days of 40 mg of dexamethasone. My platelets dropped back to a similar level, so I was placed on prednisone 60 mg with a taper once I started 4 weekly Rituxamab treatments. I just finished those and my hematologist is recommending a spleenectomy at this time.

approximately 2 minutes after patient received vaccine he yelled out "I'm going to faint" and he laid down in supine position on floor and went unconscious. 2 staff members responded and positioned head to maintain his airway. He was breathing and had pulse and was very pale. EMS was called. It took approximately 90 seconds for patient to become conscious again. Cool cloth applied to head and verbal reassurance given to patient. Pt denied any injury. Pt stated he has fainted before with blood draws. EMS arrived and evaluated pt and found his vital signs and heart rhythm stable. Pt declined transport to hospital. Pts girlfriend came to drive him home. He remained sitting in pharmacy waiting area for approximately 1 hour. He had food and water before leaving.
24 2021-06-21 pallor At 1620, pt. received Pfizer vaccine administered by RN at clinic. Pt. was sent to observation area,... Read more
Close
At 1620, pt. received Pfizer vaccine administered by RN at clinic. Pt. was sent to observation area, which is in the cafeteria. At 1625, Support staff checked on pt. and pt. reported he felt dizzy and immediately informed RNs. Pt. was sitting on the chair and drinking water when this incident occurred. During assessment, pt. was found diaphoretic, pale in skin color, pt. reported blurry vision, and trouble breathing. Pt. respirations rate was 16 breaths per minute, non-labored, no signs of any distress. Pt. stated no prior medical history. After a few minutes, pt. started to recover. Pt. skin color started to improve and less diaphoretic. At 1629, EMS called by RN. Pt was moved to another area away from other patients. Pt. was able to ambulate, follow commands/ directions without any deficits. At 1637, EMS arrived, pt. vitals was taken BP=100/50's and stable. Pt. refused to go to the hospital for further observation. RN stayed with pt. until 1700. Pt. was given some snacks and drinks (gatorade and water). Pt. was moved across the nurses' vaccination table for further monitoring. Pt. fully recovered and left to go home at 1732.

At 1348 client approached EMT to ask if neck tension was normal. EMT did first set of vitals and assessment. Vitals at 1348: blood pressure 148/100, pulse 79, oxygen sat 99%. Per client "slight dizziness" and headache. EMT gave client water. PHN arrived at 1353. Client sitting upright in chair, alert and oriented x4. Medical history of TMJ and headaches, no daily medications and no known allergies. At 1355 client states "slight pressure on chest". Client denied shortness of breath, blurry vision, chest pain. Per client headache 1/10 pain, chest pressure also 1-2/10. PHN offered client paramedics for further assessment and client declined. Vitals at 1400: blood pressure 150/102, pulse 84, oxygen sat 98%. Client reported dizziness and headache improving. Chest pressure 1/10. Client alert and oriented x4. Vitals at 1407: blood pressure 146/92, pulse 77, oxygen sat 98%. Per client headache, dizziness and chest pressure improving. Client described chest pressure as "anything mild". Vitals at 1414: blood pressure 150/98, pulse 74, oxygen sat 98%. Client reported to PHN feeling stressed due to work. Per client headaches are common for him. At 1417 client stated chest pressure "back to normal". Client denied chest pain, blurry vision, shortness of breath, or dizziness. PHN advised client to follow up with provider and gave ER precautions. Last vitals at 1424: blood pressure 142/99, pulse 72, oxygen sat 99%. PHN asked client if someone could drive him home. Client stated he "felt fine to drive". Client left facility with steady gait at 1428.
