24 2021-06-25 loss of consciousness patient passed out approximately 9 minutes after receiving his 1st dose of Pfizer vaccine. he left ... Read more
Close
patient passed out approximately 9 minutes after receiving his 1st dose of Pfizer vaccine. he left his 15 minute observation period and became light headed as he passed out while on his walk to the bathroom in the facility he received his vaccine in. he did not hit his head or otherwise injure himself during the fall. patient stated that he has a history of passing out after receiving dental work novocaine injections but did not tell this to the vaccine administrator when prompted to detail his "unsure" response to the question, "have you ever had an allergic reaction or fainted after receiving a vaccine or an injectable medication" on the vaccine consent questionnaire. This information was provided to me by the patient after he passed out and we were asking him questions. He felt fine and was taken back to the pharmacy for an additional 20 minutes of observation and provided him with a bottle of water. he felt fine and left without incident after this observation period.

Taken as directed, minor improvement noticed Prescribed Doxycycline Hyclate 100MG 1 twice a day. Taken as directed, no improvement noticed Emergency visit 06/14/2021 for partially closure and hypersensitivity in throat noted at 2:18am. Emergency Oral surgery at noon for impacted wisdom tooth after discussing symptoms Prescribed Hydrocodone-acetamin 5-325MG 8 each day. Prescribed Ibuprofen 800MG 2 each day. Initially no notable improvement. After 9 days notable improvement to swelling Prescribed Amoxicillin 500MG 4 each day. Prescribed Hydrocod/APAP 5-325MG 6 each day. Notable improvement to swelling Prescribed Oxycod/APAP 5-325MG 6 each day (as alt for Hydrocod). Never taken After 1 week prescribed additional stereroid anti-inflamatory. Can't recall name Since 07/25/2021 and Currently: Severe pressure behind eyes and ears, worsening sensitive throat, runny nose, worsening cough, chest pain, nightly sweating, frequent hot flashes throughout day All symptoms of night sweat, chest, hot flash, sensitive throat, and ear pressure have been sustained from May. 24 2021-07-05 fluid around the heart, inflammation of the pericardium Patient found to have large pericardial effusion without tamponade. He is now status post sub-xiphoi... Read more
Close
Patient found to have large pericardial effusion without tamponade. He is now status post sub-xiphoid pericardial window with subsequent drainage of effusions. Pericardial pathology showed hemorrhagic pericardial tissue with marked acute and chronic inflammation and adherent fibrin consistent with fibrinous pericarditis. Patient endorses improved symptoms post-operatively, remains afebrile, and is without leukocytosis. Minimal residual pain is likely secondary to his recently removed chest tube. Medical team plans to discharge patient today.
24 2021-07-06 chest pain Chest pain issues have resolved mostly. The most debilitating thing to come after the vaccine was th... Read more
Close
Chest pain issues have resolved mostly. The most debilitating thing to come after the vaccine was the onset of ringing, buzzing persistently in left ear, comes and goes in right ear. Started 2 weeks and 2 days after second dose of Pfizer vaccine, and after flying multiple times and started when I got back on the 13th of April 2021. It has remained constant but has improved slightly from where it was in the beginning, have been doing Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (five 1 hour sessions, spaced about a week-week and a half apart over the last 2 months to see if things improve). Things I would say have improved but I am running out of patience and financial means to keep going to a doctor. I feel helpless, depressional, work performance is awful, and lastly very suicidal than I have ever been. Just want to die.

Close
I believe these symptoms are consistent with the reports of myocarditis; Headache; Shortness of breath; Chest tightness all sustained between 12-24 hours after receiving 2nd dose; This is a spontaneous report from a non-contactable consumer, the patient. A 24-years-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, solution for injection, Batch/Lot Number: EWO198), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 05Jul2021 at 20:15 (at the age of 24-years-old) as single dose for covid-19 immunization. Facility type vaccine was Pharmacy or Drug Store. Medical history included known allergies to Penicillin from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing, covid-19 from an unknown date and unknown if ongoing (If covid prior vaccination: Yes). There were no concomitant medications. Historical vaccine included previously received first dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 mRNA VACCINE, solution for injection), via an unspecified route of administration, administered in Arm Left on 14Jun2021 at 20:15 (at the age of 24-years-old) (Batch/Lot Number: EWO181) as single dose for covid-19 immunization and did not experience any adverse reaction. No other vaccine administered in four weeks. Adverse event description stated by patient as on 06Jul2021 at 08:00 was headache, shortness of breath, and chest tightness all sustained between 12-24 hours after receiving 2nd dose. Took 2 Tylenol 24hrs after 2nd dose, symptoms dissipated, reappeared next morning, albeit reduced severity. I believe these symptoms are consistent with the reports of myocarditis (though the symptoms are admittedly nondescript) experienced by others in my demographic group following the 2nd dose. Patient was tested covid post vaccination. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included Nasal Swab test on 07Jul2021 with unknown result. The patient received treatment for the events. The outcome of the events was recovering. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

diagnosed with heart failure; Cardiomyopathy; there's inflammation within his heart as well as reduced ejection fraction; there's inflammation within his heart as well as reduced ejection fraction; chest pain; palpitations; rapid heart beat; This is a spontaneous report received from a consumer (patient) A 24-years-old male patient received BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), intramuscular arm left on 26Apr2021 (Batch/Lot Number: EW0170) as single dose (at the age of 24) for covid-19 immunisation. The patient medical history was none. Patient states he had no prior medical history or cardiovascular issues. The patient's concomitant medications were not reported. No other vaccine was received in four weeks. The patient experienced cardiomyopathy on May2021, diagnosed with heart failure on an unspecified date, there's inflammation within his heart as well as reduced ejection fraction on an unspecified date, chest pain on 02May2021, palpitations on 02May2021, rapid heart beat on 02May2021, there's inflammation within his heart as well as reduced ejection fraction on an unspecified date. Patient went to a specialist that Monday, a private practice, and after a good range of medical tests, he was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy and was admitted. The patient was hospitalized for cardiomyopathy and heart failure from 04May2021 to 06May2021. Patient states he was hospitalized 5 days later and diagnosed with cardiomyopathy and he was diagnosed with heart failure after he received the Pfizer vaccine after a good range of tests and MRI's, it seems there's inflammation within his heart as well as a reduced ejection fraction. Patient states it happened immediately after being vaccinated and since then have been taking cardiovascular medications everyday. Patient states he had a regular MRI heart with and without contrast in May2021. Patient states they said there was decent range of dysfunction. Patient states it's super detailed, so he thinks he would rather Pfizer get in touch with the doctor. Patient states the report is 2 pages long, but what he knows for certain is it was cardiomyopathy for sure. Patient states he also got a PET MRI heart in Jun2021 as well. Patient states his doctors said it can't be confirmed 100% but they have a reason to believe it could have been from the vaccine. Patient states he needs an answer from Pfizer and he's not the first person that's probably called in, he needs someone to hear him on this. Patient states he doesn't want to contact the media. Patient states he needs an answer, this has ruined his life essentially. Patient states he knows it's not specifically the call handler or Pfizer, but this is taking a lot for him and if someone can get back to him on this that would be great. Patient states he is a 24 year old, able-bodied guy, who's very healthy and it all started right after getting vaccinated. The outcome of cardiomyopathy, chest pain, palpitations, rapid heart beat was recovering, of the other events was unknown. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected

The patient called about his situation and to ask for some advice. The patient did not know what to do. He read online that if people have had side effects like chest pain, they should go to the hospital. The patient asked if he should go to the hospital. He was outside of a hospital at the time of reporting. The patient reclarified that if people are young and under 25 years old, they do not have to worry and the side effects usually last for 2 or 3 days and then disappear. Close
Patient was vaccinated with dose 1 of COVID19 Pfizer shot. Stated non know reactions after other vaccinations. Patient left vaccination room, and walked back to pharmacy waiting area where his significant other was waiting for him. Upon sitting down he lost consciousness. I was in the vaccination room at the time, completing paperwork, when my technician, tech came to get me to come out to the patient. When I got out to the waiting room, patient was pale, but conscious and responding to me. Tech called paramedics. I had him lay on the ground until he felt ok to sit up. My technician got him some water to drink. He said this has happened once before on an ear piercing. Paramedics showed up within 5 minutes. I recounted what happened to one of the paramedics while the other took the patient's vitals. Paramedics took him out to their truck for further evaluation.

chest pain; has been running out of breath pretty easily, and is pretty fatigued; has been running out of breath pretty easily, and is pretty fatigued; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). The patient medical history was not reported. Concomitant medications included unspecified vitamin type. The patient had experienced chest pain on Jun2021. When the chest pain started, he had kind of a very sort of dull and not severe pain. It started within a day or two of the vaccine dose. He had that for a little bit, then it went away, then it came back a couple days ago. He started yesterday, which has happened only twice, to have a sharp pain that ripples across the left side of his chest that lasts for 5-10 seconds and was painful enough for him to stop what he was doing, and it came without warning then went away on its own. He had been running out of breath pretty easily, and was pretty fatigued. He went to urgent care today, and they didn't know what wrong with him, and if it got worse, to go to the emergency room. When he first got the pain in the middle of his chest he went to the chiropractor because he thought he might have a rib out, which indeed it did go away for a while. He didn't know if it could have anything to do with his left side though, the middle of chest, because it seems like two completely different things. He did take Naproxen sodium and the pain went down a bit, he took one last night and the pain went away for a bit. He says that this is an off brand of what might be known as Naprosyn. The dose is 220mg (EXP: Aug2022). He took one liquid gel type capsule by mouth, and his pain was reduced. The patient underwent lab tests and procedures which included COVID-19 molecular test: negative on 16Jul2021. The outcome was unknown.

Patient fainted in the ICU setting.; dizziness; hypotension; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable Other HCP. A 25-year-old male patient received BNT162B2 (Lot number: eh9899) via an unspecified route of administration on 24Dec2020 13:00 at single dose for covid-19 immunisation. The patient did not have any known allergies or medical history. Prior to vaccination, the patient was not diagnosed with COVID-19. There were no concomitant medications. On 24Dec2020, patient experienced dizziness and hypotension. Patient's blood pressure (BP) was 50/30 and heart rate (HR) 45. Patient fainted in the intensive care unit (ICU) setting. This happened during work hours while treating a patient. Patient was treated in the emergency department (ED). The adverse events resulted in emergency room/department or urgent care. It was unknown if treatment was received for the adverse event. Since the vaccination, the patient has not been tested for COVID-19. The outcome of events was recovered.; Sender's Comments: A possible contributory effect of suspect BNT162B2 on reported events cannot be excluded. The impact of this report on the benefit/risk profile of the Pfizer product is evaluated as part of Pfizer procedures for safety evaluation, including the review and analysis of aggregate data for adverse events. Any safety concern identified as part of this review, as well as any appropriate action in response, will be promptly notified to regulatory authorities, Ethics Committees, and Investigators, as appropriate.

25 2021-01-19 hypertension, chest pain, fainting Patient called from work approximately 3 hours post-vaccination with symptoms of chest pain, shortne... Read more
Close
Patient called from work approximately 3 hours post-vaccination with symptoms of chest pain, shortness of breath, vomiting, and UE paresthesias. He proceeded to have a syncopal episode and 911 was called by his co-workers. Pt regained consciousness prior to EMS arriving. He reported feeling nauseated and was found to be hypertensive. He was given Zofran, which helped with his nausea. His blood pressure normalized. Patient felt better and declined any further evaluation or treatment, including declining transfer to ED.

Close
Severe apneic episodes with sleep. I have no history of sleep apnea, BMI of 24, exercise regularly, no known snoring. The night after my first dose at around 23:00 while falling asleep I shortly after having been asleep would wake up gasping for air. Attempting to fall back asleep I felt the need to consciously make myself breathe, and when I would fall asleep no more than 5-10 after I would wake up gasping for air. This continued on until around close to 03:00 on 1/7/21. When I finally fell asleep around 03:00 woke up gasping for air around 04:45 and never fell back asleep. The next two nights, 1/7/21 and 1/8/21 I would have trouble falling asleep because these same apneic episodes were happening until around 03:00. The night of 1/9/21 I had no issues sleeping, and have had no apnea since those three nights. These apneic episodes were followed by extreme anxiety from being unable to sleep fully (I worried moreso about not falling asleep than the apnea). Heart rate when counted ranged for 70s-80s and my normal HR while sleeping is around low 50s.

Close
About 5 minutes after getting the vaccine, patient started to have tunnel vision, loss of hearing, change in LOC unable to answer where he was, he was pale, diaphoretic and unable to respond to signals patient stated he was going to pass out he was removed from the chair and placed on the floor with his legs in the air, his pulse via palpation was slow, he stated that he does not like needles and he had a similar reaction to the H1n1 vaccine . He was placed on a back board and lifted to a litter and taken to the medical obs, vital signs on arrival were 134/75, pulse72 and oxygen 100 in the right arm, @ 1830 , and at 1834 vital 148/88 HR 75 pulse ox 99 on room air. patients skin was now warm and dry, he reported that he was feeling better, at 6:35 bp 133/81, patient was then placed in a sitting position and blood pressure with position change was :143/92, pulse 68 and 99% on room air, standing after 1 minute patient was 145/87 and heart rate 78 and pulse ox 99%. Patient reported feeling better. His color had returned, he was given water and monitored for another 5 minutes.

Mask removed for ease of breathing. Was offered food and water, which he took- hands softened within 7-8" and color returned to face and arms within approximately 12 minutes. Had some food and water, which he stated helped. He felt he was dehydrated, hungry, and fearful. Never had episode of fainting or dizziness in the past.

Patient received 1st dose of Pfizer Vaccine Lot#ER8730 and was sitting in chair at administering station when he lost consciousness. Patient regained consciousness, A/Ox4, skin pale, cold and clammy, pupils dilated. FNP assessed pupils were non reactive to light. Per FNP, patient then had a seizure for approx. 18 sec at 2:55 pm; seizure precautions maintained at all times. Upon regaining consciousness, pt. began projectile emesis. 911 called/patient brought to sick bay. BP 104/51, HR 120, O2 97%, Temp 97.1 Patient remained A/Ox4 and stated he felt "very tired." Patient transferred to paramedics and transported to Hospital. EMS Incident.

Close
Patient fainted approximately 3 minutes after receiving his vaccine. He was in a monitoring chair and rested his head back. Pt did not fall or incur any injuries as a result of fainting. Pharmacy staff noticed it happening and gave him attention immediately. He revived right away. Patient was moved to counseling room floor and laid on floor with legs up for 15 minutes. Patient drank some apple juice and was monitored for a total of 30 minutes. Pt confirmed he felt ready to leave at that time and was advised to report any other symptoms to us immediately.

Close
patient was sitting in chair in observation room. approximately 3 minutes after his vaccine, he had a syncopal episode, fell out of the chair, hit is left jaw and left hip on the floor. Upon immediate assessment, he was hypotensive (83/28) bradycardic (P38), and pale. He has whole body "shaking" for about 10 seconds. He was responsive almost immediately after that, AOx4. assisted to a gurney where he rested. No SOB noted. His VS improved. He was sent to the ED via ambulance. d/c'd from ER without treatment. Close
03/25/2021 at 12:27 pm While patient in the post vaccination area , Patient noted sweating profusely , he is complaining of light headedness, observed pale in color . He denies loss of consciousness also he stated ?I did not eat anything since this morning?. The above occurrence lasted approximately five minutes, vital sign as followed: BP 110/90, respiration 18, pulse 73, 02 sat 98% on room air. Snack and water were provided to patient. On day of vaccination, he developed tactile fever, chills, headaches, body aches, and mild nausea without emesis. The next day, he took ibuprofen with mild relief of his symptoms. 25 2021-03-28 chest pain, chest discomfort I had chest pains that felt like tightness of my chest. Friends and family said it sounded like a h... Read more
Close
I had chest pains that felt like tightness of my chest. Friends and family said it sounded like a heart attack (despite being only 25 years old). It hurt to sit up or maneuver my chest/rib cage in any manner, for example, a sit up caused extreme pain. The pain was consistent throughout the day. After it began to dissipate, it was only reproducible when my chest/rib cage was moved or had pressure put onto it. Went to the doctor, diagnosed me with costochondritis. Received an anti-inflammatory shot. Reduced the pain. From initial pain to full recovery was about 3 days (if memory serves correctly, VSafe should have the correct dates as I responded accurately there). A slight discomfort in my chest did occur after my second shot, but nowhere near the same amount of discomfort.
25 2021-03-28 fainting, loss of consciousness Patient had just finished recieving his covid-19 vaccination from vaccinator. At the time of patient... Read more
Close
Patient had just finished recieving his covid-19 vaccination from vaccinator. At the time of patients fainting I was mixing up covid-19 vaccinations when the technicians said we need you to come out here because a patient is having a seizure, When arriving on the scene I found patient unconsious on the floor face down, while assessing the scene I noticed some blood on floor. I tried to look for any trauma, patient was breathing and I tried to awaken him. I told someone to call 911 and contact a store manager. Then all of a sudden he popped up and sat up like nothing happened. I then noticed the brusing on his nose and asked for an ice pack and a bottle of water. Patient knew his name, was coherent, and seemed to be fine. I stayed with patient until paramedics arrived. Paramedics did a thorough examination and everything checked out. Patient waited for parents to arrive instead of going with paramedics. Vaccinator stayed with patient till his parents arrived.

Close
Pt observed another pt having reaction and stated to provider, "I think I am freaking out." He stated that his chest felt tight. He denied any itching, rash, difficulty breathing, SOB, numbness/tingling. EMT/medics were on site and immediately responded to pt. Initially pt was diaphoretic with thready pulse. Vitals were pulse 54-62, blood pressure 100 palpabale, pulse ox 92-98, respirations 24. Pt was safely transferred to the floor where vitals were observed for 15 minutes lying supine with feet elevated. Continued stable in ranges stated ablve. He was then transferred to sitting position safely and then to standing position safetly. His vitals were continuously observed for the next 30 minutes by medical/EMT. Pt was able to ambulate freely at time of discharge and denied any advserse effects

25 2021-03-31 loss of consciousness Patient reported to clinic for Pfizer Covid-19 vaccination. Patient did not indicate on questionnai... Read more
Close
Patient reported to clinic for Pfizer Covid-19 vaccination. Patient did not indicate on questionnaire that he had experienced fainting or severe reactions from receiving vaccinations before. About 5 seconds after receiving vaccination patient said he would like to sit for just a minute. The clinic had a designated waiting area about 25 feet away where patients sit for 15 minutes after receiving vaccination. My technician and I agreed that patient should stay seated in the same chair he was receiving the vaccination in so we would be right next to him. After 2-3 minutes I noticed the patient had his eyes closed and then his head began to nod and he started to slump down in the chair. As I went to patient's side to stabilize him he pushed his chair backwards away from me about 5 feet which caused him to roll to the right side of the chair and fall off hitting his head on the floor. My technician immediately called 911 and EMTs arrived in about 5 minutes. A bystander who was a nurse helped me roll him onto his back and we propped his legs up with 2 cushions. We took his blood pressure and pulse. Patient regained consciousness in about 30 seconds and the EMTs cleared him to stand up after about 15 minutes. After patient had recovered, patient's mother who was there with patient and other siblings stated that the whole family has fainting episodes when receiving vaccinations. I informed patient's mother and patient to please inform any future vaccinators of these fainting episodes so they can be prepared.

Close
tunnel vision; Drop in blood pressure and heart rate; Drop in blood pressure and heart rate; dizzy; nauseous; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (patient). A 25-year-old male patient received the first dose of bnt162b2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE), via an unspecified route of administration administered in arm left on 19Mar2021 12:45 (Batch/Lot Number: Ep6955) as SINGLE DOSE for COVID-19 immunization. The patient had no medical history and no known allergies. Concomitant medications were not reported. He had no COVID prior vaccination and not tested post vaccination. On 19Mar2021, the patient had drop in blood pressure and heart rate, tunnel vision, dizzy, and nauseous. The patient did not receive any treatment for the events. The patient recovered from the events in Mar2021. No follow-up attempts are possible. No further information is expected.

Vaccine itself does not appear to have any correlation to the event, but given that patient was transferred to a higher level of care, will submit a VAERS report.

25 2021-04-15 loss of consciousness, fainting At 1455 client had a vasovagal syncopal reaction following 1st dose of Pfizer vaccine. Client state... Read more
Close
At 1455 client had a vasovagal syncopal reaction following 1st dose of Pfizer vaccine. Client stated he had a history of syncope and anxiety with injections and blood draws. No injuries were sustained and client regained consciousness with sternal rub and verbal prompts. Client was unconscious for less than 20 seconds. Vital signs were obtained and were within normal limits. Client denied shortness of breath, headache, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, dizziness or blurry vision. Client's pupils were PERRLA. Client complained of feeling stiffness and cramping in hands and arms. Paramedic was able to flex hands and arms without resistance, capillary refill was less than 2 seconds. Client offered 911 evaluation and declined three times. Client left via wheelchair and released to care of significant other following a 60 minute observation time and stated resolution of symptoms.

25 2021-04-17 loss of consciousness, fainting syncope, lightheaded, fainting, dizziness
25 2021-04-17 loss of consciousness Client received their vaccine in the vaccination room. Client ambulated independently to the observa... Read more
Close
Client received their vaccine in the vaccination room. Client ambulated independently to the observation room. Observation staff approached client and greeted them. Observation staff seated client and instructed them to notify staff if they are experiencing any symptoms. Client began to feel faint and lost consciousness before they could alert staff. Client fell forward resulting in a contusion and abrasion on their forehead and nose. EMS and Safety officer notified via radio. EMS arrived to the scene and placed client in supine position. Client regained consciousness. EMS began assessment. Vitals taken 1st BP: 98/45 Safety officer arrived to the scene. Client transferred to wheelchair and taken to EMS area. Vitals taken 2nd BP: 103/56 Client refused to be transferred to hospital. Client completed observation time in EMS area. Client able to ambulate independently to exit. Client transported home by friend. Time course, approximately 1 hour from start to finish.
25 2021-04-18 loss of consciousness 10:48am Passed out, sweating and urinated. No reaction at site.

Close
Vasovagal response. Sweaty, light headed, hearing changes, change in vision. Felt back to baseline within 20 mins. Had patient lie down, hydrate with water, gave a sucker. elevated legs, cold cloth to forehead. Continuous monitoring.

Patient was conversing with EMS throughout their exam. Vital signs were WNL. EMS recommended that the patient stay an additional 15 minutes. Patient was discharged by EMS as OK to go home. No further complaints Palpitations resolved.
25 2021-04-22 loss of consciousness, pallor About 5 to 10 minutes after receiving vaccine (during observation period), patient became dizzy, lig... Read more
Close
About 5 to 10 minutes after receiving vaccine (during observation period), patient became dizzy, lightheaded and his skin was very pale and clammy. His hands were red and warm to the touch. About 3 to 5 minutes after symptoms started, he passed out for about 10 seconds, but came to on his own. EMS was called and he was checked- out by paramedics, his blood pressure and blood sugar were all within normal range. They observed him for 5 to 10 minutes after which he signed a "refusal" to be transported to ER. He stated he was feeling better and would continue to self-monitor at home with his girlfriend.

Close
AT 5:35 PM PT CAME IN FOR HIS 2ND COVID SHOT. PT STATED THAT HE GOT HIS 1ST ONE DONE WITH NO ISSUES. AT 5:45 PM WHILE PT WAS WAITING FOR HIS WAITING PERIOD TO BE OVER, HE BECAME VERY PALE, EYES DILATED, UNRESPONSIVE, AND VERY SWEATY. I ASKED FOR ONE OF MY COWORKERS TO CALL 911, WHILE I GOT THE EMERGENCY KIT OVER TO THE PTS SIDE. AFTER ABOUT 30 SECONDS TO 1 MIN, PT CAME TO, AND WE GAVE HIM WATER AND A COLD CLOTH. WE GOT HIM ON HIS BACK, AND KNEES BENT, WHILE WE WAITED FOR EMS. I TOOK HIS PULSE WHILE WAITING FOR EMS AND DID NOT NOTE ANY BRADYCARDIA OR TACHYCARDIA. EMS TOOK OVER CARE AND FINISHED EXAMINATION IN THE TRUCK. HIS GIRLFRIEND WAS WITH HIM AND SAID SHE WOULD DRIVE HIM HOME.
25 2021-04-22 pallor Patient received 1st dose Pfizer today approximately 11:20 am, requested to receive vaccine while st... Read more
Close
Patient received 1st dose Pfizer today approximately 11:20 am, requested to receive vaccine while standing. Patient reported feeling "tingling feeling in chest, arms, and face. I felt like I was seeing colors" immediately after vaccine was administered. As per MD, patient was unresponsive for 5 seconds, noted to be very pale. Assisted from standing to sitting position. Initial B/P 81/34, HR 56, O2 sat 100% on room air. After 5 seconds, when patient became more alert, given 1 bottle of water and 1 cup of orange juice. Emergency medical services (EMS) called. Re-checked vital signs approx. 11:30 am B/P 100/59, HR 67, O2 98%. Patient denied SOB, lightheadedness, dizziness, stated relief in tingling. EMS arrived to evaluate patient. Patient stated relief in all symptoms, patient refused to go to ER for further evaluation. Instructed patient to call 911 if any feeling of fainting, dizziness, lightheadedness, loss of consciousness, SOB, chest pain, rash should develop. Verbalized understanding, escorted by mother to home.

PT TURNED GRAYISH IN COLOR AND PASSED OUT IN CHAIR, WAS CAUGHT BY WIFE AND LOWERED TO GROUND AND PLACED ON A MAT WITH PILLOW. PT CAME TO UPON SHAKING SHOULDER. PER WIFE WHO WAS NOT PHASED AT ALL WITH PT PASSING OUT REPORTED PT HAS HISTORY OF PASSING OUT AND HAS HAD THIS HAPPEN WITHIN THE PAST 2 WKS. PT WAS NOT IN ANY DISTRESS. WAS GIVEN WATER AND FOOD. COLOR REAPPEARED AFTER A FEW MINUTES AND PT WAS FEELING BETTER 10MINUTES LATER. CONTINUED TO MONITOR PATIENT FOR 30MINS.

Close
4 days after vaccination, patient woke up with severe chest pain, radiating to L arm. Presented to ED where he was found to have elevated troponins. Cardiac cath normal. Echocardiogram normal. Cardiac MRI with evidence of Myocarditis. COVID testing at the time of chest pain NEGATIVE.
25 2021-04-27 loss of consciousness We had a patient today that passed out after his covid vaccine. It was his 2nd covid immunization. ... Read more
Close
We had a patient today that passed out after his covid vaccine. It was his 2nd covid immunization. He got his immunization at the pharmacy in the booth and then he sat down in one of the waiting chairs at the end of the cough and cold aisle. While he was sitting down, he began to feel unwell, he then got up off his chair and then was approaching the drop off window (he was going to let us know he didn't feel well) at that time he then passed out. He fell into the privacy screen of the imz booth. He did fall into the booth which did break some of his fall. He also knocked off one of the frames that we had on the wall, and then I think it fell on his nose. He did get a cut nose and he also bit his lip or mouth because his mouth was bleeding also. He reported that his nose did hurt, and he will have a prominent bruise on his nose. We did provide him with a couple of ice packs and a bottle of water. The patient (25 years old) and his mother both stated that he has passed out in the past when he has been around needles. He stated that he got to thinking about getting the shot and the needle going into his arm and that is when he started to feel unwell.
25 2021-04-27 inflammation of the heart muscle, chest pain On Wednesday April 14th I got my second vaccination shot. The following day I had a 103 F fever, bod... Read more
Close
On Wednesday April 14th I got my second vaccination shot. The following day I had a 103 F fever, body aches, chills, migraine, sore muscles, couldn't walk, excessive thirst. Those effects lasted all day and I felt better on Friday. Saturday night chest pain started along with sore arm getting worse. I took ibuprofen and melatonin to sleep. Woke up Sunday morning and pain came back and gradually got worse until I went into the ER around 9 am. They gave me Morphine to put the chest pain at bay. Then transferred me by ambulance to a different hospital with a cariology department. They treated me as if it was Myocarditis and also got an x-ray of my chest. The next morning I had an MRI and that is what confirmed it to be Myocarditis. I was then discharged with lots of medications to keep the inflammation down.

25 2021-04-27 fainting, heart rate increased The patient reported that they were experiencing tightness in their arm and believed it swelled init... Read more
Close
The patient reported that they were experiencing tightness in their arm and believed it swelled initially. They left the pharmacy area and went to get Tylenol that was recommended by the pharmacist. They then began to get lightheaded and had syncope, attempted to get back up and the cashier asked to if they wanted to sit, but fell again. It was not clear initially to the employee who was helping them they had received the vaccine. 911 was called and the employee helping them let the pharmacist know they had just gotten their vaccine. The immunizing pharmacist went to check on the patient. EMTs were already helping the patient and had taken his blood pressure which was normal the lightheadedness had stopped and both sitting and standing blood pressure was the same. He had an elevated heart rate per the patient but didn't know any of the numbers the EMTs had taken. His father was driving him. He was not experiencing any symptoms and the injection site had no swelling and was otherwise unremarkable.

Was helped to lay down in a supine position with legs eleveted. At 10:56 vitals were 140/90, 83, 20, 99%RA. Cold ice pack was applied at the back of his neck. 25 2021-04-29 pallor, loss of consciousness Client received first dose of vaccine @2:52pm. At 3:16pm client alerted EMT he was not feeling wel... Read more
Close
Client received first dose of vaccine @2:52pm. At 3:16pm client alerted EMT he was not feeling well, stated he "felt like he was shutting down". Client lost consciousness while EMTs supported him upright in chair. Client had convulsions for 5 seconds and was unconscious for approximately 20 seconds. Once client regained consciousness he was assisted to zero-gravity chair, alert and oriented. Client was pale and diaphoretic, no trouble breathing, able to talk and answer questions. Client denies having any seizure activity in past, denies medical conditions, not taking medication, no allergies. EMS was called by lead RN @ 3:30pm, arrived on scene @ 3:40pm. EMS completed assessment, made client aware everything appeared normal, offered to take patient to hospital, client declined. Client made aware to follow up with his primary care and when to call 911. Client's girlfriend and family present, client able to walk out with steady gait. Client left @ 3:50pm.

25 2021-05-01 pallor Reports that as the needle was going into his arm he started feeling light headed and nauseous. He r... Read more
Close
Reports that as the needle was going into his arm he started feeling light headed and nauseous. He reports that he doesn't do well with vaccinations. He believes that he started feeling this way before the vaccine was even completely administered. He looked pale. We had him sit on the ground and he ended up drinking water and resting for well over 30 minutes so we could observe him. At no point did he have trouble breathing or swallowing. We had him stand up for several minutes to make sure not dizzy before he left. He refused a ride home, ambulance and said did not need to get ride home. Said he felt completely back to normal before leaving.

Patient described experiencing dizziness. He was accompanied by partner, who was holding him closely. He then fainted, which was followed by a seizure lasting between 15-30 seconds. He did not collapse to the floor, as his partner let him down on the floor slowly. Patient then regained consciousness, and sat down while waiting for EMS. He continued to experience dizziness for the following 20 minutes. He was then transported by EMS to the hospital

Close
25-year-old male with a history of exercise-induced asthma who presents with headache, myalgias, nausea, vomiting as well as sudden onset chest pain with diarrhea in the setting of recent Covid-19 vaccination. He was found to have diffuse ST elevations and PR depressions on EKG with downtrending troponins from 0.15 ng/mL and admitted for myopericarditis.

25 2021-05-04 fast heart rate Pt received vaccine and within minutes of receiving the vaccine, pt stated that he had dizziness and... Read more
Close
Pt received vaccine and within minutes of receiving the vaccine, pt stated that he had dizziness and felt light headed. Neuro assessment was performed by reporting nurse and neuro assessment WNL. Pt started hyper ventilating and pt was advised to slow down his breathing. Pt continued to complain of feeling dizzy and lightheaded. Pt had bilateral feet elevated on a chair and bilateral arms raised. Site was called to the patient and they assessed the patient. Pt was laid down on the floor and bilateral feet elevated. Pt had a 12 lead ECG performed showed 60 with a run of SVT with rate of 182. Pt had VS taken initally 80/40, 62, 24. continued treating patient, FSBS was 79. Pt was advised to go to the ER for further assessment and treatment. provided O2 2L via , 12 lead ECG monitoring, IV access to right AC, 20g secured with opsite, 0.9% NS bolus of 200ml. Pt was transported. Ship staff aware of incident and will f/u with patient status.

25 2021-05-05 fainting Pt felt dizzy, had vasovagal syncope, hit head on metal stanchion and then the ground.
25 2021-05-05 fainting 25yo male patient fainted about 5min after receiving the vaccine while sitting in an observation cha... Read more
Close
25yo male patient fainted about 5min after receiving the vaccine while sitting in an observation chair. He fell to the side off his chair and hit head on the concrete floor, with his body still on the chair. Patient had convulsion-like movements. It was unclear if it was seizure-type activity or if his body was struggling to sit up from the supine position laying on the chair. Patient was attended to immediately by pharmacist - he responded immediately to my talking to him and touching his shoulders. Patient was guided to an upright seated position, then helped to floor and asked to lie on floor with legs elevated. 911 was called and Seattle Fire Dept arrived about 5min later. Patient was fully aware of surroundings, his name, etc. Evaluated him and took multiple blood pressure readings with him laying on floor and eventually sitting up. His pressure was initially low but recovered to normal over 15-30 minutes. Ambulance was called but patient declined as his parents were on their way. Patient's blood pressure recovered to normal and he was able to sit and stand, was fully conversational throughout the episode. Patient left building of his own accord with his family to seek medical follow-up.
25 2021-05-07 fainting Patient fainted approximately 5 minutes after receiving 2nd dose of Pfizer vaccine. Vaccine adminste... Read more
Close
Patient fainted approximately 5 minutes after receiving 2nd dose of Pfizer vaccine. Vaccine adminstered at approximately 12:20pm. Witnesses reported patient fell to floor and hit his head. This writer assessed patient after fainting. Patient was diaphoretic but oriented. Patient was given water and advised to sit on the floor for a few minutes. Patient then transferred to a chair where is sat for an extra 20 minutes. No EMS activated. Patient reported feeling better after sitting. Patient reported that he was with his significant other. Advised patient to have significant other drive him home.

Shortly after receiving vaccine, patient complained of being light headed and not feeling well. After a few minutes, patient decided to sit on floor where he started to say that his arms were locked up and chest tight. Patient continued to talk to pharmacist. EMS was notified and pharmacist stayed with patient. Once EMT were on the scene, the EMTS started interview the patient more and patient allowed vitals to be taken (where as the patient was hesitate with rph doing BP). During interview, it was discussed the patient in the past has had panic attack. However, not this severe of locked arms /seized muscles. EMTs eventually let patient leave on his own accord

Client sitting post vaccine approx. 5 min. after, and looked to have a vagal vagus response. Fell side ways in chair- was unconscious for approx 10-15 sec. No injury. Came to Alert and oriented x 3 no memory of passing out. Did state he felt a flushing feeling and ears get muffled. 911 called by co worker. B/P stable @ 05:12 -96/42 HR 64 done by reporter. EMS arrived approx. 17:25- client awake and speaking. B/P by EMS- 120/80, HR 61, sats 99%. Client refused further treatment at hospital. Stayed another 1/2 hour and was picked up pt parents. Client walked out of site without further incident. Spoke to client next day stated he felt fine. Encouraged him to speak to PMD before next vaccine.
25 2021-05-10 fainting Vaccine administered to pt at 2:12pm on 5/11/21. Pt was recommended to wait in waiting area for 15 ... Read more
Close
Vaccine administered to pt at 2:12pm on 5/11/21. Pt was recommended to wait in waiting area for 15 minutes post injection. After approximately 5 minutes, he stood up and walked near the counter reporting he was feeling dizzy. As the pharmacist was recommending him to sit down rather than stand and was attempting to assist him to his chair, he fainted. RPh and technician reached to hold him and help break his fall. The pt fell to the ground mainly falling on his buttocks and then to his back. After approx. 20-30 seconds, the pt awoke and sat up on his own. He then stated he was feeling better and drank some water. About 3-5 minutes later, he was able to get back to his chair where he sat coherent for another 30-40 minutes. After being assessed by paramedic/fire chief, it was recommended he go to the hospital to be further assessed. He left walking away with paramedics.

Pt stated that he wanted to check his blood pressure because he felt like it was high. Pt had no medical hx. Pt?s vitals were obtained. All were within normal limits excluding blood pressure, which was slightly elevated. Pt refused medical care and transport. Pt was advised to call 911 if symptoms worsened. Pt signed AMA paperwork. Pt stated that he felt much better and was comfortable walking to his car with his family.

Close
I've gotten heart palpitations for several years. They are pretty minor, but for two days after getting the second dose of the Pfizer vaccine they got much stronger and more regular. After about a week they settled back to baseline, but I'm currently using a Holter monitor to check my heart.

Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Mild, Additional Details: Patient received first dose of COVID-19 vaccine. Afterwards he passed out to the gound. He came to, and was seated. 911 was called and emergency response came. Patient was evaluated and he said he was ok. EMT's left and patient remained for more observation. After some time, patient became ashen faced again and 911 was called again. This time patient left with emergency services. The EMT's said it was not an allergic reaction. Patient stated a severe fear of needles/previous reaction.
25 2021-05-20 chest discomfort Pt reported an anaphylactic history to bee stings with his last reaction being in 2017 during his sc... Read more
Close
Pt reported an anaphylactic history to bee stings with his last reaction being in 2017 during his screening. Pt was instructed to wait an additional 30 minutes following his vaccination. Pt was given his vaccine at 1134. Pt reported a sensation of "tongue swelling and chest tightness" at 1139. Pt reported it felt like his past anaphylactic reaction. Pt voice sounded muffled, tongue appeared swollen. Pt self administered 1 adult Epi Pen at 1139 with x1 RN and x1 medic supervision. VS were taken. HR was 107, BP was 137/92, SpO2 was 97%. Lung sounds were clear in the apices and diminished in the bases bilaterally. Periorbital swelling was noted at 1140. 911 was called and an ambulance was dispatched at this time. The pt denied a feeling of nausea, denied dizziness. Pt was alert and oriented x4/4 for the entirety of observation. VS were taken again at 1144. The HR was 97, BP was 131/85, SpO2 was 97%. Last reported oral intake of a "bagel and coffee at 0800". VS taken again at 1147, HR 101, BP 135/86, SpO2 98%. Pt reported a continued feeling of throat tightness, periorbital swelling was increasing. Ambulance arrived at 1154 and was given full report. Paramedic assumed care at 1155. Paramedic team deemed it safe to administer one more dose of epinephrine and transport patient via ambulance to ER.
25 2021-05-20 heart rate irregular Ever since I got the Pfizer COVID19 vaccine, there's been something wrong with my heartbeat. It feel... Read more
Close
Ever since I got the Pfizer COVID19 vaccine, there's been something wrong with my heartbeat. It feels stronger, to the point where it keeps me up at night sometimes. At first it was subtle, and I thought it could have been indigestion (I have IBS which sometimes causes gastrointestinal distress), or anxiety. However, both of those conditions have been with me for many years, and this particular event began precisely when I got my first dose of the COVID19 vaccine - that night. The first time, it went away after a few days, but after my second dose, it came back (again, the same night the vaccine was administered) and hasn't gone away since. It's still subtle enough that I don't notice it during the day, but it's there quite clearly every single night now. I'm getting used to it, and it doesn't seem to be causing any other health problems or adverse effects, but something has definitely changed.

Close
Patient fainted and fell on the floor and hit his head approximately 3 minutes after he received his covid vaccine. Patient stated he was feeling dizzy and nauseous.
25 2021-05-22 chest pain Extreme headache shortly after, treated with water and Advil, no big deal. Woke up in the middle of... Read more
Close
Extreme headache shortly after, treated with water and Advil, no big deal. Woke up in the middle of the night with a horrible fever, headache, rash, and chest pains. Treated with nothing, and it eventually went away this morning, considered going to hospital.
25 2021-05-22 heart rate irregular, chest pain Beginning on the evening of Monday, May 10th, I began to feel a dull soreness in my chest, directly ... Read more
Close
Beginning on the evening of Monday, May 10th, I began to feel a dull soreness in my chest, directly over the heart. I took an antacid believing it may be heartburn, but symptoms did not resolve. I scheduled a doctor's appointment for the next day as I felt something was definitely "off". The next afternoon I walked about 30 minutes to the clinic throughout relatively hilly terrain and did notice that I seemed a bit more tired than usual and felt my heart was working a bit harder, but it was hard to tell if it was just mental anxiety about the whole thing. I met with Dr. and an EKG was performed. The results indicated possible LAE and possible RV conduction delay. Both him and a colleague didn't see much reason for concern, however. I scheduled an upcoming video visit with a cardiologist. The feeling continued, varying in intensity for the next week. On Wednesday, May 19th (2wks post 2nd dose, 9 days post symptom onset), I returned home from a motorcycle ride (something I mention as it often results in stress?still learning) and walked up to my third floor apartment. I noticed I was particularly stressed from the climb and my heart felt like it was working harder than usual, and consequently I felt the strongest pain since the initial onset. That pain lasted for a few hours until subsiding somewhat that evening, but was consistently present. The following day the pain had reduced significantly. It is now May 22nd and it's felt mostly normal all day, but is still definitely there. Feels worse when I get anxious or stressed. Heart rate as measured by my Apple Watch appears consistently normal aside from aforementioned stress or anxiety.

25 2021-05-26 chest discomfort Pt reported an anaphylactic history to bee stings with his last reaction being in 2017 during his sc... Read more
Close
Pt reported an anaphylactic history to bee stings with his last reaction being in 2017 during his screening. Pt was instructed to wait an additional 30 minutes following his vaccination. Pt was given his vaccine at 1134. Pt reported a sensation of "tongue swelling and chest tightness" at 1139. Pt reported it felt like his past anaphylactic reaction. Pt voice sounded muffled, tongue appeared swollen. Pt self administered 1 adult Epi Pen at 1139 with x1 RN and x1 medic supervision. VS were taken. HR was 107, BP was 137/92, SpO2 was 97%. Lung sounds were clear in the apices and diminished in the bases bilaterally. Periorbital swelling was noted at 1140. 911 was called and an ambulance was dispatched at this time. The pt denied a feeling of nausea, denied dizziness. Pt was alert and oriented x4/4 for the entirety of observation. VS were taken again at 1144. The HR was 97, BP was 131/85, SpO2 was 97%. Last reported oral intake of a "bagel and coffee at 0800". VS taken again at 1147, HR 101, BP 135/86, SpO2 98%. Pt reported a continued feeling of throat tightness, periorbital swelling was increasing. Ambulance arrived at 1154 and was given full report. Paramedic assumed care at 1155. Paramedic team deemed it safe to administer one more dose of epinephrine and transport patient via ambulance to ER. In ER, patient endorses mild chest tightness but denies any shortness of breath, oral pharyngeal edema, difficulty swallowing, wheezing, abdominal discomfort, nausea or vomiting, pruritus, or hives. He was given Benadryl, methylprednisolone, and famotidine while in the emergency department to finish the allergic reaction cocktail. He was observed for a total of 3 hours after his last epi injection and he remained HDS and asymptomatic. He was given a prescription for EpiPen autoinjectors with multiple refills. Patient was advised that he should not receive his second covered vaccination without discussing with his PCM. He was given strict return precautions and patient felt comfortable being discharged home.

After 2 minutes of vaccination, patient passed out and had an absent seizure. However, it lasted about 1 to 2 minutes, he was able to wake up by himself.

25 2021-05-30 inflammation of the heart muscle, palpitations -- Myocarditis, i.e. inflammation of the heart myuscle and area surrounding the heart -- Inflammatio... Read more
Close
-- Myocarditis, i.e. inflammation of the heart myuscle and area surrounding the heart -- Inflammation/pressure around my ears/head, leading to headaches/dizziness/disorientation I have confirmed this with both my primary care doctor and my cardiologist. It has been 3 weeks and I am not feeling better at all. I have a pounding heartbeat, and a pounding headache. At this point the vaccine has been worse than the disease itself. I hope you stop misleading the public and communicate that myocarditis and severe inflammation IS 100% A SIDE EFFECT THAT IS CAUSED BY THE VACCINE RESPONSE. I know because I am experiencing it, and you've ruined the last 24 days of my life. Thank you.
25 2021-05-31 palpitations, chest discomfort, troponin increased, heart attack, chest pain Pt is a 25M with PMH of GERD, ADHD, obesity who presented to the ED on 5/11 for chest pain. That mor... Read more
Close
Pt is a 25M with PMH of GERD, ADHD, obesity who presented to the ED on 5/11 for chest pain. That morning he had noticed increased substernal chest pressure associated with palpitations, nausea, diaphoresis, and left arm tingling. He notes that early last year he was very sick and though he had COVID but confirmatory testing was not available at that time. After recovering from the illness he noted that he had occasionally episodes of chest pressure and palpitations. However yesterday was the worst his symptoms have ever been. He did receive his 2nd COVID vaccine this past Saturday and experienced fatigue, nausea, weakness. In the ED patient has HD stable, afebrile, saturating well on RA. Labs were notable for troponin of 5.2 which trend down to 3.1. ESR WNL, CRP elevated 2.4. EKG showed normal sinus rhythm with signs suggestive of possible pericarditis. CXR negative. CTA showed no pulmonary embolism, enlarged and prominent left axillary lymph nodes, nonspecific, cholelithiasis. Patient admitted for NSTEMI. Enlarged axillary lymph nodes likely reactive in the setting of recent COVID vaccine. Cardiology consulted. Patient underwent cardiac cath which was unremarkable. Cardiology recommends short course NSAIDs for possible pericarditis, however EKG changes unimpressive per cardiology. Discharged home on ibuprofen 400 mg TID for 5 days. Advise follow up with PCP within 1 week.

Close
Systemic: Chills-Mild, Systemic: Dizziness / Lightheadness-Medium, Systemic: Hypotension-Mild, Additional Details: 1st Dose given at 6:05 PM, lightheaded within 5 minutes. also developed chills. BP read 115/60, 5 mins later 108/67 and sat for 30 minutes. patient had improved since then and was able to leave.
25 2021-06-02 palpitations Intense shivering followed by 2 hours and continuing of a hard, pounding heartbeat that will not rel... Read more
Close
Intense shivering followed by 2 hours and continuing of a hard, pounding heartbeat that will not relax. Have been drinking plenty of water no probably not dehydration. Had a very similar weird reaction to a muscle relaxer I cannot remember the name of about a year ago. Oth instances have occurred at night. Heartbeat seema stable, just fast and so hard that I can feel it pulsing up my neck.
25 2021-06-02 troponin increased, inflammation of the heart muscle Patient developed sudden onset of fevers and malaise on 5/7/21 (26 days after his 2nd Pfizer COVID v... Read more
Close
Patient developed sudden onset of fevers and malaise on 5/7/21 (26 days after his 2nd Pfizer COVID vaccine). His symptoms progressed to involve shortness of breath which prompted his admission to our Hospital on 5/12/21. He rapidly deteriorated requiring intubation and ultimately placement on ECMO and temporary internal heart pump (Impella device) placement. He was thought to have myocarditis due to elevated troponins at the time of admission and cardiac MRI showing wide spread myocardial inflammation suggestive of myocarditis. He was treated with high dose steroids and supportive care due to the concern for cytokine storm and eventually started to show signs of improvement. He was eventually taken off ECMO, internal heart pump and ventilatory support and went home after 20 days in the hospital. However, follow up cardiac MRI revealed ongoing myocarditis, but his ejection fraction had improved.
25 2021-06-03 loss of consciousness 25 year old Male with no significant PMH presented to the vaccination clinic for his first dose of t... Read more
Close
25 year old Male with no significant PMH presented to the vaccination clinic for his first dose of the covid-19 vaccine. Patient recieved the dose at 6PM and around 6:10pm the nurse saw the Patients eyes roll back and began to shake all four extremities "jerky movements". Patient lost consciousness for about 15-30 seconds. Once Patient regained consciousness he began to say "What happened to me?". EMS was present and PA's. Patient reported that he had no symptoms prior to experiencing the seizure. Patient denies history of seizures, shortness of breath, chest pain, dizziness, blurry vision, abdominal pain, numbness/tingling, weakness and headache. Of note Patient has syncopized previously from blood draws. Patient was place on a 12 lead ekg: ekg unremarkable with no ST elevations, no inverted t waves, normal rate, intervals within normal intervals and no peaked t waves. Patients blood glucose was taken initially reading 54 and then Patient was given oral orange juice and the second blood glucose reading was 103. Patients initial vitals were HR: 62 RR:14, BP:117/82 with a SPO2: 100% on RA Second vital readings after 20mins there HR: 65 RR:15 BP:133/94 SPO2: 100% on RA. Patients physical exam revealed neurological exam within normal limits, Patient alert and oriented x4. Cranial nerves 2-12 intact, steady gait, ambulatory, normal finger to nose, no romberg, sensation intact in all fours extremities, all fours extremities reveal a strength of 5/5 and normal coordination. Patient was in no acute distress, alert and oriented. Cardiac exam: regular rate, rhythm, no rubs, murmurs, or gallops. Pulmonary: lungs clear bilaterally, no wheezing or rhonchi and airway patent. HEENT: Pupils equal round and reactive to light, EOM intact, airway patent, moist mucosa, no tongue lacerations, uvula mid-line. Patient was transported to the hospital via ambulance by Paramedic and EMT. Patients Mother was informed of what occurred at the vaccination site and was informed that her son was being transported to the hospital given Patients first seizure and no history of seizures.

25 2021-06-11 chest pain Woke up in the middle of the night with sharp chest pain. Went to the ER and was diagnosed with cost... Read more
Close
Woke up in the middle of the night with sharp chest pain. Went to the ER and was diagnosed with costochondritis. I recovered within a few days just medicating with advil and tylenol. I am reporting this incident because I have seen reports from the CDC about cases of myocondritis occuring after vaccination, and symptoms very similar to what I experienced. https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/safety/myocarditis.html

Patient then started reporting chest heaviness and loss of hearing. EMS was contacted. Patient refused care by EMS and transport to ED. Patient left the vaccine clinic on his own.

Event occurred minutes after the vaccine was given.

getting good sleep, but he's absolutely exhausted all day; feeling absolutely terrible; under his left armpit, there's a bump and it's super sore; his whole armpit and chest area has been sore out of no where for a few days; his whole armpit and chest area has been sore out of no where for a few days; This is a spontaneous report from a contactable consumer (Patient). A 25-year-old male patient received second dose of BNT162B2 (PFIZER-BIONTECH COVID-19 VACCINE, formulation: solution for injection, Lot number was not reported), via an unspecified route of administration on 07Jun2021 (at the age of 25-years-old) as, single dose for COVID-19 immunisation. Patient stated that under his left armpit, there was a bump and its super sore and his whole armpit and chest area has been sore out of nowhere and its been for a few days. It was reported that the patient got his second dose of the Pfizer vaccine this Monday, it's now Thursday morning and he is honestly just feeling absolutely terrible and he just wants to make sure this was normal. Patient stated that he has other symptoms he is getting concerned about at this point, it's been a few days since he started having them. Patient stated that he honestly feels terrible, he cannot physically do anything. Patient stated that he was actually going to a doctor's appointment in 15 minutes and stated he will call back at a later time, he just wanted to know if what he was feeling was normal or if he needs to seek further medical advice and confirms it was the Pfizer Covid vaccine that he was speaking of and received. The outcome of the events was reported as unknown Information about lot/batch number has been requested.

25 2021-06-17 inflammation of the pericardium, chest pain Acute pleuro-pericarditis, take naproxen and cochicine, still recovering This was my first dose. Too... Read more
Close
Acute pleuro-pericarditis, take naproxen and cochicine, still recovering This was my first dose. Took vaccine on June 2, mild pain in chest on June 3, it got a bit better after a day or two. It came back on Sunday with more pain suddenly. Went for a walk and it felt better for the rest of the day and also the next day. On Wednesday is was bad, more painful than sunday, went to PCP. Thursday was the worst day, hurt to move, can't move in bed and wakes up from pain from moving or rotating in bed. Having chest pain since last week, sharp pain on the left front of chest. Pain worsens when leaning forward. Significant pleuritic pain. Started taking Naproxen and Cochicine and conditions have been much better. Still recovering with very mild pain in the same area now.

25 2021-06-23 chest pain Over a month after receiving my second dose of Pfizer, I had an episode of lightheadedness, dizzines... Read more
Close
Over a month after receiving my second dose of Pfizer, I had an episode of lightheadedness, dizziness, shakiness, and fatigue. I attributed it to dehydration and laid down and ate a snack, I began to feel better after 1-2 hours. A week later I had another lightheadedness incident that sent me back to bed (this one being slightly worse). I experience slight chest pain in my upper right chest muscle. It took me a day to recover from this spell. I constantly felt weak and as if I was about to faint. I went to the doctor two days later and got blood work done and measured my blood pressure. Everything came back normal. On Saturday June 19th, I had another near-fainting experience in a public setting. My hearing changed, I couldn't think straight, I was very shaky and weak, and I tried to drink a lot of water. Nothing helped so I went home and once I got in bed I was aggressively shaking. Since then I have been bed-ridden for the week, and unable to do normal activities such as go for walks, exercise, or go to work. I am going to visit a cardiologist tomorrow.
25 2021-06-23 loss of consciousness, pallor Client received Pfizer vaccine at 1502 without any complications/client anxiety. Client was lead to ... Read more
Close
Client received Pfizer vaccine at 1502 without any complications/client anxiety. Client was lead to lobby for CDC recommended 15 minutes of observation. At 1508, the client fell sideways in his chair but caught himself. Client reported having hazy vision for a second. Client's skin was pale and highly diaphoretic. Client then passed out for 20 seconds. Clinic RN grabbed under his armpits to hold him in chair to prevent him from falling over. Once client regained consciousness, (1510: BP 100/85, HR 60) Client was moved to the vaccination room to lie down on the floor with his feet elevated above his heart with a chair. BP taken at 1512, 110/80. Client given 4 cups cold water to drink and 3 fun sized candy bars to eat. At 1520 BP was 110/70, HR 70. Client monitored and assisted to chair. Ten minutes in chair he was allowed to try standing. Client was able to ambulate on own without assistance. Client was monitored for 45 minutes post vaccination, no obvious signs of distress, pruritus, apnea, hives/rashes, heart palpitations. Instructed to place family member on speaker phone while driving home/ leaving clinic.

25 2021-06-29 loss of consciousness The patient was given the Pfizer vaccine at 10:22 am. There were no complications with administratio... Read more
Close
The patient was given the Pfizer vaccine at 10:22 am. There were no complications with administration. The patient was then told to sit in the waiting area for 20 minutes. After about 1 minute he fell out of his chair in the waiting area and passed out. He was out for about 2 minutes until he came to. The pharmacist on duty tended to him and put a frozen water bottle on his neck. He was helped into his chair where he sat for about 5 minutes until he started to feel light headed again. At this point he went back to laying on the floor for about 15 minutes. Once he was feeling well enough again, he moved back up into the chair. After a total of 45 minutes the patient called a ride and left to return home.

25 2021-07-01 loss of consciousness Patient received first dose of Pfizer vaccine in left arm at 1128 06/29/2021. Patient stated he was ... Read more
Close
Patient received first dose of Pfizer vaccine in left arm at 1128 06/29/2021. Patient stated he was very nervous to get his vaccine when he arrived. Patient was sitting in observation when he stood up to alert someone he was dizzy. Patient started to lose consciousness while a nurse was able to catch him and lower him to the ground safely. The patient's legs were elevated and patient regained consciousness. Blood pressure taken at 1130 and was 105/55 with a HR between 46/52 BPM. The second BP was taken after the patient sat up. At that time, he was 124/64. The patient verbalized that he hadn't eaten anything that day, so staff got him apple juice and crackers which he started to eat/drink immediately. The third blood pressure was 146/68. At this time, the patient verbalized he felt safe to sit in a chair. All blood pressures taken on left arm. Patient denies any dizziness at this time. Additional vitals BP 128/81, HR 57 -- > 126/77, 59 prior to D/C. Pt stable and released from the vaccination site.

25 2021-07-07 chest discomfort, inflammation of the pericardium, chest pain 25yr old patient with no significant PMH presented to urgent care on 7/4 for left side chest pain x ... Read more
Close
25yr old patient with no significant PMH presented to urgent care on 7/4 for left side chest pain x 4-5 days. Just prior, patient had upper back pain (thought to be muscle related) which resolved and then chest tightness/pain started. Patient denied sweats, nausea, lightheadedness, dizziness, palpitations, or shortness of breath. Patient did endorse sharp stabbing pain under left breastbone while taking a deep breath which improved slightly. Patient endorsed pain improved if "laying completely flat and stretching out upper body so heart is not touching his chest wall". Patient had been taking ibuprofen 200mg daily x several days and Tums. Patient developed upper respiratory infection with cough and congestion 2-3 we Patient developed upper respiratory infection with cough and congestion 2-3 weeks ago, symptoms resolved. Self swab Covid test on 6/15 was negative. Patient endorsed receiving Pfizer vaccine (second dose 5/28/21). Unknown LOT number, sight of administration or details and date of first Pfizer vaccine administration. On 7/4, ECG noted ST elevation with multiple leads with concern for acute pericarditis. Provider noted "likely viral, related to recent URI which may have been COVID". VS normal, and chest x-ray normal. D-dimer negative (<100), cardiac panel/troponin normal (Troponin < 0.05). Patient prescribed ibuprofen 600mg TID and colchicine 0.6mg daily x 14 days (# 551151809). Cardiology referral pending EKG formal read. Patient returned to urgent care on 7/7 for follow up with resolution of symptoms. EKG still noted ST elevation in multiple leads but had improved from prior. Repeat labs deferred (as patient self pay). Patient placed on 3 week taper for ibuprofen and instructed to continue colchicine until completed (2 weeks). Provider noted while standard 3 month colchicine course typical for acute pericarditis, normal labs and mild symptoms supported discontinuing med early.

This made me loose my appetite to eat for several days. On two instances, i went to the emergency room. I've been following up with my doctor about this issue. The discomfort will happen every several days. Before getting the vaccine I had none of the symptoms.
